loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en:
Fikrat is 46 years old. He has been married for 18 years already. His family is from Fuzuli city and now lives in Boyuk Bahmanli village in the Fuzuli region. For 20 years Fikrat’s family has been displaced from their native Fuzuli city.  Fikrat’s wife is a housewife. He has two childen; his eldest son is in tenth grade, and his 14-year-old daughter is in tenth grade. 

Fikrat is a taxi driver, he transports passengers in Fuzuli. Today he wants to expand his business, therefore he has requested a loan of 500 AZN to repair the interior of his car. He is thankful to Kiva for the help. In the future, Fikrat wants to buy new wheels for his car.

loans.use: to repair the interior of his car

loans.name: Gundelina

texts.en:
Gundelina is a hard working mother from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with 2 children aged 17 and 18 years old. She engages in selling personal products like beauty kits, ready to wear clothing, and house hold wares. Aside from that, she also raises hogs, to increase her earnings. Her business started almost 3 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and ready to wear clothing, to be able to sell her pigs on time while also fulfilling her customers' needs. This loan will also help her purchase food for the family and to continue sending her children to school. In the future, Gundelina would like to improve both of her businesses to establish a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and ready to wear clothing.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Nida has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell.

Nida has been in this business for two years now.

Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Porferia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling firewood in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from a general store. Porferia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Porferia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from growing vegetables.  Arlene is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  has been helping her husband working on their farm and selling snacks in their village to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loans with the income she generated by purchasing raw ingredients for preparing snacks.  She has a retail grocery store that serves several customers and allows her to earn extra income.

Grace has many years of experience in this field. She works hard to provide for the needs of the family and her children's education. Grace requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

The story of Grace  and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC's economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married now and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with seven children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more like rice, diapers, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, facial wash, and other items to sell. 

Teresita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more like rice, diapers, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, facial wash, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is 61 years old and single.  

Wilhelmina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional snack foods, beers, sanitary napkins, candies, shampoo, and other groceries to sell. 

Wilhelmina has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Wilhelmina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snack foods, beers, sanitary napkins, candies, shampoo, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is 40 years old, married, and lives with his family. He has a bakery serving bread and pastries in their community to generate income for his family. Marte has been in this business for four years. He works hard every day to provide income for the family.

Marte requested this loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare bread and pastries to sell. He dreams of developing his business and expanding it to increase employment in his community to help improve the lives of others. Most of all, his dreams of improving his community's living conditions. Marte and his wife also want to give their child a better education in the near future.

The story of Marte and his business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare bread and pastries to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a tea farmer in Nyakabingo in Rwenjere Sub County in Buwheju where his tea shamba is situated. He is a married man and a father of two children ages seven and three; and he is determined to see the children grow into good and responsible people. In addition to tea growing he also has a pineapple garden and he sells the pineapples harvested from his garden. He started farming in 2009 and he had hopes of getting money from the family so he could use it to cater for his family. He hopes to use the loan money amounting to ugx.1,200,000 shillings only to buy fertilizers to boost the soil fertility so that he can harvest much more than he harvests presently. His clients are tea traders in the same area where he operates from and he believes that with their continuous support, he will grow the business. He is faced with a challenge of completion but he believes that it will be a challenge no more if he applies fertilizers since he will then have better tea as opposed to the tea supplied by other farmers. Robert hopes to remain the hard working man he has always been so that he gets enough money to pay back the loan and to sustain his family

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Ramathan Group

texts.en:
Ramathan is a group consists of three women, living in Aden, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB.  Susan is a 46 years old married woman with five children, living with them in miserable conditions.  Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest one is 11 years old.  She is the leader of the group.  Susan studied until secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies.  Now, she is a door to a door sales person. 

Susan works very hard to improve the living standards of her family.  She started up a small business for the past five years by selling some women's clothes in her area.  She started that business with a small amount of capital, but that was not enough to develop it.  In time, she applied for a loan from AMB to purchase more women's clothes.  Now, she earns good profits, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family.  After she finished the first loan from AMB, Susan applied for anther loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to develop her business. 

Susan looks forward to providing her family with a better future and further developing her business.  She is thankful for anyone who helps her in developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase women clothes to resell it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new laptops for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 27 year old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen.  He is a university graduate, but due to hard conditions in the country, he couldn't find a job in order to help his family with the expenses of the house.  Now, he is unemployed, but he didn't surrender to his hard conditions.  He lives with his family in a very old house, which needs to a renovation. 

For this reason, Adnan applied for a Youth loan of 100,000 YER from Al- Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and wood to renovate his house.  Adnan looks forward to building the second floor and renting the first floor.  His dream is to open a savings account in AMB.  Also, he hopes to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials  to renovate the house

loans.name: Delen

texts.en:
Delen  is 32 years old, married and lives with her family.  She has a farm that she and her husband has developed for many years.  Rice farming is the main source of income for the family and also in their community.

Delen is now earning income with her rice production business while her husband works abroad in order to improve their standard of living.  Delen requested this  loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the rice production.  She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to make her husband proud of her.  She wants to give her child a better education in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for the rice production

location.town: Gulayon, Dipolog  City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma’s goal in life is to improve her sari-sari store business. She wants to continue operating her business to supplement her husband's source of income so they can generate additional income. 

Gemma is 47 years old, married and has one child who is taking up college level of education. 

While managing her retailing business, Gemma’s husband is also engaged in buying and selling hogs to butcher and sell the meat. 

With her desire to achieve her goal quickly, Gemma is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy grocery items to sell. 

She believes that by borrowing the loan, it will help her achieving her goal.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Dolly Grace

texts.en:
Dolly Grace is married with two children, and operates a buy and sell business. Her husband works abroad to earn a living. 

She has been buying and selling firewood in their village for two years; it helps a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She has sustained her business, and was able to save her income. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional firewood to sell. 

In the future, Dolly Grace wants to build a new house where her family can live comfortably, and to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy additional fire wood to sell

loans.name: Sokvicheka

texts.en:
Sokvicheka (in the photo), age 24, is single and lives with her parents and sister in a village about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokvicheka is a third year student of her medical university in Phnom Penh. 

She asked for a loan in order to pay her school fees.

In the future, she hopes to have her own clinic.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita's greatest dream in life is providing the best way of living for her children. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time, a farmer. Margarita is engaged in a retailing business, selling grocery items along with various vegetables. 

Margarita and her husband work together, having the same goal which is to earn enough profit to sustain their children's needs in pursuing their education.

Margarita wanted to borrow a loan of P12,000 to buy drinks, biscuits, junk food, and vegetables. 

She hopes to sell more items to increase their income, as well as for their children's future.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits, junk food, and vegetables.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy , a mother of three, managed a food vending business for two years and she earns well to support her husband’s income from his work as a construction worker. She had sustained it with the support of the entire family. The couple wants to provide a better education to their children.  

She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.  

In the future, she wants to improve the business, as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, a mother of two, has managed a general store for three years.  She and her husband, who is a farmer, earn enough money to support their family. 

The couple wants to provide a better education for their children and to improve their living situation.  

Juliana is seeking a loan from GDMPC to buy grocery goods to sell in  her store.  In the future, she wants to improve her business and the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 59 years old, married and has four children. 

Nelita farms sugarcane in the Philippines.  She requests a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelita has been farming sugarcane for 30 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough money to stabilize her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vey

texts.en:
Vey, age 51, is a housing constructor.  He has been married since 1990 and has four children. One of his children is married, two attend school and another one stays at home. 

His wife sells desserts and Khmer noodles from home.  Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok are considered the national dish of Cambodia.  It can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumbers. 

Vey’s family does not have enough electricity because they use batteries.  To help increase the amount of electricity his family can use on daily basis, he decided to apply for a loan to buy a home solar system for family use.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona sells coconuts and other farm produce in the market, which she grows and acquires from neighbors to make a living. . 

Her three children attend secondary school, so Leona has to prepare for their future education. 

Leona seeks a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer for her farm.  She wants to expand and improve her farm to ensure a better source of income for her family.  

Leona hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Blanca Yised

texts.es: Blanca es una joven emprendedora, dedicada hace seis años a la venta de mercancía (ropa, implementos de belleza y cuidado personal y papelería), atiende en un local en un municipio del oriente antioqueño. Ella quiere invertir el crédito en el pago de un saldo pendiente con la entidad y en la compra de más mercancía para su negocio, con lo que podrá adquirir descuentos y por lo tanto mayor rentabilidad. Su sueño es ampliar el almacén y ganar reconocimiento en el sector.
texts.en: Blanca is a young entrepreneur. For six years she has worked selling merchandise (clothes, beauty and personal care tools and paper goods). She works at a locale in a town in Eastern Antioquia. She wants to invest the loan in paying off a current balance with the agency and in buying more merchandise for her business. This way, she can acquire discounts and therefore more profitability. Her dream is to expand her store and gain recognition in the area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes, beauty and personal care tools and paper goods).

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es: Andrés es un joven trabajador, quien hace ocho meses se dedica a la venta de productos de una multinacional por catálogo (implementos para el aseo personal y de vivienda, vitaminas, etc). Sus clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos de un municipio del oriente Antioqueño; quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de mercancía, con lo que podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos y mejorar el servicio. Andrés sueña con tener su propio local, en el que pueda mostrar los productos de una manera organizada, tener reconocimiento en la zona y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Andrés is a hardworking young man. For eight months, he has worked selling products from a multinational company via catalog (tools for personal and home hygiene, vitamins, etc.) His customers are family members, friends and residents of a town in Eastern Antioquia. He wants to invest the loan in buying merchandise to offer his customers a wider variety of products and better service. Andrés dreams of having his own locale where he can display his products in an organized way and to have recognition in the area and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (tools for personal and home hygiene, vitamins, etc)

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 39, is a weaver and has two sons and one daughter.  All of her children are school age. Her husband is a fisherman and also assists his wife with her waving business. 

Tha also sells fish that her husband catches, in her local village. 

Tha's problem is that she does not have access to enough electricity.  She only uses batteies; hence she decided to apply for a loan to buy a solar home system for family use.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system for family use.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 30 years old, and lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2007, and has two children, one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school and another is still young. 

Vanna is a weaver, while her husband is a driver for a company in Phnom Penh. Vanna’s husband commutes to work by driving his old motorcycle. The old motorbike does not work well and uses more gasoline. 

Vanna requested a loan in order to buy a new motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: To replace a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana es casada, con tres hijos mayores, junto con su esposo se han dedicado por 30 años al negocio donde distribuyen frutas y verduras, el cual se encuentra muy bien ubicado en  una de las principales plazas de mercado de otra ciudad, y ya es reconocido. Ana sueña con seguir brindando lo mejor a su fiel clientela y por ello solicita el dinero prestado para comprar abundante pescado para la temporada de Semana mayor que se acerca, ofreciendo a su clientela  aparte de lo que ya distribuyen, un producto rico y que se consume en abundancia en la zona, todo esto le incrementará sus ingresos y satisfará otras necesidades que sus hijos apremian, dando como resultado que la unidad y bienestar familiar sea cada día mejor.
texts.en: Ana is married and has three grown children. She and her husband having been working in their business for 30 years. They distribute fruit and vegetables and they have a good location in one if the main marketplaces in another city, and it is well known. Ana dreams of continuing to offer the best to her loyal customers and to do that she has asked for the loan to buy fish for Holy Week which is soon. This way, in addition to what they already distribute, she can offer her customers a delicious product which is widely consumed in the area. All of this will increase her income and fill other needs that her children prize, such as family unity and well being that is better every day.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of fish for Holy Week, which is soon.

loans.name: Sotheani

texts.en:
Sotheani is a weaver.  She is 29 years old and has one son and a daughter.  One of her children attends school and the other is too young for school.  Her husband is a security guard. 

Sotheani and her family don't have access to electricity and depend on a battery for power. 

Sotheani decided to apply for a loan to purchase a small solar home system.

loans.use: to purchase a small solar home system.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 52 years old and widowed. He is solely responsible for his living. Oscar raises vegetables to sell, which he has been doing since he was very young. His father taught him this work since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. 

Oscar is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.  In the future, he wants to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income, which he is sure he can achieve with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (pictured above) is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. She lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two married daughters who live separately.   

One of Yat’s son-in-laws is a security guard. He does not have transportation to get to work; he spends a lot of money for traveling costs. 

Hence Yat decided to apply for a loan to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita runs a retail store, while her husband works in the government in order to make a living. With the generated income from her business, she was able to support her family and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She always finds ways to earn an income to support her children's education. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Claber

texts.en:
Claber is a 53 year old woman from the town of Cortes,Bohol. She is married with five children.  Her youngest child is age 14 and the others are adults.

Claber is a dealer and retailer of Herbalaya liniment.  To augment her earnings,Claber is also a food vendor.  She sells peanut rolls, bread and other snack food.  She started her business about thee years ago. 

Claber is asking for a loan to buy more Herbalaya liniment and ingredients like flour,sugar, oil, vegetables, meat and spices.  She hopes to increase her sales and profits to help provide for her family's basic needs.  Her husband sells things to support their family.  

In the future, Claber hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Herbalaya liniment and ingredients like flour,sugar, oil, vegetables, meat and spices.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been selling their farm products in the market in addition to her general store. She buys rice in their village, and sells it in the market . Her husband works abroad, and it helps them earn more for their future plan of building their own home.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more farm products, especially rice, to sell. 

She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. 

Jocelyn hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy more farm products, especially rice, to sell

loans.name: Edfelyn

texts.en:
Edfelyn is 32 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Edfelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edfelyn would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mylvin

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mylvin works hard to support her family by selling fish.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from carpentry.  Mylvin seeks to borrow PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Mylvin has had nine loans from NWTF, in the past.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam has been married for 27 years and so loves his wife. He has two children and both of them are married. The family is living in the Fuzuli region, but for more than 20 years they have been IDPs (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. 

Rustam for many long years has been a taxi driver. A while ago he requested a loan of an amount of 800 AZN-Azerbaijan New Manat to buy new wheels for his car. 

Rustam says a great thanks to the Kiva organization for the support.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for his car.

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr: Mme Nanou est âgée de  58 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, et vit avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala. Elle est vendeuse de Soumbala. Elle exerce cette activité il y a  plus de 20 ans. Au Mali, le soumbala est l’un des condiments le plus important et très prisé par les femmes,  pour  cela cette  activité lui procure beaucoup de bénéfice car elle peut vendre beaucoup dans la semaine.  Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Mme a sollicité la collaboration avec  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 9 ans.   elle est à son 9ème  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter de noix de Néré, les transformer en Soumbala (Condiments)  et les vendent en  détail  à une clientèle  de femmes  au comptant.  En plus de son fonds propre, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement de son prêt, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nanou, age 58, is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in Koutiala. She sells sumbala, a business she's been running for more than 20 years.

Sumbala is one of the most important condiments in Mali, and is very much sought after by women. For this reason, her business turns a big profit, because she's able to sell a lot during the week.

To increase her working capital and expand her business, she's been working with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for the past nine years. She's seeking her ninth personal loan, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

With this loan, she intends to buy néré nuts to transform into sumbala and retail them for cash to a female clientele. In addition to her working capital, she counts on turning an average monthly profit of XOF 120'000, that she intends to use to repay the loan, provide for herself, and reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy néré nuts to make sumbala

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Nora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia works hard to support her family. Verginia is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Verginia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

Verginia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Verginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Naseem* Group

texts.en:
Naseem* is a group consisting of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Naseem is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is ten years old and the youngest one is one year and a half. She is the leader of the group. Despite her miserable conditions, she didn't surrender to her condition, but she decided to help her husband with the expenses of the family. 

Three years ago, Naseem started up her business as a door-to-door seller. She started her humble business by buying children's clothes in her area, but this business needs a lot of money in order to purchase more stylish clothes for the children and cosmetics and accessories. The money which she accumulates is not enough for that and most of what she earns goes on the expenses of her family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase children's clothes and accessories. 

Naseem looks forward to expanding her business by buying more children's clothes. Her dream is to support her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Benkan ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila (commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (brodés, légers et pagnes wax) et des condiments. Dans le but d’accroître leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Batoma  (femme  debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (brodés, légers et pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 pièces de brodés  en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Batoma compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of Benkan group are married women, and most of them live in monogamous households. They average 36 years of age and 4 children. 

They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the commune of Mandé, Kati Cercle, and got to know each other through bonds of community and through their money-earning business in Kanadjiguila.

The members of the group retail clothing, such as embroidery, lightweight garment, and "pagnes wax" (colorful African cloth). In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Batoma is the woman standing on the left in the photograph. She's a big seller of clothing (embroidery, lightweight garment, and pagnes wax). She intends to use her loan to buy 40 pieces of embroidery wholesale at the grand market.

She retails at the market and as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000, to be reinvested in her business and used to cover her household's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 40 pieces of embroidery

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida is a 32-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children aged eight, four and two. She engages in selling stoves and refills of butane gas. This is her main source of income. Her business started two years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stoves so she can respond the need of her customers and also to be able to purchase food for the family and other daily needs.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stoves.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married with three children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Thelma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 36 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ivy has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Ivy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Ivy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Naty is 52 years old and blessed with eight children. Despite being a widow, she has the determination to uplift the living status of her family. Aside from farming, she also engages in raising hogs to have an additional source of income. She aims to improve this business and make it profitable but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access a loan in the amount of PHP 27,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Sto.Domingo West, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Melfreden

texts.en:
Melfreden is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through KIVA to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Deande

texts.en:
Deande operates a general store to support her husband's income from farming. For more than six years, she has provided their daily living expenses and successfully repaid her previous loan. 

Deande requested another loan, which she will use to purchase additional grocery items so that she can expand her business. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Dympna

texts.en:
Dympna is married with two children. She helps her husband managing their own farm for a living. She has been harvesting and selling bananas for five years and she earns well to support their needs. 

To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and pay replanting costs. She had to be determined in her work as she wants to give a better education to her children. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay replanting costs.

loans.name: Maria Nena

texts.en:
Maria Nena is married with four children. She helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling rice for more than nine years and she earns well enough to support their needs. Aside from this, the couple also earns from the salary of her husband from working as a construction worker. 

To improve the farm, Maria Nena borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and cover replanting cost.  She has to be determined in her work to give adequate school allowance to her children who are students.  She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover replanting cost

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old, married and has seven children. 

Vilma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 54 years old and married with four children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support three children. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Wilma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services for iron accessories. A few days ago his welding plant become out of order due to overheating and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy new welding plant but does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Saima has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  

Saima thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for her husband's blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa, 29 years old, lives with her husband and three-year-old son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse for more than six years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband has a position of field engineer at a mining company. Their son spends the day at kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 2300 USD to purchase a car which runs on natural gas. This kind of car has the advantage of reduced fuel usage and less emission of smoke to the air. The borrower will use her car for traveling between work and home as the long distance is wasting her precious time.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a single entrepreneur who operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells snacks to earn extra income. For more than five years in running the business, she has earned well for her needs and was able to sustain the business.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Teresita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband makes iron chains by hand in his workshop. The chain is made on a hearth by hammering cut lengths of red-hot wrought iron rods into oval links, one link passing through the next to form a cable.

A few days ago, the stock of iron rods coil has come to an end; he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a fresh stock as per the requirement. Nowadays, he is unable to make any chains to sell and to generate income as well.

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new iron rods coil and could start his business again.

Naseem is the mother of three children, and it is very difficult to feed all of them in a day. Her dreams are to provide all the necessities to each of her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: to buy new iron rods coil for making iron chains.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen con 52 años, tiene dos hijos y convive con su compañero, desde hace 10 años tiene un pequeño negocio en su vivienda, en el cual vende frutas, verduras, granos, entre otros; con la experiencia adquirida y en vista de la situación económica difícil, ella sueña con tener un local independiente, más amplio y surtirlo, con el dinero del préstamo ella comprará surtido al por mayor que le genera más ganancias, de esta manera podrá ofrecer a su clientela productos de gran variedad y calidad a mejores precios, ella conseguirá en poco tiempo el ahorro para pasar a un local y las cosas para ella y toda su familia serán de gran satisfacción.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old. She has two children and lives with her partner. 

For 10 years, she has had a small business in her home in which she sells fruit, vegetables, and grains, among others. With the experience acquired and in light of the difficult economic situation, she dreams of having an independent and larger store and to supply it. 

With the loan, she will purchase supplies wholesale, which generate better profits. In this way, she will be able to offer a great variety of good quality products to her customers at better prices. She will soon obtain the savings to move to a store, and things for herself and her family will be greatly satisfactory.

loans.use: to purchase supplies wholesale, such as fruit, vegetables, and grains, among others.

loans.name: Isnani

texts.en:
Isnani lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit. Isnani is married and lives with five persons in the family home. 

Isnani joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Isnani sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $63 – $64 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She manages her own general store, which she has been doing for two years. She earns good income to support the needs of her children. 

Joanne requested a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a mother of three, manages her own general store while her husband has a transportation service to make a living. For two years in this field of business, she has earned a good income, so she is capable of supporting the needs of her children and was able to sustain this.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 60 years old and married, with one child who is in school. Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Regina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Regina has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Regina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gladys Yaneth

texts.es: Gladys,  es una mujer con proyección empresarial desde hace mucho tiempo, se ha capacitado en academias de belleza, lleva más de once años de haber iniciado con su peluquería en la casa, por el momento su sueño primordial es poder tener la capacidad de ampliar su negocio, y poder brindar empleo a otras personas, sobre todo en temporadas especiales donde se incrementa el trabajo. Gladys solicita el préstamo para hacerle mejoras al salón de belleza y brindarle a su clientela un lugar cómodo y bonito, también surtirá su stock comprando (tintes, shampoo, esmaltes, y productos de marcas reconocidas para vender directamente a las clientes, etc) con todo esta renovación y mejoras sus ingresos se aumentarán favorablemente permitiendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is a woman who has had a business plan for a long time. She has been trained in beauty academies. She began her salon in her home more than eleven years ago. At the moment, her primary dream is to be able to have the capacity to expand her business and be able to provide employment to other people, above all during special seasons when work increases.

Gladys is requesting the loan to improve the beauty salon and provide her customers with a comfortable and pretty place. She will also supply her stock purchasing dyes, shampoo, nail polishes, and products with known brands to sell directly to the customers, etc. With all of these renovations and improvements, her income will increase favorably, allowing her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her beauty salon and purchase supplies (dyes, shampoo, nail polishes, and products with known brands to sell directly to the customers, etc.).

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 30, is a housewife. She is mother of two sons and one daughter. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He deals in scrap items in his own shop. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Azra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, scrap aluminum, scrap plastic bottles, etc. for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Azra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, scrap aluminum, scrap plastic bottles etc. for scrap business.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 45, a mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. So Balqees requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling. 

Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en:
Gerelt-Od, 57 years old, lives with his wife in an old house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as a sentry at a water reserve agency since 2009. His wife is a cook and works at a restaurant. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy vacuum insulated windows for his house. His old house has damaged windows so dust and dirt come into the house. Vacuum insulated windows will not only protect against dust and dirt but preserve heat during winter. Significant heat loss leads the family to burn more coal for heating. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise wholesale (toys, pottery, clothing, etc.)

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 34 years old and married. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Nasreen also is providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business use such as clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann, a mother of three, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband working in their own farm to earn extra income. For two years in running the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain it.  Her husband manages their main source of income, which is their farm.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime, vive con su compañera, tienen dos hijos menores de edad, viven en una zona rural, desde hace muchos años trabaja en el gremio de la construcción, actualmente es maestro de obras y hace diferentes contratos entre ellos la construcción y mantenimiento de techos, tiene en su negocio un inventario de maderas, su sueño es poder ampliar su depósito de maderas y trabajar esta materia prima primordial para la actividad desempeñada, y también le distribuye a otros constructores a mejores precios y menor tiempo de entrega lo que le da la posibilidad de aumentar su clientela por estas ventajas, con el dinero adquirirá  madera al por mayor, aumentando sus ganancias, beneficio que le permite darle un nivel de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime lives with his partner. They have two children who are minors. They live in a rural area. 

For many years, he has worked in the construction profession. Currently, he is a master of construction and has different contracts, among which are roof construction and maintenance. In his business, he has an inventory of wood. 

His dream is to be able to increase his lumber yard and work this essential primary material for the activity performed. He also wishes to distribute it to other construction workers at better prices and in less time which gives him the possibility of increasing his clientele because of these advantages. With the money, he will acquire wood wholesale, increasing his profits, a benefit that will allow him to provide a higher standard of living to all of his family.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials wholesale (wood and paint).

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is the age of 36, mother of seven children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is taking a loan for her husband’s business. His business is the purchase and selling of motorbikes. Through this business, he generates income for his family.

Tahira's husband wants to buy more motorbikes to grow his business, but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy more motorbikes. Therefore, Tahira contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and presented her humble request to take a loan. In this way, her husband would be able to buy motorbikes for resale. 

Tahira seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: to support her husband's business by buying motorbikes for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Jennifer requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, vinegar, etc.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marlyn has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Marlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertiilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tasneem's Group

texts.en:
Tasneem is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring at her home. She has been providing these services for the past many years. She sews the garments in her locality; she very well knows the techniques of stitching. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has became out of order due to continuous use. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Tasneem thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos con 29 años, vive con su pareja y tienen 3 hijos, viven en zona rural, son mayordomos de una finca, siempre se ha desempeñado en todo lo relacionado a la ganadería y la agricultura, actualmente le brindaron la oportunidad de trabajar su  propio ganado bovino, sueña con tener muchos animales y comercilizarlos en varios sectores de la zona, para ello solicitó a la Corporación el crédito con el cual comprará 3 novillos de buena raza y también debe comprar alimentos y vacunas para el cuidado de los animales, con la venta de estos, busca capitalizar la inversión y seguir adquiriendo más, lo cual le permitirá disfrutar con su familia mayores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida y tranquilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carlos, 29 years old, lives with his partner and their three children. They live in a rural area and are administrators on an estate. Carlos has always worked with everything related to cattle and farming. Currently he has been offered the opportunity to work with his own cattle. He dreams of owning many animals and of marketing them in various sectors of the area. 

As a result, Carlos has requested a loan from Interactuar in order to purchase 3 young well-bred bulls. He also needs to buy feed and vaccine in order to care for the animals. With the sale of these animals, he hopes to capitalize on his investment and continue acquiring more. This will allow him and his family to enjoy a higher income and a better quality of life as well as financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase three young bulls of good breed, feed and vaccines for the animals' care.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en: Marry is 24 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last three years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular uses. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Marry has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Marry is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 40-year-old lady. All her devotions are for her husband who is earning a very low income. He provides sheltering services for under construct houses. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he is unable to get any contract for sheltering services. 

Recently, her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Yasmeen has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services. 

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders will take pity on her and support her in the form of fund raising.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, planks, timbers and nails for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Moisés Salvador

texts.es: Moisés, es un campesino, tiene 5 hijos y viven en zona rural, toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo en diversas labores como agricultor, criador de animales, actualmente su actividad es criar cerdos para la venta y distribución,  sueña con tener muchos animales y mejorar su vivienda, Moisés hizo la solicitud del crédito con el fin de invertir en compra de animales,  insumos para el cuidado y engorde de los cerdos, negocio que le representa ganancias aumentando sus ingresos con lo cual puede seguir dando a su familia la educación que necesitan y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Moisés is a farmer. He has five children and lives in a rural area. All of his life he has worked in the fields doing different jobs, such as farming and raising animals. Nowadays he works raising pigs for sale and distribution. 

Moisés dreams of owning many animals and of improving his home. He has requested a loan with the goal of purchasing animals and supplies to care for and fatten his pigs. Thus his business will have increased profits and he will be able to continue giving his family the education they need and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, a mother of two, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends snacks to earn extra income. Her husband works as a government employee.  

For ten years in running her business, she has earned well to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain it.
 
She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Delia has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elnora works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elnora is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries  for her general store business.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable and dried fish business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish and vegetables to sell for her buy and sell business.  Julie has been in this business for four years, and she earns more income from farming rice.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cerlita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying  and selling charcoal. Cerlita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now request a new loan to further build her business.

Cerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 34 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell in her herbal medicines business.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. Norma earns additional income from buying and selling veterinary products.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the means necessary to make other products (two-drawer oven, table, masher, etc)

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily wishes for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Aside from the hog raising business, Emily also has a tricycle for passenger transportation, her husband’s source of income. 

At her age of 28, Emily’s dream is to have a stall in the market and run a restaurant business for a bigger income. 

She has two children she is sending to school, and she is doing her best to fully support their education until they finish college. Through her present business, she believes that it is her stepping stone to obtain her dream

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Julie Ann has been in this business for 2 years. Julie Ann earns more income from general store.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 32 years old and has one child. Ligaya is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ligaya has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: As a married parent of thirteen children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business. Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Tayyba

texts.en:
Tayyba is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past five years; he is the only responsible person to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Tayya's husband wants to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes.

But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Tayyba has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these goods and also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Tayyba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items  such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, and other grocery products

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been doing machine embroidery at home for the past few years to support her family. Her husband is also doing same work at home but earns an insufficient income to support family, so she helps him with his tasks related to the embroidery. She sells embroidered dresses in her town. At this point,  she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Shahida has become expert in machine embroidery and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easily cope with the increasing demands. She is a mother of seven children; she hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Shahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana con 48 años, tiene dos hijos, los cuales ha sacado adelante con su trabajo, el cual lleva desempeñando desde hace 20 años como confeccionista a terceros, ha adquirido mucha experiencia en el medio y por esto sueña con tener su propio local, actualmente necesita comprar una máquina fileteadora, mercancía para dar cumplimiento a los pedidos que tiene con los proveedores, Adriana solicitó a la Corporación un crédito para invertir en la fileteadora con ésta dará oportunidad de empleo para otra personas, también le genera más ventas y como resultado muchas ganancias a nivel económico.  Su calidad de vida tendrá un cambio positivo para toda la familia.
texts.en: Adriana, who is 48 years old, has two children whom she has raised with her work. She has worked for 20 years as a third-party seamstress. She has acquired a lot of experience in this area, and because of this, she dreams of having her own shop. At this time, she needs to buy an overlock sewing machine to meet the orders that she has with the contractors. Adriana applied to the corporation for a loan to invest in the overlock machine. With this, she will give employment opportunities to others, and it will also generate more sales and as a result many earnings at an economic level. Her quality of life will have a positive change for all the family.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Riaz Bibi

texts.en:
Riaz Bibi is 47 years old, a married woman and mother of nine children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Riaz Bibi has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Riaz Bibi thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en:
Mariles is 29 years old and is married. The greatest challenge she has encountered in her life was when she lost her husband at a young age. At present, Mariles operates a store business in their village. She also sells halo-halo (a Filipino dessert) in season. 

Mariles is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy grocery items and raw ingredients for her halo-halo business. She will do her best to grow her business and be able to help her relatives. Her simple dream is having a partner in life and that she will have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and raw ingredients for her halo-halo (dessert) business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 35 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for five years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pays for laborers' salaries during the harvest period. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during the harvest period.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is 63 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, noodles, canned goods, etc. Cresencia has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, noodles, canned goods, and more.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, esta casado su esposa trabaja de jornalera en una hacienda y en los oficios del hogar José solamente logro estudiar noveno grado, él se dedica a la agricultura junto con su esposa. De él depende económicamente su esposa y su hijo pequeño. 

José tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo que realiza, ya que lo ha hecho desde muy pequeño a él le ha tocado trabajar muy duro y la única actividad económica que ha tenido es la agricultura.

El credito lo utilizara para comprar lamina y poder reparar el techo de su vivienda y otros arreglos mas para que su casa quede bien para el momento que llegue el invierno que su esposa y  su hijo tengan un lugar cálido para vivir.

El sueño de José es poder tener una buena casa para vivir con su familia y cuando su hijo llegue a ser mayor pueda tener una buena educación y ser un profesional, por eso trabaja muy duro, para que a su esposa y a su hijo no les falte nada y sabe que eso lo puede adquirir con los préstamos que CREDICAMPO le proporciona.
texts.en:
José, who is 36 years old, is married. His wife does day labor at a farm and takes care of the household tasks. José only managed to go to school through ninth grade. He works in agriculture along with his wife. His wife and their little son depend on him economically.

José has a lot of experience in the work that he does, since he has done it since he was very young. He has had to work very hard, and the only jobs that he has had have been in agriculture.

He will use the loan to buy metal sheets so that he can repair the roof of his house and make other repairs so that his house will be be in good shape for the time when winter arrives, so that his wife and son can have a warm place to live.

José's dream is to be able to have a good house to live in with his family, and when his son is older, for him to have a good education and become a professional. For this reason, he works very hard so that his wife and son don't lack for anything, and he knows that he can do this with the loans that CrediCampo provides him.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets to repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Annie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Divina requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stock such as sardines, noodles, spices, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as sardines, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 35-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Nabeela is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute together with her husband to managing the household.
