She needs various things, e.g., needles, thread, lengths of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these necessities. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above necessities and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nabeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business use, i.e , cloth, thread, needles, etc

loans.name: Lorjean

texts.en:
Lorjean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing boat materials like wood, bamboo, paint, etc for her fishing business.

Lorjean has been in this business for four years. Lorjean earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing boat materials like wood, bamboo, paint, etc

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 53-year-old housewife who lives with her husband. They have three children. By profession, Rita’s husband is a farmer. 

Rita wishes to cultivate crops on her own land, to generate more income. Having their own land and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. That is why she has taken a loan from ASKI (Kiva’s partner) to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer. Now, they want to grow rice seed in their field. She is confident that she will be able to grow her business. 

Rita dreams her children will lead a very successful life, with a good education. She is a woman with great enthusiasm and she never wants to stop fighting.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio tiene 48 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta noveno grado pues por razones económicas sus padres no le dieron continuidad a su carrera educativa , él está acompañado, tiene dos hijos que dependen de él y su esposa no tiene un trabajo fijo, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando.
Julio tiene una pequeña tienda en escuela de la comunidad, ya tiene tres años de tener su pequeño negocio ahí dado que no hay otra tienda dentro del centro educativo, la idea de negocio surgió cuando su hijo quien todavía está yendo a la escuela le comentaba que no había nada que comprar para comer, fue entonces cuando decidió hacer la propuesta a la directora de poner una tienda al servicio de los estudiantes.
Él necesita este crédito porque en su tienda  hay muchas necesidades las cuales no alcanza a cubrir  al instante, y lo invertirá en comprar productos que no tiene en su tienda  y también poder comprar algunas vitrinas que un amigo le está vendiendo a un buen precio y en buen estado
Sus sueños son, que su negocio pueda mejorar y tener todo lo necesario para que todos los alumnos puedan cubrir sus necesidades, además espera que sus dos hijos puedan llegar a ser profesionales y sabe que lo puede llegar a lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Julio is 48 years of age and managed to study only as far as the 9th grade for economic reasons -- his parents could not provide for continuity in his educational career. Julio is married and has 2 children who depend upon him. His wife does not have fixed work but his children are currently studying.

Julio has a small store in the community school. For 3 years he has operated this small business. No other store exists in this educational center. The idea of starting a business began when his son, who still attends the school, commented that there was nothing to eat for sale there. It was then that Julio decided to propose to the Director that a store should be opened to provide services for the students.

Julio will use this loan for his store, which has many needs that he can not presently provide. He will invest the money in purchasing products he lacks in his store. Also, he needs to buy some glass display cases which a friend is currently selling at a good price and in good condition.

Julio's dreams are to improve his business and have what is necessary so that all the students can satisfy their needs. In addition, he hopes that his 2 children will be able to become professionals and he is convinced that these things can be achieved with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy glass display cases and more inventory to supply his store.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 49-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building construction. In this regard her husband needs  raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income for financial support of his family. 

Nargis is applying for loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets  for shuttering work.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase a carabao, cow, or goat to sell.

Edna has been buying and selling livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a carabao (water buffalo), cow, or goat to sell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Annaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Annaliza is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fishing vending business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her family. Marisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marisa is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Marisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es: Juan es casado, vive en un municipio en las afueras de la ciudad, desde hace varios años emprendió su propio negocio de legumbrería en la cual distribuye verduras, frutas, hortalizas y otros, su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y tener un mayor surtido para brindarle a su querida clientela.  Juan pasó una solicitud de crédito el cual invertirá en la compra al por mayor de una gran variedad de productos frescos y a menor costo, lo que le permitirá aumentar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos, mejorando asi su calidad de vida y cumpliendo con sus obligaciones adquiridas.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives in a town on the outskirts of the city. Several years ago he launched his own greengrocers in which he sells vegetables, fruits, leafy greens and other items. His dream is to be able to expand his store and to have a bigger supply to provide to his beloved clientele. 

Juan is requesting a loan which he will invest in the purchase of a large variety of fresh products at whole sale at a lower cost. This will allow him to increase his clientele and thus his revenue, improving his quality of life and fulfilling his obligations.

loans.use: to purchase at wholesale a large variety of fresh products at a lower cost. (vegetables, fruits, leafy greens and others).

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family; he manufactures and sells furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business at a young age, but now he has grown old and weak as well.  

Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs more money to afford household expenses. Now, Naseem wants to buy more raw materials for her husband for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so her husband can buy raw materials for marking furniture. 

Naseem hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for his family. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Zelyn

texts.en:
Zelyn earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her place, in Getafe, Bohol. Zelyn has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

As of now, Zelyn dreams of expanding her business, but she lacks the capital to do so. Because of this, she is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap and toiletries. With this loan, Zelyn will be able to improve the variety of her stocks, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store. 

Zelyn believes that, with hard work and perseverance, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell for her business.

Elsie has been in this business for 39 years. Elsie earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Virginia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jenifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines. Jenifer has been in this business for 19 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tobacco to sell. In the future, Jenifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, coffee, milk, etc.. to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Era works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Era is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell through her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Era has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money and she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 58 años es soltero, tiene 7 hijos, están ubicados en un municipio del departamento, desde muy joven trabajó en minería y en la agricultura,  pero debido a una enfermedad, tuvo que suspender estas labores que le demandaban mucho esfuerzo, inició con otra actividad de vender productos elaborados a base de coco, y los vendía en forma ambulante, actualmente continua con este negocio. Carlos sueña poder reparar su bicicleta y comprar insumos para la elaboración del producto, su crédito lo usará para reparar su herramienta principal de trabajo, ya que por la edad no se le facilita caminar por todo el pueblo ofreciendo su producto, al tener su bicicleta en buen estado puede mejorar notablemente sus ventas y dispondrá de más dinero para seguir sustentando a su numerosa familia, todos viviendo armoniosamente y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and has 7 children. They live in a town in the department. Since he was very young, he worked in mining and in agriculture but due to an illness he had to stop these activities that demanded a lot of work. He began with another activity, selling products made out of coconut and he sold them on the street. He is currently doing this business. 

Carlos dreams of being able to repair his bicycle and purchase supplies for the product development.  He will use this loan to repair his main work tool since for his age it’s not easy to walk all over town offering his products. Having his bicycle in good condition could noticeably improve his sales and he can have more money to continue to support his big family; everyone living harmoniously and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his bicycle and purchase supplies to make his products.

loans.name: Sandra Miley

texts.es: Sandra de 27 años tiene dos hijos menores de edad, vive en un municipio en las afueras de la ciudad, para sustentar su casa y la educación de sus niños, se inició como comerciante vendiendo variedad de productos como ropa de dama, lencería, accesorios y otros. Su sueño principal es el de adquirir su casa propia y el de tener un almacén grande con mucho surtido,  solicita un préstamo a la Corporación el cual invertirá en mercancía de marca y a  la moda, para que sus clientas mayormente sus vecinos y amigos puedan encontrar artículos a buenos precios y de buena calidad, generándole de forma amplia sus ingresos económicos para darle a sus hijos una buena educación y brindar una vida de mucha calidad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Sandra, 27, has 2 young children. She lives in a town on the outskirts of the city. To support her household and her children’s education she began as a merchant selling various products such as women’s clothing, undergarments, accessories and others. Her main dream is to have her own house and to have a big store with a lot of supply. 

She is requesting a loan from the Corporation which she will invest in brand merchandise and fashion so that her clients, mainly her neighbours and friends, can find items at good prices and good quality. Broadly generating her income to give her children a good education and provide a high quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase brand merchandise and in fashion.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a hardworking retailer dealing in general merchandise in Hoima, Uganda. He is fifty-six years old. He is married with four children and gets side income from farming. His clients are residents of his area.

He dreams of building a permanent residential house for his family to live in, despite the challenge of constant price fluctuations of his products. Jimmy needs the loan facility to buy soap, sugar and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is happy, satisfied and grateful for the support she has been given. Her first loan was invested in the upkeep of her crops by buying two types of fertilizer and to pay to transport the fertilizers. It helped her care for and protect her crops, resulting in an excellent harvest. Thanks to the support provided she could assist her crops properly.

Now Alma is requesting a second loan which she will invest in the care and protection of her crops. She hopes to have greater production and in the end more profits to be able to provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for her farm business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 57 years old and married with four children. She has been farming crops for five years and earns additional income. She is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she will be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 60 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid twenty-two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending. Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling other kinds of food.  Leonida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is age 36 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children, three of whom go to school. Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and paying for the financial expenses of his house. This restaurant has been caring for her whole family for many years. 

Now, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers so that he can generate more income. Shumaila is receiving a loan for the further establishment of her husband's restaurant. He wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses (chickpeas, kidney beans, etc.), bread, butter, yogurt, etc. to increase the menu on a daily basis. She is hopeful that this loan will be the cause of getting more profit and savings as well.

Shumaila thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy food items such as chicken, beef, pulses (chickpeas, kidney beans, etc.), bread, butter and yogurt for the restaurant.

loans.name: Norelia

texts.es: Norelia tiene 24 años, vive en zona municipal, trabaja en su propio negocio, una salsamentaría que inició hace varios años, está ubicada en la plaza principal del municipio, siendo de mucha ventaja para este tipo de actividad por el flujo de visitantes en este sector. Norelia sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener un mayor surtido, hizo la solicitud del crédito con el cual comprará variedad de productos (licores, gaseosas, mecato) y tener como satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, todo con el fin de mejorar en la competencia que allí se vive, tendrá ganancias y dispondrá de mayor tiempo para realizar otras actividades que le brinden bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Norelia is 24 years old. She lives in the city. She works in her own business, a bar that she started some years ago. It is located in the main city plaza, being very advantageous for this type of business due to the flow of visitors in the area. Norelia dreams of growing her business and having a larger stock. She made the loan request with which she will buy a variety of products (liquors, sodas, snacks) to satisfy her customer tastes and needs, all with the end of improving her work. She will have profits and will have more time to do other work for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products (liquor, sodas, snacks)

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel de 77 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, està casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domèsticos; tienen 2 hijos que tienen su propio hogar , nadie màs vive con èl. Solamente depende la esposa de èl. 

El cliente trabaja con ganado de repasto, ademàs de la agricultura, se dedica a fabricar carretas, lo aprendiò de su padre (ya fallecido) y decide trabajar para tener un dinero extra para darle estudios a sus hijos. 

Ademàs de recibir ayuda econòmica de un nieto que vive en EE.UU. El ganado en el verano se mantiene en el terreno de su casa; y donde cultiva maìz està muy cerca como a 1 km. La fabricación de carretas la tiene en su casa y viaja a pie, lo apoya en estas actividades un nieto; su horario es variado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para Comprar un ternero (ganado de repasto) y pago del alquiler de un terreno para trabajar la agricultura; le ayudarà mucho porque seguira trabajando y teniendo ingresos econòmicos adicionales. Se sentira satisfecho porque con el prèstamo adquirira el terreno para trabajar. 

 Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, (lo que espera de sus hijos es que lo sigan apoyando). Las ganancias las utiliza para ir pagando el prèstamo; para salir bien con Credicampo y asi poder seguir trabajando con Credicampo, porque de esa manera seguirà confiando en èl.
texts.en:
Samuel is 77 years old and he studied up to Grade 3. He is married and has two children who have their own homes. His wife does the domestic work and is the only person who is financially dependent on him.

Samuel raises cattle and farms. He also makes carts something he learned from his father and decided to do to make extra money for the education of his children. He also gets financial aid from a grandchild who lives in the USA.

In the summer he keeps the cattle on the plot of land where his house is. The place where he grows corn is one km away. He makes the carts at his house. A grandchild helps him with these activities. His timetable varies.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a calf and pay the rent on the land he farms. This will help him a lot as he can continue to work and have additional financial income. He is happy with the loan as he can have the land he needs to work.

His dreams are to continue working to provide a higher standard of living for his family. (What he wants from his children is that they continue to support him). The profits will be used to pay off the loan to stay in the good books with Credicampo. So then he can continue to work with Credicampo as they will have confidence in him.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 39 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 54 years old and married, with four children.

Gwendolyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gwendolyn has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, who lives in Hoima, Uganda, is a thirty-four-year-old married man with two children. He is a teacher by profession, providing Primary Education. He ventured into education because his parents didn't have money to send him to a university. 

He desires to build a house, but his major challenge is low and late salary payments by the government. Christopher is acquiring a loan to buy building materials like cement and sand..

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and sand.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Joy is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear products business in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like shorts, shirts, and shoes.

Mary Joy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like shorts, shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
José, estudiò hasta 3º grado, està casado; su pareja trabaja en los oficios domèsticos y recibe un salario; sus dos hijos estàn casados  y tienen sus propios hogares y son empleados. Nadie màs vive con èl en su hogar, solamente la esposa depende de èl. 

El cliente trabajacomo jornal, ademàs tiene ganado de repasto y se dedica a trabajar la agricultura y lo hace desde hace muchos años; asì tambièn sus hijos le ayudan econòmicamente. La distancia donde trabaja està como a 2 km y viaja a pie, en la agricultura y con el ganado le ayuda su esposa. Su horario jornal es de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. 

El cliente terminarà la construcciòn de una vivienda, el prèstamo le mejorarà las condiciones  de su vivienda y por lo tanto su calidad de vida serà mejor; se siente satisfecho con el prèstamo porque podrà tener su vivenda en otras condiciones. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para su esposa y apoyar a sus hijos, aunque ya tienen sus propios hogares pero se apoyan mutuamente. El prèstamo le ayudarà porque podrà comprar de una sola vez todo el material que le hace falta. Con el trabajo de èl y el apoyo ecònomico de sus hijos pagara las cuotas de su prèstamo y siempre que Credicampo le siga prestando seguirà trabajando en àreas productivas.
texts.en:
José studied up to Grade 3. He is married and his wife works as a domestic and receives a salary. His two children are married and have their own homes and employment. No one else lives with them and only his wife is dependent on him.

José works as a day laborer. He also raises cattle and farms. He has done this for many years. His children help him economically. He lives 2 km from his fields and he walks there. His wife helps him with the cattle. He works from 6 am until 11 am.

José will finish building his house. The loan will improve the conditions of the house and thus make his quality of living better. He is satisfied with the loan as he can have a better house. José`s dreams are to continue working for his wife and to support his children as they help each other. The loan will help him as he can buy all the needed material at once. With his work and the financial support from his children he can pay the installments of his loan. As long as Credicampo continues to support him he can continue to work and be productive.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Ofelia is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She has worked in agriculture for 12 years. She plants rice and corn and uses the proceeds from selling the harvest to pay her household's expenses. She is a very responsible, decent, hardworking woman. 

Ofelia is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy supplies for the harvest such as herbicides, soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, etc, because she does not earn enough to cover the expense. She hopes to earn a higher income and more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, soil amendments, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: María Delmy

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como motorista haciendo viajes a las personas de la comunidad, tiene cinco hijos, 2 viven en casa y los otros 3 han formado sus hogares.

Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende todo lo necesario para la cocina, ya tiene cinco años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevó a iniciar este negocio por lo que decidió poner la tienda como una fuente de ingreso, la tienda está en su casa por lo que no tiene que trasladarse a otro lugar, sus dos hijas le ayudan, y trabajan en un horario de 6:00 AM a 8:00 PM. 

El préstamo será invertido en el negocio, para comprar mas productos para la venta, ya que tiene bastante demanda de la gente que vive alrededor, la mejora que tendrá, es el poderle ofrecer mayor variedad de producto a los clientes.

Los sueños que ella tiene son poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se da a conocer cada vez más, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de ampliar el negocio,  la ganancia de la tienda será invertido en el pago de la cuota, y en el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and has a third-grade education. She is married, and her husband works as a driver, making trips with the people of the community. She has five children; two of them live at home and the other three have established their own households.

She has a shop where she sells all the kitchen necessities. She has been doing this work for five years. Necessity drove her to start this business; she decided to set up a shop as a source of income. The shop is in her house, so she doesn't have to travel to another site. Her two daughters help her, and they work from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

The loan will be invested in the business. She will buy more products to sell, since she has a lot of demand from the people who live in the surrounding area. The benefit will be that she will be able to offer a better variety of products to her customers.

Her dream is to be able to always increase her sales;  with that she will have a better income and will become more and more well-known. The loan will help her to satisfy the need to expand the business. The shop's earnings will be invested in paying her loan payment and sustaining her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a member of this group. She is the age of 39. She is married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchases goats, billy goats, bull calves, heifers, etc. from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock, which is very tough for him in his old age. He is making the effort and earning money for the survival of both of them. 

Khalida's husband wants to buy billy goats to sell on Eid-ul-Azha because many people like to buy billy goats to immolate on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable, but he does not have enough savings to buy billy goats.

Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy billy goats to sell and he could earn maximum profit, so they can pass their lives with peace and calm.

Khalida is very pleased after receiving this loan and she is thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's business by buying billy goats.

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, se casó a la edad de los 18  años y tiene tres  hijos con su pareja quien se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, de momento solo la pareja de esposos vive en casa.   

Carlos trabaja como empleado de la alcaldía donde él vive, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura la cual prendió por medio de su hermano mayor. El trabajo le queda a unos 300 metros de su casa, lo cual se desplaza a pie, y lo hace en un horario de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo será invertido en la construcción de un cuarto de habitación a su casa, ya que cuando lo visitan los familiares no tiene mucho espacio que ofrecerles para poder dormir, comprará materiales de construcción, cemento, hierro, lámina etc. 

Sus sueños son mejorar poco a poco su casa, y dejarles una pequeña herencia a sus hijos, espera trabajar muy duro para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 52 years old and studied up to Grade 4. He got married when he was 18 and has 3 children who are all adults. His wife does the housework and only the two of them live in their home at the moment.

Carlos works as an employee for the municipality. Before he farmed which he learned how to do from his older brother. His work is 300 meters from his home so he walks to work. He works from 8 am until 4 pm.

The loan will be invested in the construction of a room at his house. When family comes to visit they don`t have much room and can`t offer them a place to sleep. He will buy construction materials like cement, re-bar, laminate, etc. His dream is to improve his house little by little and leave a small inheritance for his children. He plans to work hard to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy cement, re-bar and laminate to build a room on his house.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Hazel runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years, selling bread, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.  

Hazel requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es: Tiene 70 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son mayores de edad, independientes Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, se dedica a la agricultura. Con las ganancias percibidas le han permitido establecer una pulpería hace tres años, no obstante, con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos y que su negocio crezca, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos para sembrar frijoles y hortalizas. Su sueño es incrementar el área de producción de granos básicos, y que el negocio de la pulpería crezca.
texts.en: Lazaro is 70 years old. He has 5 children, 4 of them are adults and independent. For the past 20 years he has farmed. With the money he has earned he managed to open a small store 3 years ago. However with the aim of making more revenue and to expand his business he is requesting his first loan to buy inputs to plant beans and vegetables. His dream is to increase the area where he grows basic grains and expand his store.

loans.use: to buy inputs to plant beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Djalabatigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Djalabatigui  est composé de 9 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes, fruits, grains d’arachides, condiments et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de poivrons, 3 sacs de betteraves et 4 corbeilles de concombres en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Djalabatigui Group is made up of nine women who are married, mostly in monogamous households. They average 37 years of age and four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in Mandé Commune, Kati Cercle, and got to know each other through bonds of community.

The members of the group retail vegetables, fruits, peanuts, condiments, and clothes. In order to increase their working capital, they decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Awa, the woman standing on the right in the photograph, is very well renowned as a vegetable seller. She intends to use her loan to buy 3 baskets of peppers, 3 sacks of beets, and 4 baskets of cucumbers, wholesale in Bamako.

She retails in Kanadjiguila, to a clientele made up of women. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000, to be reinvested in her business.

Her goal with this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a housing land lot.

loans.use: 3 baskets of peppers, 3 sacks of beets, and 4 baskets of cucumbers

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. Ritchel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production.  Ritchel has been in this business for 10 years now..

In the future, Ritchel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Margret has a private primary school located in Hoima Uganda. She started the school in 2010 after realizing the need for a better standard school due to the poor performance of government aided Primary Schools. She gets side income from selling clothes. She desires to see her school built with permanent structures and acquiring more land for expansion, even though limited capital and high license fees affect her cash flow.
Margret is acquiring a loan to buy roofing materials, such as iron sheets, timber and nails for the school.

The photo taken shows Margret with the pupils of her school, since that is her business.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials such as iron sheets, timber and nails for the school.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is single and has two children. She is vending various kinds of vegetables in their village. Marivic always assures that her children will have enough food. She is always finding a better way of living for her children. In this regard, Marivic also engages herself in the hog raising business, primarily in hogs for breeding. Marivic admits that she is struggling to feed her hogs. In this connection, Marivic wants a loan of P5,000 to buy feed for her hog and piglets. She hopes to maintain and grow the business for a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog and piglets.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is from Liwanag village in the Isabela region. She lives there with her husband and one child. The family is in the farming business. They run a farm which includes raising cattle, calves, and chickens, as well as cultivating rice and corn. The requested loan of Php 10,000 will be a big support for this hardworking couple to make some improvements on their farm. Particularly, they plan to purchase fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sewa est composé de 2 femmes polygames et 2 monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé/cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates, poivrons, aubergines et choux), vêtements et fromages. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Magnama (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates, poivrons, aubergines et choux). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 corbeilles de poivrons, 3 sacs d’aubergines, 5 sacs de choux et 5 corbeilles de tomates en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame  Magnama espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Sewa Group is made up of four women, two polygamous and two polygamous. They average 41 years of age and five children. All live Kanadjiguila, in Mandé Commune, Kati Cercle, and got to know each other through bonds of community.

The members of the group retail condiments (tomatoes, peppers, egg plants, and cabbages), clothes, and cheese. In order to be able to pay cash for their supplies, they decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Magnama is the second woman from the right in the photograph. She's very well renowned as a condiment seller (tomatoes, peppers, egg plants, and cabbages).

She intends to use her loan to buy 2 baskets of peppers, 3 sacks of egg plants, 5 sacks of cabbages, and 5 baskets of tomatoes, wholesale in Bamako.

She retails at the the market and as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mostly women. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 85'000, to be reinvested in her business.

With this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a housing land lot.

loans.use: to buy peppers, egg plants, cabbages, and tomatoes

loans.name: Hojiakbar

texts.ru:
Тридцати трехлетний Хочиакбар занимается выпечкой в своем районе Спитамен. У него имеется большая пекарня, где он вот уже 7 лет занимается производством традиционных таджикских лепешек. Его деятельность год за годом расширяется, так как Хочиакбар целеустремленный человек и не стоит на одном месте. У него всегда много заказов, поскольку его лепешки получаются изумительно вкусными. В делах пекарни ему помогает жена и племянник. Это семейный бизнес. 
В данный момент Хочиакбар обратился за кредитом. Он планирует приобрести аппарат тестомешалки, запас муки и стеллаж. Благодаря кредиту он сможет производить и продавать больше лепешек и его бизнес будет еще успешнее.
texts.en:
Hojakbar, 33 years of age, is a baker in his region of Spitamen. He has a large bakery, where he has been baking traditional Tajik flatbread. His business keeps expanding year after year, since Hojakbar is a goal-oriented person and never stops trying. He always gets a lot of orders since his flatbreads come out delightfully tasty. His wife and nephew help him in the bakery. This is a family business. 
At present Hojakbar has applied for a loan. He is planning to buy a dough kneading machine, a supply of flour and shelving. Thanks to his loan he will be able to bake and sell more flatbreads, and his business will be even more successful.

loans.use: to buy a dough kneading machine, a supply of flour and shelving.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to pay for the rice grain and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grain and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

loans.name: María Lucía

texts.es:
María es una joven trabajadora de 19 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja le ayuda a ella en la elaboración de hamacas, tiene un hijo y nadie mas dependen de ella.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la elaboración y comercialización de hamacas de seda, negocio que aprendió gracias a sus padres que han tejido hamacas por muchos años para sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar 100 libras de hilo de seda para continuar su negocio de elaboración de hamacas, con el crédito se le ayudará a María a que pueda continuar con su trabajo y que no le falten los ingresos económicos.
Ella  sueña con mejorar su vivienda, y también planea ir aumentando poco a poco su producción de hamacas para obtener ingresos económicos que le permitan darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking young woman. She is 19 years old and in a relationship. Her partner helps her make hammocks. María has one son; she has no other dependents. 

María takes care of her home and also makes and sells silk hammocks. She learned this business thanks to her parents who wove hammocks for many years to help their family get ahead. 

María is requesting this loan with CrediCampo to buy 100 pounds of silk thread to continue her business making hammocks. With the credit, María will be able to continue her work and will not lose income.

María's dream is to improve her home. She also plans to continue increasing her hammock production little by little to obtain income that allows her to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 100 pounds of silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 49 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from buying and reselling rice.

Rocelyn has borrowed and paid back two loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested an 11,000 loan PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, spices, sardines, and biscuits to sell.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, spices, sardines, and biscuits.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is 24 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. Firuza is a sewer, which she has been doing for four years. She works in a workshop from 7 AM to 5 PM, six days in a week. She works hard to earn a living as her husband’s income is small. Little by little she is developing her business and attracting clients. 

Firuza is requesting a loan for 5,000 Somoni which she will use to organize a circumcision ceremony for her son.

loans.use: to organize a circumcision ceremony of her son

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 46 years old and married with one kid. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Rema runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Rema would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and reselling fish in the Philippines. 

She has been in this business for 22 years. Ruth earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. Ruth is borrowing 23,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en:
Nazra is 40 years old and lives with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns an auto spare parts shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market, and it is challenging for him to sell his product with his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales. 

To grow his business income and differentiate himself from the competitors, he decided to offer some additions and stylish spare parts. Nazra's husband hopes that this strategy will work positively, and the customers will be attracted by his new products. He cannot act upon his strategy without some capital, so Nazra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because BRAC Pakistan provides the tools to empower the poor. 

With the loan, her husband will be able to buy more stock of spare parts for resale. Nazra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a widow living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has earned a living through her pot making business for several years now. She also runs a sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Dioscora needs a loan for the expansion of her business, but unfortunately she lacks the financial resources to do so. Due to these circumstances, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like herself. 

She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, and toiletries and materials for pot making like clay and cement.

With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock and attract more buyers to her store. Furthermore, Dioscora will be able to make more pots which she can then sell to the market for a good price. 

In the future, Dioscora dreams of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy clay and cement, as well as additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Shela Me

texts.en:
Shela Me is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Shela Me operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years, selling a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Shela Me requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, etc., to sell.  Jocelyn has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Nely de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con un negocio el cual es una pulpería.
Doña Nely también cuenta con una moto taxi en la cual transporta pasajeros y esto es otro ingreso que ella y su esposo tienen. Doña Nely en su pulpería vende todo lo que es abarrotería y refrescos, en su negocio le visitan todas las personas que se conducen alas diferentes aldea de su localidad.
Doña Nely está muy contenta ya que con el apoyo que ha recibido y por las ganacias que ha obtenido, Ella  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito por que se acerca la temporada de verano y quiere tener artículos de la temporada como Sardinas, pescado, sombrillas, cremas para la piel entre otros .
Su sueño es que se le mejoren las ventas y tener buenos clientes que le sean puntuales. 

San Lorenzo,  Honduras Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Nely , age 38, lives with her husband and their children in their house, where she has a grocery store business.  Nely also has a moto taxi with which she transports customers.  This is another income that she and her husband have.  Nely sells all types of groceries and soft drinks in her grocery business.  All of the people that drive to the different villages in her area visit her.

Nely is very happy because of the support she has received and the earnings that she got.  This time she is requesting the loan because the summer season is approaching.  She wants to have items for the season like sardines, seafood, umbrellas, and skin creams, among others.

Her dream is that her sales increase and that she has good customers who are punctual.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March, 2014

loans.use: to buy sardines, seafood, umbrellas, and skin creams, among other items.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She is managing a hog-breeding business in their village. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice in their field. 

According to Jenny, she doesn’t have any treasure and wealth that she can give to her children but she and her husband are doing their best to give what they consider to be the best treasure, which is education. Jenny’s greatest dream is for all her children to finish their education and have a decent job. 

With regards to her business, Jenny is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for her hog and piglets. She will do her best to give the best treasure to her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog and piglets.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. Susan has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Susan requested her twentieth second loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last three years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly.  Because of that  he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sughran has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sughran is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, spices, sugar, etc. to sell.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jeneva

texts.en:
Jeneva is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. Jeneva is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Shahnoz

texts.en:
Shahnoz was born in 1979. She is a woman who always tries for the well-being of her family. She is bringing up 3 children. Shahnoz’s husband is an accountant. Her husband has a small income. 

Shahnoz is going to start her own business as she wants to improve their living conditions. She is going to organize a business selling women's clothes. She will sell women's clothes in a local market. Shahnoz will manage this business alone. 

Shahnoz is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy women's clothes for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: start a women's clothes business

loans.name: Ikmaitius

texts.en:
Ikmaitius is a 38-year-old man who is married to Novi, a 25-year-old woman. They have been blessed with 3 children:  Rangu, 5; Giandra, 2, and the last one is Putri, 1.  All of the children are not attending school yet.

Ikmaitius produces income for his family from being an ojek or motor taxi driver since 2005. Besides operating an ojek business, he had established a repair shop business to bolster his income. 

At the moment, Ikmaitius is thinking of expanding his business through selling gasoline.  His wife will take part  in managing the business. In order to realize his planning, Ikmaitius asked for a loan from TLM of IDR 3,000,000 and has spent the loan to buy gasoline.

loans.use: buy gasoline to resell

loans.name: Nova Liza

texts.en:
Nova Liza is 29 years old and is a married mother of one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nova Liza has an E-loading (mobile prepaid loading) business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more prepaid loads to sell.

Nova Liza has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: buy prepaid mobile call loads to sell

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en:
Violenda works hard to support her family. Violenda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 16 years now, and also earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Violenda requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested this new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Violenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph, a farmer who hails from the very rich highlands of Litein in South rift Kenya.  He is married and has 3 children, all of school-going age.  Farming has been his source of livelihood for the past 15 years, where his primary income source is milk, tea, and a retail business.  His biggest challenge in the farming industry is poor and low quality breeds.

Joseph chose Juhudi kilimo for this loan because they offer low favourable interest rates on their loans.  During the training, he learned how to develop his skills to suit his farming projects.T his loan will help in the construction of a dairy unit, which will give his dairy cows a better environment to produce more and this will lead to an increase in income. This will upgrade their living standards.

loans.use: construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling cosmetics and beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 23 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice. Josephine is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her repair shop business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 45 years old, married and has six children. Three of her children are in school.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Adelaida has been raising livestock for ten years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. Emily has a butcher shop in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Emily requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will user to buy more livestock for her butcher shop. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is 23 years old. She is divorced and does not any children.  Firuza lives with her mother, brothers and sister-in-laws. She is a hardworking woman.

One year ago, Firuza began her own business dealing with cooking and selling rolls. She has her own workshop where she cooks rolls.  Firuza’s mother and brothers help her with managing the business. She helps her family to improve their living condition. She dreams to become a successful business woman in the future and to find happiness. 

Firuza wants to increase her working capital and in this way to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somonis to buy flour, sugar, etc. for increasing the working capital of her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy bakery ingredients

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie, a mother of four, manages a piggery to make a living. Aside from this, her husband works on their farm, which is their main source of income. For five years, she has been earning well to support the needs of her family and has been able to sustain the business.  Her husband manages their main source of income, which is their farm.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase piglets and feed. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Martinus

texts.en:
Martinus is a 37-year-old man who is married with Rosalina, a 37-year-old woman. From their marriage they have been blessed with 5 children:  Dedi, 17 and in grade 3 of senior high school; Yosua, 12, and Darto, 10, both in elementary school; Mirasemitra, 5, in early childhood education; and the last one is Januardi, 3, who is not attending school yet.

Martinus is a meatball seller. He has been engaging in that job for 3 years. Actually he really wanted to start his own business but he has very limited capital to do so.  Therefore, he requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. That loan will help him to purchase beef, noodle, cooking ingredients, cooking equipments and a stove to start a food production business.

loans.use: start a food business

loans.name: Orhanis

texts.en:
Orhanis is a 48-year-old man who is married to Yeni, a 40-year-old woman. They are blessed with four children: Maya, 19 and in college; Nelton, 14 and in the second grade of Junior High School; Juanto, 11 and in the fourth grade of Elementary School; and Jimri, 2 years old.

Orhanis has been working as a farmer since 1994 in his village. In addition to a plant paddy, he also grows vegetables such as water spinach. The water spinach can be harvested three times each week. After it is harvested, his wife Yeni sells them to the Soe market, which is located about 30 km from their house. 

The income generated from selling the vegetables amounts to 200,000 IDR. He also plans to grow onions, which requires a better irrigation system in the field. To do this, he needs a water pump and has requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to 10,000,000 IDR. The loan will be spent on the water pump, onion seeds, and kerosene for the pump. He hopes the loan from TLM will improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump, onion seeds, and kerosene for the pump

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is 31 years old and married with two children.   She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Welyn has been raising pigs for 1 year and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Welyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestocks.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 33 years old and married with one child.   Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lorna requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, sardines, noodles and other groceries.  She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Lorna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 23 years old, married and has one child.   She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.   Maricris has been farming vegetables for 1 year now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maricris requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 32 years old and married with two children.  

Romana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Romana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  

Romana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 24 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been  farming vegetables for 5 years.

Renalyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment

loans.name: Buhara United Group

texts.en:
Charles, a member of Buhara united group, is 36 years old.  He has 3 children of school-going age.  They are living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Charles has passion for agriculture.   He owns a sugarcane plantation which he started in 2004 to sustain himself and his family.  He also has a shoe selling business, which he carries out in different seasons like Easter and Christmas to supplement the income from his main business of agriculture. He says weather is the factor affecting his business, but has a dream of expanding his business and educating his children.  

Charles needs a loan to buy shoes for selling during the Easter season.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosita is borrowing PHP 4600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.   She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Rosita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular uses. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Shamim has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shamim is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a new rickshaaw

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is 39 and lives with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband polishes newly constructed floors. He polishes concrete and marble floors. For this purpose, he uses a floor-polishing machine. He has been providing these services for many years. For the last few days, his floor-polishing machine has been out of order due to fluctuations in electricity. So, he wants to buy new machine but he does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, Haleema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy the new floor-polishing machine. In this way, he can continue his services smoothly. Haleema is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a marble polishing machine.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a father of two children, operates his own farm for a living. For many years in farming, he and his wife earn enough to provide for the family. William works on his farm and fatten cattle to sell in the future. His wife has a buy-and-sell business in addition to her household chores. 

William borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds in order to improve the farm as they have planned. It is their main source of income, so he has to ensure to gain more harvest in the near future. He wants to ensure a better home and improve the general living situation for his entire family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol, and a mother of two grown children. Floreta has been raising hogs for a living for ten years now. She is able to support the daily food consumption of her family primarily through her business. 

Floreta has worked hard and dedicated her spare time to her business.  At this time, Floreta is asking for a loan to buy animal feed, additional piglets to raise, and to pay for a pig pen. With this loan, Floreta will be able to improve the productivity of her hog raising business, thus augmenting her yield and income. Floreta dreams of expanding her business and making it a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: improve her pig business

loans.name: Zoloo

texts.en:
Zoloo is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2010.  Her husband transports goods between districts using his own truck for living. 

Zoloo is requesting a loan of 3500000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and planks for house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used for heating and less pollutants will be released. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Albinus E.

texts.en:
Albinus is a 48-year-old man who is married to Nurlina, 36 years old. They are blessed with six children:  Josin, 19, a college student; Nita, 14, a Junior High School student; Viktor, 11 (he died last week);  Angel, 9, an Elementary School student; Dede, 6, a kindergartener; and Mayang, 1 years old. 

Albinus is a civil servant. He has a monthly income that is used to cover all the family needs including the education expenses of his children except Mayang. Last week, Victor, his son, died due to an illness. Albinus spent a lot of money for the funeral ceremony. 

Recently, Albinus proposed a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 9,000,000 to be spent on Josin’s tuition fees. He was so grateful because TLM was willing to help him with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristobal tiene 62 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, su esposa anterior viajó a otro país y tiempo después lo abandonó, ahora él ha vuelto a rehacer su vida con su pareja actual, sus hijos mayores ya tienen su propia familia, con su esposa actual tiene 2 hijos que son menores y aún no estudian. 
Cristobal se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y maicillo), también trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas su esposa le ayuda y comercializa los granos en la comunidad.
Él solicita el crédito, para comprar cuatro cerdos, los cuales engordará para luego venderlos en las plazas y así obtener ingresos económicos que le permitan dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Cristobal sueña con seguir trabajando y aprender mucho mas sobre la siembra de hortalizas para así incrementar su producción y las ventas, también le gustaría apoya a sus hijos para que logren sus metas.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 62 years old and has a third grade education.  His last wife left the country and short after left him.  He has now started to remake his life with his current partner.  His older children all have their own families, and he has two young children, who are not yet in school, with his current wife.  Cristobal works growing basic grains (corn, beans, and sorghum) and planting vegetables.  His wife helps him, and he sells his grains in the community.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase four pigs that he will fatten up and later sell in the plazas, allowing him to generate income to provide his family with a better quality of life.  Cristobal dreams of continuing to work and learn a lot about growing vegetables so that he can increase his production and sales.  He would also like to support his children so they can reach their goals.

loans.use: purchase four pigs.

loans.name: Bitman

texts.es: Es un hombre humilde, trabajador y cordial, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 71 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes.  Con una experiencia de más de 5 décadas en técnicas y conocimientos para cultivar la tierra y la parte del sector primario. Posee 120 hectáreas de tierra heredadas por su padre, de las cuales 50 hectáreas son destinadas a la producción de hortalizas y granos básicos. Con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos y que su actividad productiva crezca solicita su primer financiamiento para cultivar 2 hectáreas de frijoles en colaboración con su hijo de 30 años. Su sueño es comprar ganado, para dedicarse al engorde y comercialización.
texts.en:
He is a humble, hardworking and friendly man.  He is a native of Puerto Cabezas.  He is 71 years old, married, and has five children who are adults and independent.  He has over five decades of experience in the skills and knowledge needed to cultivate the land and the primary part of the sector.  He has 120 hectares of land that he inherited from his father.  Of that land, 50 hectares are designated to producing vegetables and basic grains.

With the goal of increasing his earnings and expanding his production, he is seeking his first loan to farm two hectares of beans in partnership with his 30 year old son.  His dream is to purchase cattle to fatten up and sell.

loans.use: to farm two hectares of beans.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
