Jessie is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jessie operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jessie requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as snack foods, seasonings, and other groceries. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as snack foods, seasonings, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 75 pounds of silk thread.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre de un niño de 7 años de edad y quien está iniciando los estudios en primer grado en la escuela de la comunidad, Ana se casó hace 9 años con su esposo, y él trabaja de seguridad en la ciudad.

Ana ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo de secretaria en un negocio en la ciudad, además ha trabajado en una casa cuidando y haciendo los oficios domésticos, además cuida en casa a su hijo y se levanta temprano para prepararlo y llevarlo a la escuela.

Ella solicita este crédito, para terminar de construir un muro de contención en el terreno que compraron con su esposo, donde tiene en planes construir su vivienda. Con el crédito ella logrará uno de sus objetivos como lo es tener un lugar propio donde construir su vivienda, esto le beneficiará de mucho ya que actualmente están alquilando la casa donde vive con su familia.
Ella sueña con construir su propia casa donde vivir con su esposo y su hijo, además planea seguir apoyando a su hijo con los estudios para que logre culminar una carrera profesional en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and has a high school education.  She is the mother of a 7 year old boy who is entering the first grade in their local school.  Ana married her husband 9 years ago, and he works in security in the city.  Ana has worked as a secretary in a local business for a long time.  She has also worked as a housekeeper.  She takes care of her son at home, and she wakes up early to get him ready and take him to school.

She is seeking this loan to finish building a retaining wall on the land that she purchased with her husband, where they plan to build their home.  With the loan, she will be able to achieve one of her goals, which is to have a place of her own to build her home.  This will be very helpful as currently they are renting the house they live in.  She dreams of building her own home where she can live with her husband and son.  She also plans to continue supporting her son with his studies so that he can get a college education.

loans.use: finish building a retaining wall on the land that she purchased with her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  livestock and bringing up them in order to resale them

loans.name: Noé Esaú

texts.es:
Noé de 29 años de edad, se casó hace 5 meses en la comunidad, es padre de un niño de 7 años de edad que está en primer grado en la escuela, vivió acompañado con su actual esposa desde hace 8 años, su esposa trabaja en un negocio familiar de sastre. Noé estudió bachillerato en el instituto de la ciudad, gracias al apoyo que recibió de sus padres.

Actualmente él trabaja en la ciudad que le queda a 15 minutos de donde vive, trabaja en una tienda de productos varios, a las cinco de la mañana se va para su trabajo y regresa a su casa a las cinco de la tarde. Anteriormente él trabajaba en la construcción de viviendas con un albañil de la zona. 

Noé solicita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta, la cual le venderá alguien que vive en su comunidad.
Noé sueña en un futuro hacer una casa de bloque para darle una mejor comodidad a su esposa y a su hijo, también espera seguir trabajando para ahorrar y así ayudar a su hijo con los estudios y que se logre superar profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Noé is 29 years old, he has been married for 5 years, and he is the father of a 9-year-old son who attends the first grade.  He has lived with his wife for 8 years.  She works for a tailoring business. Noé has his bachelor's degree from the city university, thanks to the help he received from his parents.

He now works in the city, 15 minutes away from home. He works in a store that sells various products.  He works from 5 AM until 5 PM.  Previously, he worked in construction, building homes with the region's mason.

Noé is seeking a loan so that he can buy a motorcycle, which is a common purchase by the people that live in the community.

Noé dreams that in the future he will have a brick house in order to provide more comfort for his wife and their son.  He also hopes to continue working so that he can save money and help his son with the cost of his education, so that one day he can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 39-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a driller by profession. He has been providing water boring services for many years, and he is the only one responsible for managing the household.

Ghazala's husband wants to purchase different types of tools and accessories for his drilling activity but due to some financial constraints, he is unable to buy these goods to upgrade his services. Therefore, his wife Ghazala has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. In this way, she can financially assist her husband to buy relevant tools and accessories for his business purposes to provide better boring and drilling facilities.

For this financial support, Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: too buy different types of tools for her husband's water boring (drilling) business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system for her eldest son's house.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Es hombre cordial y trabajador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad, independientes y 5 en edad escolar. Desde su adolescencia adquirió las técnicas y conocimientos para cultivar la tierra y la parte del sector primario. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de tres décadas en trabajos de agricultura. Ha participado en diversas capacitaciones, enfocadas en el manejo integral de los cultivos, abonos orgánicos, motivación y organización, mejoramiento de vida con organismos de cooperación y ONG´s como PANA PANA, quien le otorgó certificación como promotor agropecuario. Con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos y que su actividad productiva crezca solicita su primer financiamiento para cultivar 5 hectáreas de frijoles, 1 hectárea de hortalizas, por lo que necesita preparar la tierra, comprar equipos, herramientas e insumos agrícolas, servicios de manejo agronómicos de los cultivos y mano de obra. Su sueño es incrementar el área de producción de granos básicos y hortalizas.
texts.en:
He is a friendly and hardworking native of Puerto Cabezas.  He is 47 years old, married and has seven children, of which two are adults and independent, and five are school-age.  During his adolescence, he acquired the skills and knowledge to cultivate the land.  He has over three decades of experience working in agriculture.  He has participated in various trainings focused on integrated management of crops, organic fertilizers, motivation and organization, improving life with cooperative organisms and ONG's like Pana Pana who certified him as a promotor of agriculture.  

With the goal of improving his earnings and increasing his productivity, he has requested his first loan to cultivate five hectares of beans and one hectare of vegetables.  For this, he needs to prepare the land, purchase equipment, purchase tools, purchase agricultural supplies, pay for agronomic crop management services, and pay for labor.  His dream is to expand his production area for basic grains and vegetables.

loans.use: harvest five hectares of beans and one hectare of vegetables.

loans.name: Justa Rufina

texts.es: Doña Justa, tiene 64 años de edad, es casada, vive sola con su esposo en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon. Hace 4 años decidio tener sus propios ingresos y estableció una pulpería donde vende arroz, harina, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, churros, refrescos, manteca, pan, medicamentos de uso común, jabón, etc. ella anteriormente vendia cosméticos de productos AVON. Ha solicitado otro préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de productos alimenticios su pulpería como ser, arroz, frijoles, manteca, pan, huevos, harina, condimentos, productos de aseo etc. Su objetivo es crecer con el negocio y con las ganancias tener bienestar y unión familiar.
texts.en:
Justa is 64 years old and married.  She and her husband live alone in the Trujillo municipality in Colon.  Four years ago she decided to have her own income, and she established a grocery store where she sells rice, flour, beans, sugar, eggs, churros, soft drinks, shortening, bread, commonly used medications, and soap, etc.  She previously sold Avon cosmetic products.

She has requested another loan for 12,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock food products like rice, beans, shortening, bread, eggs, flour, condiments, and hygiene products, etc. in her grocery store.  Her objective is to grow in the business and with the earnings have well-being and family unity.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Moisés Isaías

texts.es:
Moisés de 22 años de edad, estudia cuarto año de licenciatura en computación en la universidad, gracias al esfuerzo que está realizando su padre y sus hermanos quienes le apoyan para lograr su objetivo, su madre murió hace cuatro años, hoy en día está solo en su casa de habitación ya que sus hermanos se casaron y tienen sus propias familias y su padre está trabajando para apoyarlo a salir adelante.
Actualmente en sus días libres trabaja de ayudante de albañil o de jornalero en trabajos varios, de los cuales obtiene ingresos económicos, ya que estudia de lunes a jueves.
Él solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora valorada en $700.00 y el resto lo necesita para cancelar en la universidad, así podrá contar con su propio equipo para hacer diferentes tareas que le dejan en la universidad.

Uno de sus sueños principalmente es culminar con sus estudios en la universidad y también trabajar para mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Moisés is 22 years old and is in the fourth year of his computer science program at the university, thanks to the efforts of his father and his siblings, who support him to reach his goal.  His mother passed away four years ago.  He now lives alone in his home, as his siblings have all married and have their own families.  His father works to support him in getting ahead.  On his days off, he works as a mason's assistant or as a day laborer on various jobs, which allow him to earn an income since he attends school from Monday to Thursday.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase a computer, valued at $700, and the rest will be used to pay his college tuition.  This way, he will have his own equipment to do the homework that he is assigned at school.  One of his biggest dreams is to complete his studies and to work to improve his conditions.

loans.use: purchase a computer and pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en:
Nasur is a resident of Kasusu trading centre in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a self-employed businessman who deals in a butchery business selling meat, a business he has carried out since 2007. 

He now has a wide customer base around Kasusu trading centre, and says inadequate capital is the factor hindering the business, yet he desires to open up more outlets in the nearby trading centres.

Nasur needs a loan to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughtering.

loans.name: Janica

texts.en:
Janica is 30 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

Janica has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merma

texts.en:
Merma is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs an ambulant tobacco vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Merma has been in this business for twenty years.

In the future, Merma would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children who both attend school.

Levi is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been in the business of raising pigs for three years.  Levi has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Levi would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 51 years old, married and has seven children, two in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Edna has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Kalmurza

texts.ru: Калмурза, 48 лет, женат, воспитывает пятерых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Деятельность Калмурзы носит сезонный характер, он работает на стройке, в остальное время занимается разведением скота, в чем ему активно помогает жена. В 2003 году стартовый капитал бизнеса составлял 15,000 сомов (KGS), на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть скот для своего употребления и на реализацию: 2 коровы, 15 овец, 5 коз и 3 лошади. В месяц заемщик имеет прибыль в размере 10,000 сомов(KGS). В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Калмурза обращается за покупкой 2 бычков, что станет толчком к развитию бизнеса и позволит обучить его несовершеннолетних детей.
texts.en: Kalmurza is 48, married, and has five children. He has a high school education and takes seasonal work in construction. For the rest of the year, he raises cattle with his wife's help. He started his livestock business in 2003 with 15,000 som (KGS) in capital, and today he has two cows, 15 sheep, five goats and three horses and he earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Kalmurza applied for a loan with the bank Bai-Tushum to purchase two steers and continue expanding his business in order to help educate his children.

loans.use: To buy steers

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is 45 years old, married and has four children, all in school.

Melly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melly requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melly has been raising pigs for four years.

In the future, Melly would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a steel worker and he has been running his business for the past five years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.
Shakeela's husband needs to purchase steel sheets, nails, hammers and other tools but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford these items for business purposes.
Therefore Shakeela has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase items for his business needs. This loan will also help her husband increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.
Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy steel sheets and other accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
La señora  Corina de 60 años de edad es casada y se dedica la elaboración y venta de rosquillas, sus ventas son dos veces por semana, este producto lo elabora y luego lo entrega a sus clientes quienes ya tiene contrato con sus clientes, Doña Corina le vende a dueños de pulpería del municipio donde ella vie, Doña Corina también vende quesillo y se dedica a la cría de cerdos y ganado. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde 10 años en su lugar de residencia al sur de honduras. 
Doña Corina está solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras para compra de dos vacas con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña Corina su sueño  es comprar un vehículo para transportarse con su negocio y llagar a mas comunidades en el municipio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Corina, 60, is married and works making and selling ‘rosquillas’ [traditional cookies]. 

Her sales take place twice weekly. She makes the cookies and then delivers them to her customers who already have contracts with her.

Corina sells to supermarket owners in the municipality where she lives. She also sells cheese and she raises pigs and livestock. She has been doing this type of work for ten years in her house which is located in southern Honduras. 

Corina is requesting 15,000.00 HNL [$800] to buy two cows. With the profits and support from this loan she wants to get ahead and keep improving her business. 

Corina's dream is to buy a transportation vehicle to reach more communities in the municipality. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Beverly Luz

texts.en: Beverly Luz, a mother of two, operates her own farm, growing bananas, while her husband works as a private employee to make a living.  For five years, she has earned a steady income to help meet the various needs of her family.  In order to give her children a better education, she is taking a loan from GDMPC in order to buy organic fertilizer and pay replanting costs to improve the farm.  In the future, she hopes to expand the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay replanting costs

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is a 40-year-old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children.  Her husband is responsible for meeting the needs of the family.  Hameeda is providing sewing services and earning income to contribute and help her husband manage the household.

She is in need of different kinds of materials like needles, thread, cloth and machine oil to support her sewing business.  But, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will enable her to purchase the items mentioned above and also help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Hameeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary items to support her sewing business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 42-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan from Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a leather merchant and has been in business for the past five years. He is responsible for managing the entire household.
Rani's husband wants to purchase leather in bulk for reselling purposes. Due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy leather to re-process it for reselling purposes. Therefore, Rani has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can financially assist her husband to buy leather for his business. This loan amount will also help him to increase the size of his business.
Rani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather in bulk for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Lucresia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar and chips.

Lucresia has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar and chips

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a 29-year-old married mother of four children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Rosana has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosana has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has two children who are one and six years of age. 

As her primary source of income, Rosita engages in a business, buying and selling swaki (sea urchin) to the people in the community. She started her business two years ago. Due to financial challenges, she is asking for a loan to buy more sea urchins to sell in order to be able to provide proper food for the family.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability in order to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more sea urchins to sell.

loans.name: Lincol

texts.es:
Lincol nacio en la selva de Peru pero se mudo a Lima con su padre, que es mototaxista, para realizar sus estudios. Su madre, peluquera, y sus hermanos menores siguen viviendo en Chanchamayo. Actualmente, atraviesa por una dificil situacion economica la cual no le permitiria seguir estudiando sin el apoyo economico de los prestamistas de Kiva. El sera el primer miembro de su familia que obtenga un titulo profesional a nivel superior y estan orgullosos de el. Su sueno es de terminar sus estudios y establecer su propio negocio de mecanica en Chanchamayo para poder ayudar economicamente a su familia y ser modelo a seguir para sus hermanos. Le gustaria tambien una opportunidad de trabajar en el extranjero para ganar experiencia y ser mas competente. 

Lincol quiere agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por este apoyo y decirles que cree que apoyo como este podria cambiar la vida de muchos jovenes que se encuentran en la misma situacion que el. El piensa firmemente de que las buenas acciones que uno hace por otras personas regresan a uno mismo.
texts.en:
Lincol was born in the Peruvian jungle, but moved to Lima with his father, who is a taxi driver, to attend school.  His mother, a hairstylist, and his younger siblings continue to live in Chanchamayo.  At this time, he is going through a difficult financial situation, and so he will not be able to continue to study without financial support from the Kiva lenders.  

Lincol will be the first in his family to get an advanced degree, and they are proud of him.  His dream is to complete his education and launch his own mechanics business in Chanchamayo, so that he can help his family financially and become a role model for his siblings to follow.  In addition, he would like to have the opportunity to work abroad to gain experience and gain competence.

Lincol wants to thank the Kiva lenders for this support, and to tell them that he believes that support like this can change the lives of many young people who are in the same situation as him.  He strongly believes that the good deeds that one does for others come back to oneself.

loans.use: to finance his studies in metal-working

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora works with her husband on their farm to make a living. With income from the farm, her previous loan used for fertilizer was successfully repaid. She was able to engage in another line of business selling grocery goods in her village for additional income. To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  She always finds ways to augment their living.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish nets, fishing poles, and tallow to smear on boat bottoms.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina tiene una edad de 54 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado y no siguió porque los ingresos económicos de sus padres no lo permitían. Después ella conoció a su hoy en día esposo quien también es caficultor y trabaja en otras fincas con quien tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales 6 de ellos ya se casaron y la mayoría vive en otro municipio viviendo con ella solo tres: María tiene 22 años y estudio hasta tercero de ciclo después no quiso seguir estudiando y le ayuda en los oficios domésticos a su madre, Olman de 20 años no le gusto el estudio y prefirió aprender un oficio aprendiendo la ebanistería pero no termino ya que prefirió ayudar a sus padres en sus cultivos de café y ayuda en otras fincas y la menor tiene 8 años y está en segundo grado en la escuela de la comunidad. También con ella viven 5 nietos de distintos hijos, los cuales ella los cuida. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café y aprendió a realizar todas las actividades concernientes a este rubro, por medio de una capacitación que recibió en la escuela agrícola. Su propiedad es de 2 manzanas en la cual siembra granos básicos pero únicamente para el consumo del hogar. Anterior mente también tenía un pequeño negocio de pulperia el cual cerro por la inestabilidad de precios sobre los productos que vendía por lo que mejor decidió dedicarse 100% al cultivo de café ya que lo estaba descuidando por estar más pendiente de su pulperia. La tierra que cultiva la compro y están en el mismo terreno donde está construida su casa pero también tienen otras por herencia a su esposo de la madre la cual queda a una hora caminando y hasta en estos momentos la están arreglando ya que el café está en plantía. A ella le ayudan sus hijos, nietos y esposo y a veces paga trabajadores, sobre todo la temporada de corta de café. 
Doña Reina desea que por lo menos su hija menor siga estudiando y se gradúe del colegio y si es posible en la universidad, así llegar más allá de donde ella y sus hijos mayores llegaron, también sueña con ir ampliando más sus cultivos de café y dejar un patrimonio fortalecido para su familia. Ella solicita financiamiento con el cual comprara con una parte fertilizantes, foliares y pagar la mano de obra para aplicar estos insumos a sus cultivos debido a que después de la temporada de corta las plantas quedan un poco maltratadas y necesitan asistencia y un buen mantenimiento para que la planta de café este fuerte y floree bien. Con la otra parte del financiamiento a las mismas personas pagar mano de obra para sembrar unas 2,500 plantas de café, que ya tiene listas en las zonas que están un poco despobladas en donde se a podado planta vieja o enferma o que no había café.
texts.en:
Reina is 54 years old and studied up until third grade. She did not continue because the income level of her parents did not allow it. Later she met her now-husband, who is also a coffee grower and works on other farms. She has nine children with him, six of which are already married, most living in another town. Only three are living with her. María is 22 years old and studied as far as ninth grade and did not want to continue. She helps her mother with the housework. Olman, 20 years old, did not like school and preferred to study the woodworking trade. He did not finish though, since he preferred to help his parents with the coffee crops and he helps on other farms as well. The youngest daughter is 8 years old and in second grade at the local school. Also living with Reina are 5 grandchildren that she cares for, from various children.

Reina works as a coffee farmer, having learned how to carry out all of the related tasks through training she received at the agriculture school. Her property consists of 2 manzanas where she plants basic grains but only for family consumption. Previously she also had a small convenience store business, which closed due to price instability of the products she sold. For this reason she decided it would be better to dedicate herself 100% to coffee farming since she had been neglecting it while looking after her convenience store. She purchased the land she farms and it is the same land where her house is built, but she also has other land through her husband's mother's inheritance that is an hour away on foot. Even right now it is being worked on since coffee is being planted. Her children, grandchildren and husband help her and sometimes she pays workers, especially during coffee picking season. 

Reina hopes that at least her youngest daughter will continue to study, graduate from high school and if possible, go on to university so that she gets further than Reina and the older children. She also dreams of expanding her coffee farm and leaving a better inheritance for her family. She is requesting financing that she will use partly to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor to apply them to her crops, since after picking season the plants are left a little mistreated and need help and good care so the coffee plants are strong and flower well. With the remaining part of the loan she will pay the same people to plant 2,500 coffee plants that she already has ready in areas that are a little thin due to removal of plants that were old, sick or did not bear coffee.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mahroof

texts.en:
Mahroof is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a guardian of the family and responsible for managing the entire household. Mahroof has also been running her own small business of sewing services for past few years. She contributes her income to fulfill the needs of her family.
Mahroof wants to purchase different kinds of sewing accessories such as thread, needles, machine oil and pieces of cloth for her business purpose. Due to insufficient financial resources she is unable to buy all these things. Therefore she has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will purchase accessories for her business so that she can earn more income.
For this financial assistance, Mahroof is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of stitching accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 36 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nerissa has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Nerissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 35 years old, and married with five children. Three of her children are in school; she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en:
Marjolyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Marjolyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

Shs requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, paints, etc, and to pay for her laborers salaries.

In the future, Marjolyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, paints, etc, and to pay for her laborers salaries

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
Beteliana is 52 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, eggs, and dry goods.

Beteliana has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat was born in 1956. She is a married parent of four children. 

Khosiyat has been busy with farming more than 38 years; she grows vegetables and crops. She has great experience in this field. Khosiyat’s husband is also has been busy with farming. Her children help her with the managing business. 

She wants to improve her living condition; her house has bad condition. She is going to repair her house, but she doesn't have the money. 

Khosiyat is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy building materials as cement, soil, paints, etc. for repairing the house. 

She awaits your support, and thanks you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy materials as cement, soil, paints, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. She earns a living by raising hogs. Her  business was started quite a few years ago. 

Because of the scarcity of capital, she is asking for a loan to buy three sacks of feed and additional piglets, so she has more pigs to sell during a given period of time. 

In the future, Yolanda hopes to improved her business for a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Getafe, Bohol. The eldest is 27 and the youngest is 8. Teodola runs a sari-sari or variety store. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Teodola is also a fish vendor; her husband works as a fisherman.

Teodola hopes to expand her business but she lacks the capital that she needs. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell in her store like canned goods, candies and biscuits, noodles, soap, toiletries, and fish. With this, she will be able to augment her store thus giving her the opportunity to cater to more buyers. Moreover, Teodola dreams of making her business a successful one.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar was born in 1994. She is a smart and hardworking woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. Nilufar is a third-year student, studying at the Tajikistan State University of Commerce. She studies well and actively takes part in all seminars. She must pay for her third year tuition but she does not have the funds; neither do her parents. She is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Henry Giovani

texts.es:
Henry de 40 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, él estudió hasta noveno, grado su compañera de vida se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, y solo dos de sus hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. 
Él se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, además trabaja con un camión haciendo viajes de arena y piedra, de modo que realiza varias actividades para que no le falten los ingresos económicos. 
Él necesita mucho este crédito para comprar ganado y reparar el camión que utiliza para hacer viajes. 
Su plan a futuro es dejarle a su familia un capital para poder trabajar y vivir en un lugar propio.
texts.en:
Henry, who is 40 years old, has a partner and three children. He went to school through ninth grade. His life companion does the domestic work, and only two of his children go to the school in the community.

He works in agriculture and livestock-raising. In addition, he works with a truck, making trips with sand and stone, so that he has various business activities so that he doesn't lack economic income.

He needs this loan a lot in order to buy livestock and to repair the truck that he uses to make trips.

His plan for the future is to have some capital for his family so that they can continue to work and live in their own place.

loans.use: to buy livestock and repair the truck he uses to make trips

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc. for her food production business.

Rodora has been in this business for 1 year. Rodora earns more income from raising livestock.

Rodora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia has been running her piggery while her husband works as a carpenter. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her piggery. 

In order to buy feed, she took a loan from GDMPC. 

She wants to improve the business and be able to renovate their own house for a comfortable living in the near future. 

While her children are studying, the couple plans to improve their business to help them with their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Ее зовут Дилфуза. Ей 40 лет. Она живет с большой семьей в маленьком городке Турсунзаде. Дилфуза счастлива в браке. Дилфуза, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить большую семью продает в магазине напитки. В работе ей помогают ее дети. Дилфуза занимается продажей 10 лет. Она продает напитки газированные и без газа, соки нектары и компот. Весна приходит в Таджикистан и проходит не заметно, потому что очень быстро теплеет и жарко становиться в конце апреля. И Дилфуза активно готовиться к жаркому сезону, и просит ей помочь привести больше товара, так как с по обстоятельствами семьи она не смогла собрать достаточную сумму денег.
texts.en: This is Dilfuza. She is 40 years old. She lives with her big family in the small town of Tursun-zoda. Dilfuza has a happy marriage. In order to help her husband provide for their large family, Dilfuza sells beverages in a shop. Her children help her with this work. Dilfuza has been in retail sale for 10 years. She sells carbonated and still beverages as well as nectar and compote juices. Spring is coming unnoticed to Tajikistan, because it very quickly warms up and becomes hot by the end of April. Dilfuza is actively preparing for the hot season. She is requesting your help to bring in more merchandise as she is unable to collect enough money due to circumstances in her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for her coffee crops and to invest in a new project growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Placida

texts.en: Placida is married with three children and helps her husband manage their own farm for a living. She has been harvesting and selling rice and she earns well to support their needs. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and cover replanting costs. She is determined in her work. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover replanting costs

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en: Raymunda  manages a sari sari store in the village of Dipolog City. She has been in this business for many years to supplement her husband's income. With her generated income, she was able to repay her previous loan used for the business successfully. She wants to improve her business and be able to provide for her family's needs. To increase sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to have a grocery store in the village with a complete grocery selection to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer living in the rich highland area of Litein in South rift Kenya. She has been involved in farming for the past 14 years where she loves feeding her dairy cows but her biggest challenge is poor breeds. Her primary income source is milk,and tea.

Josephine chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have better repayment period and their interest rates are affordable. During the training, she learned how she can use the loan to better her livelihood as a small scale farmer. This loan will help her construct a dairy unit for good production from her dairy cows. This will lead to more milk production and hence more income which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit for milking her cows

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Linda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Jane

texts.en:
Ma. Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of personal products to resell.

Ma. Jane has been in this business for two years. Ma. Jane earns more income from general store.

Ma. Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal products to resell.

loans.name: Tanymkul

texts.ru: Танымкуль, 59 лет, замужем, имеет троих совершеннолетних детей. Уже около 20 лет занимается разведением скота. Начав свой бизнес с 20,000 сомов (KGS), смогла развить свое хозяйство до 1 коровы и 15 овец. Также Танымкуль занимается земледелием, она вместе со своим мужем и младшим сыном выращивает фасоль на своем собственном участке в 3 Га. Танымкуль имеет ежемесячную прибыль в размере 12,000 сомов (KGS). Танымкуль обратилась за кредитом в Банк "Бай-Тушум" в первый раз, на полученные средства планирует расширить свое хозяйство, приобрести скот и семена фасоли. Дальнейшей целью Танымкуль является помощь младшему сыну в обучении.
texts.en: Tanymkul is 59 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She has been raising cattle for about 20 years. Starting her business with 20,000 som (KGS), she was able to develop her farm to include 1 cow and 15 sheep. Tanymkul also practices crop farming. She and her husband and youngest son grow beans on their own 3 hectare plot of land. Tanymkul makes a monthly profit of 12,000 som (KGS). Tanymkul requested a loan from Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum" for the first time. With the received funds, she plants to expand her farm and purchase cattle and bean seeds. Tanymkul's longterm goal is to help her youngest son receive an education.

loans.use: To buy cattle and bean seeds.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina's husband owns and operates a transportation service while she manages a retail store to earn a living. She has been in her business for four years, with the help of her husband, and they earn well to provide for the family.

Rosalina gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC. The cooperative helps her to improve her ability to engage in business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery products. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Этого бизнесмена с района Кубадиён зовут Юлдош. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и у него четверо детей. Юлдош занимается услугой. Десять лет назад он открыл кафе в своем районе. У него работает хороший персонал. Кафе Юлдоша предлагает клиентам вкусные национальные блюда. Сейчас Юлдош планирует расширить свой бизнес. Он просит кредит на сумму 2000 долларов США, чтобы приобрести столы и стулья, а также светомузыку. Благодаря светомузыке Юлдош хочет создать особую атмосферу в кафе и оставить хорошее впечатление у клиентов. Таким образом он хочет привлечь больше клиентов. Юлдош всегда стремится к цели и верит, что его данная цель реализуется с вашей поддержки.
texts.en: This man's name is Yuldosh. He is 49 years old and is from the Qubadiyon District. He is married and has four children. Yuldosh is in the service industry. Ten years ago, he opened a cafe in his town. He has a good staff that works for him. Yuldosh's cafe offers customers delicious ethnic Tajik cuisine. Now Yuldosh is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 USD in order to buy tables and chairs, as well as a disco light projector. Thanks to the disco light projector, Yuldosh wants to create a special ambiance in his cafe and leave a good impression on his customers. Yuldosh wants to attract more customers as a result. Yuldosh always pursues his goals and he believes that this goal will be achieved with your support.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as a disco light projector for his cafe.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Aside from growing and selling pigs, Susan also has a farm, while her husband manages a transportation services business to make a living. With revenue generated from her previous loan used for her livestock shelter, she was able to successfully repay. To improve the farm, she took a new loan to buy fertilizers such as manure. Susan is hopeful to improve her business and save a portion of her returns for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Agnes has been in this business for five years now. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell. In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
Charmaine is 35 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Charmaine has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. Charmaine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lizbeth Ruisa

texts.es:
Lizbeth tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja desde hace 2 años trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de celulares con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir a delante.

Lizbeth esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ellá podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como más equipos celulares y accesorios, con lo cual podrá atender los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; de esta, manera luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 25 years old and lives in the city of Ica. She has worked for two years selling cell phones in her small shop which has provided income for her to get ahead.

Lizbeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders; thanks to their help, she has been able to buy merchandise for her business, such as more handsets and accessories, to meet the needs of her customers and improve her income. In this way, she has strived to make her dream of owning her home come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (phones and accessories).

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Her children are doing study. 

Ghazala's husband has been running his own garment shop business for ten years. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Ghazala is applying for a Kiva group loan with another person, from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes for his business, in bulk. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for her husband to sell in his garment shop.

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.ru:
Хазраткул жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат и имеет 2-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Хазраткул живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Хазраткула также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Хазраткул занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Хазраткул подрабатывает разнорабочим. От своего бизнеса животноводства он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Хазраткулу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Хазраткул хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Хазраткул очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hazratkul is a cheerful and hardworking 48-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support. Hazratkul lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have a higher education, as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family. Hazratkul's wife also does not have an education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have an income to live on, Hazratkul has his own business. He fattens up and sells cattle. He also earns extra money doing odd jobs. He receives a good income from his livestock raising business. His wife also helps Hazratkul with this business. She sells the milk which she receives from the cattle. Now Hazratkul wants to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Hazratkul really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has an electronics repair business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Evelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies that she needs in order to take care of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Eumindo

texts.es:
Eumindo de 48 años de edad es agricultor, está casado y tiene tres hijos, él estudió hasta tercer grado de básica, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus hijos estudian en la escuela. 
Eumindo siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, trabajo que su familia ha realizado durante años y que por lo tanto es una tradición familiar.
Él necesita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y una ternera, para continuar con sus actividades de agricultura y ganadería.
Sus planes son seguir trabajando duro para poder darle la educación adecuada a sus hijos y dejar un patrimonio con el cual contat ante culaquier necesidad.
texts.en:
Eumindo is a married 48-year-old farmer who has three children.  He completed three years of primary school.  His wife is a domestic worker, and his children are in school.

Eumindo has always made his living raising crops and livestock.  His family has performed this work many years, and as such it is a family tradition.

He needs a loan in order to purchase compost, fertilizer and a calf, so that he can continue his work with livestock and crops.  His plan is to keep working hard in order to give his children an adequate education and leave behind an inheritance which will help his children to have everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer and a calf.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is engaged in a transportation business. He is from the village of San Isidro. Orlando is happily married and blessed with three children. Two of his children had settled for marriage and the other one is working.

Orlando is engaged in a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport. He has had this kind of business for eight years. He is thankful because his wife is supportive. 

Now, Orlando wants to buy new tires for his motorcycle, but his capital is not sufficient. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. He hopes to obtain the amount of the loan he requested to be able to improve his income and to avoid any accident during his daily travels in transporting his passengers from their village to market. Orlando believes that he could keep his transportation business profitable.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ma. Merlita

texts.en:
Ma. Merlita owns and operates a piggery to earn a living. She has been in her business for ten years, with the help of her husband, who works as a Philippine National Police Officer and they earn well to provide for the family.

Ma. Merlita gained access to microfinance services after joining Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). The cooperative helps her to improve her ability to engage in business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy piglets and feed. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future with her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 43 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Artemia runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Artemia has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as sardines, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Artemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to sell.

Editha has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: María Leonila

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, actualmente está soltera y tiene un hijo que ya trabaja y es independiente.

María es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el cual ha sido el sustento por años en su familia. 

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar ganado y para sacar adelante la milpa
Ella planea para un futuro comprar mas ganado, sembrar mas para que su capital aumente y poder dejarle a su familia un lugar donde vivir y trabajar.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She studied up until the second grade. She is currently single and has one son, who is now working and independent.

María is a hardworking woman who dedicates herself to agriculture and cattle. These livelihoods have sustained her family for years. 

She needs the requested loan to purchase cattle in order to advance the farm. She plans to purchase even more cattle in the future, and to plant more, so that her assets grow and she can leave her family a place to live and work.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and get her farm ahead.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre trabajador de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, ahora él está casado, su esposa le ayuda en la ganadería y sus hijos estudian en la escuela mas cerca de la comunidad. 
Pedro trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, lo aprendió porque este ha sido un trabajo familiar desde hace muchos años.
El crédito que él está solicitando a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar ganado y para invertir en la milpa y el maicillo.
Él sueña con poder dejarle un patrimonio y capital a su familia para que vivan en una propiedad propia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a hardworking man. He is 41 years old and studied up until the sixth grade. He is now married and his wife helps him with the cattle. His children study in the nearby school of their community.

Pedro works in agriculture and cattle. He learned this because this has been his family's work for many years.

The loan he requests of CrediCampo will be used to purchase cattle and to invest in his crops of corn and sorghum. He dreams of being able to leave wealth and assets for his family so that they can live on their own land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and to invest in corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle, for her motorcycle transport business.

Elena has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additonal spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 8,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Ханифа позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 46 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Ханифа мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Ханифу выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Ханифа никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Ханифа вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Ханифа выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Муж Ханифы также помогает ей вести данный бизнес. Их дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Ханифа с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Ханифа заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Hanifa is a cheerful and hardworking 46-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small country village. From childhood, Hanifa dreamed of becoming a teacher but circumstances happened such that she was unable to receive a higher education due to financial difficulties in her family. Right after she graduated from secondary school, Hanifa got married and became a homemaker. But even though she is always at home, she never sits idly.

In order to have a steady income to live on, Hanifa and her husband started their own business. They practice livestock breeding. Hanifa raises the cattle and then sells the meat and milk that they get from them. She receives a good income from this business. Hanifa's husband also helps her run this business. Their earns are enough for an average standard of living. Now they do not have enough money to cover all of their current needs. Currently, Hanifa and her husband want to buy several more heads of cattle to fatten up. This is why she requested a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Hanifa thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, and cream.

Gemma has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, and cream.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married, with five children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries, like rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and seasonings.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries, like rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and seasonings.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy stocks to sell, like soap, milk, diapers, and canned goods.

Janice has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell, like soap, milk, diapers, and canned goods.

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josette works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Josette is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for the materials and labor for her furniture-making business.

Josette has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the materials and labor for her funiture-making.

loans.name: Vannet

texts.en:
Vannet (pictured here) lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children attend school and another one is still young. 

Vannet is hired by villagers to spin thread, and this is how she earns a living. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Under her wooden house is open air space. She wants to use that space to build a concrete brick room for keeping items, because her two bicycles were stolen.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her school-going children.

She operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business. With the loan she wants to purchase 18 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 18 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 60 лет,имеет высшее образование. С 1982 года она занимается собственным бизнесом, разводит скот. Свою деятельность она начала с 5,000 сомов (KGS), и на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 3 коровы, 15 телят, 7 лошадей и 81 овцу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000сомов (KGS). Гульнара по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. К слову, у нее шесть детей. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Гульнаре дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Gulnara is 60 years old and has a higher education. Since 1982, she has been running her own business of raising cattle. She started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). She currently has 3 cows, 15 calves, 7 horses and 81 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). Gulnara is calm, well-adjusted and hardworking by nature. Her husband and children help her with this business. By the way, she has six children. The earnings from her farm allow Gulnara to give her children a good education. For the further development of her business, Gulnara requested a loan from Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to buy bull calves. Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further expand her farm. She also wants to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Egleceria

texts.en:
Egleceria is a 48-year-old  married woman and  mother of eight children from Getafe, Bohol. Egleceria is engaged in selling dried fish to the people in her place. 

Egleceria has been in this business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Egleceria is asking for a loan  to buy fresh fish. With this, she will be able to dry more fish which she can then sell to her buyers. In the future, Egleceria has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat was born in 1967. She is married and has two children. Her children are adults. Rohat lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. 

Rohat is going to organize her own business because she needs to earn money. She lives in an agricultural region so she wants to organize a business with animal husbandry. 

Rohat took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy cattle so as to organize this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle so as to organize a new business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosa is 39 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosa has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Rose has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Sharon is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more livestock to sell.

Sharon has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fish and seafood.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Vivian has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 40 years old, married with six children, who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Florida has a nipa-roofing business (making palm frond shingles)  in the Philippines. Florida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa-roofing.

Florida has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa-roofing business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristina has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: Masika appreciates the previous loan which helped her  to pay school fees for her child who attends primary school. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan to buy charcoal for sale in her business. In addition, she has a retail shop to supplement her income. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale in her business

loans.name: Ota

texts.ru:
Ота добродушный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 54 лет. Он родился в семье рабочего. Ота женат и является многодетным отцом, так как имеет пятерых детей. Ота очень любит своих детей и старается делать всё, чтобы они ни в чём не нуждались. Жена также очень уважает своего мужа за его добрый характер.

Чтобы иметь средства для проживания Ота занимается собственным бизнесом. Вот уже как 29 лет Ота работает пекарем. Он имеет пекарню небольшую, где печёт национальный хлеб - лепёшки. Это его любимое дело, с юных лет он любил готовить и печь. И сейчас он очень рад, что может заниматься своим любимым делом и получать от этого доход. Ота старается привлечь еще больше  клиентов для своего бизнеса. Также Ота является клиентов Арванд на протяжении нескольких лет. Вот и сейчас в очередной раз Ота обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку муки и других продуктов для выпечки лепёшек. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь.
texts.en:
Ota is a good-natured and positive 54-year-old man. He was born into a blue-collar family. He is married and is a father many times over, as he has five children. Ota really loves his children and does all that he can so that they want for nothing. His wife also really respects him for his generous character.

Ota has worked as a baker for 29 years already. He has a small bakery where he bakes lepyoshki (Central Asian bread). This is his favorite things do, as he has loved to cook and bake from a young age. Now he is really glad that he is able to practice his favorite pastime and receive earnings from it. He strives to attract even more customers for his business. Ota has been a client of Arvand over the course of many years. This time, Ota turned to Arvand to receive a loan to buy flour and other groceries needed to bake lepyoshki. He really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy flour and other groceries needed to bake lepyoshki (Central Asian bread).

loans.name: Calisteh

texts.en:
Calisteh is single and has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past three years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition. 

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit and vegetables for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pardagul

texts.ru: Пардагул простая дехканка из городка Куляб. Ей 52 года. Пардагул спокойная, добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Она замужем и вырастила двоих детей. Ее старший сын работает продавцом одежды, младший сын учится в школе ему 16 лет. Пардагул работает уборщицей в сельской школе. Так как зарплата маленькая, Пардагул дома выращивает овощи и бобы. Пардагу хочет, чтоб ее дети питались здоровой пищей, и она часть урожая может продать. Пардагул готовиться к весеннему посеву урожая с этой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Она просить в кредит $1500, чтобы купить семена овощей, минеральных удобрений и  горючей смеси для трактора. Пардагул верит, что сможет в скором времени получит кредит и во время закончит посев урожая.
texts.en: Pardagul is a simple 52-year-old farmer from the town of Kulob. Pardagul is a calm, kind and compassionate woman. She is married and is raising two children. Her eldest son works as a clothing salesman; her youngest son is 16 years old and attends school. Pardagul works as a janitor in a country school. As the salary is low, Pardagul grows vegetables and legumes at home. Pardagul wants her children to eat healthy food. She is also able to sell a portion of her harvest. Pardagul is getting ready for the spring sowing season which is why she requested a loan. She is requesting a loan for 1500 USD to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor fuel. Pardagul believes that she will be able to get a loan in the near future and finish sowing her crops on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and tractor fuel.

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendia est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 33ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé/cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de légumes (tomates et concombres) et fruits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bassira (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des  légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 corbeilles de tomates et 8 sacs de concombres à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Bassira espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 62 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Bendia group is primarily comprised of monogamous women. On average, they are 33 years old and have five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila (town of Mandé/administrative subdivision of Kati Cercle). They know one another through neighbors. 

The members of the group sell vegetables (tomatoes and cucumbers) and fruit. With the goal of growing their business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second group loan cycle.
