Madame Bassira (the woman seated in the middle of the photo) has an impressive reputation in vegetable sales. She would like to use her loan to buy eight baskets of tomatoes and eight bags of cucumbers in Bamako. She sells for retail prices in Kanadjiguila to a predominantly female clientele. 

With this loan, Madame Bassira hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 62,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in the business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land for housing during her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Shohnoza

texts.en:
Shohnoza was born in 1979. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her family in a rural area. 

Shohnoza always has wanted to organize her own business and in this way to be successful. She is going to start a business selling dried fruits. She will buy dried fruit in bulk and sell it in a local market. She took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" from a women's organization and got a certificate. 

Shohnoza is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy dried fruits for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for organizing new business

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 39 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending and poultry.

Mae aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Xiomara Kristina

texts.en:
Xiomara Kristina is a married woman and a mother of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. Xiomara has engaged in the hog-raising business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. 

Xiomara is asking for a loan  to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business, thus augmenting her yield and income. 

In the future, Xiomara hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is married with one child. He operates a transportation service to make a living. His wife works as a teacher in their village. He has been in this field of business for two years and he earns enough to provide for his family. Recently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the cost of motorcycle repairs. In the future, the couple wants to build their own house. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward appreciates the previous loan that helped him to buy second-hand clothes.

He thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.  Here again he comes to you again, requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy one bale of second hand clothes to add to his stock.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second hand clothes to add to his stock to sell.

loans.name: İsmayilxan

texts.en: Ismayilxan has cows. He has been in the agriculture business for seven years. He has been married and has two children. Ismayilxan’s elder son studies in his first course of college. His daughter is going to music school and plays the piano well. His lovely wife helps Ismayilxan in their family business. They are living in the Boyuk Bahmanli village in the Fuzuli region, but  they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city. In 1993, the Fuzuli city was occupied by Armenians. Today, Ismayilxan needs a loan of 1,550 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to improve his business. With this loan, he wants to buy calves. In the future, İsmayilxan wants to repair the stall he uses for his cows.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his pineapple crop

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 28 years old, married, and  owns and operates a farm, raising pigs to make a living.  Her husband  works in their village as a carpenter and she helps him by managing their farm. 

In order to purchase feed, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit which she had joined last year. She hopes to gain more income to sustain and improve the piggery to ensure better income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and married with 12 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 36 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Genalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Genalyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fozil

texts.ru:
Фозил жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Сам Фозил работает мастером по ремеслу.  у него своя небольшая мастерская, где он и работает. От этой работы он получает хороший доход.

Также Фозил получает дополнительный доход от дехканства. Он выращивает некоторую сельхозкультуру. Хотя это сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит Фозилу доход. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Фозила является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Фозилу хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Фозил обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Фозил заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Fozil is a cheerful and hardworking man. He is married and has four children. He has a very close-knit family. They live in the countryside. In order to have earnings for the family, all the members of the family try to do something to earn money. Each person works as hard as they can. Fozil works as an expert craftsman. He has a small workshop where he works. He receives a good income from this work.

Fozil also receives an additional income from farming. He grow various types of crops. Although it is a seasonal business, it also brings Fozil more earnings. Fozil's main stable business is livestock breeding. He raises and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. She looks after the cattle and sells the milk she receives from them. The business of livestock breeding brings Fozil a good and steady income. This is why he wants to expand this business. He needs to buy several cattle to raise and sell in the future. This is why he requested a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring in more profits to completely fulfill his family's needs. Fozil thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Familia Miranda Group

texts.es:
Anteriormente la mayoría de las personas de los pueblos no utilizaban calzado sino el atuendo que identifica a cada una de sus regiones. Con el paso de los años, dentro de las regiones del Estado de México comenzó el fenómeno de la migración en la cual habitantes de las comunidades comenzaron a salir a las grandes ciudades en busca de un empleo o bien una mejor calidad de vida. Es así como la ropa de moda comenzó a llegar a estas regiones, después de ello se expandió el comercio y la oportunidad de vender ropa para varias familias.

Eduardo, Griselda y Evodio son algunas de esas personas que decidieron dedicarse a la venta de ropa; comentan que llevan 2 años desde que iniciaron con este tipo de negocio gracias a que sus familiares los motivaron a tener su propia actividad económica. Eduardo  inició ofreciendo a sus clientes calcetines y ropa interior para dama y caballero gracias a que ha trabajado arduamente y con la ayuda de Griselda y Evodio han podido obtener un local cerca de su domicilio en donde, con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y amor a su negocio también pueden ofrecer a sus clientes pantalones para dama y caballero, blusas, camisas, chalecos, abrigos, playeras y sudaderas y también gracias a VisionFund México ellos han podido ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer sus productos no solo a sus vecinos. Además ya también salen a los distintos tianguis fuera del Estado a vender la gran variedad de mercancía que adquieren.

Con el crédito solicitado, Eduardo comprará pantalones, blusas, camisas, sudaderas y chamarras ya que es lo que sus clientes le consumen y con ello él podrá contar con el dinero necesario para que sus hijos Mariel de 4 años y Eduardo de tan solo 2 meses de nacido puedan tener todo lo que necesitan. Asimismo Eduardo comenta que quiere ahorrar para que cuando su pequeña inicie con sus estudios no le falte nada y pueda comprar lo que le pidan en la escuela. Griselda y Evodio también invierten en su local de ropa y comprarán la misma mercancía que Eduardo ya que son socios en el negocio.

Ellos son las 3 personas que integran al grupo Familia Miranda quienes han sido beneficiadas con los apoyos que ofrece VisionFund México. Ellos comentan que en el tiempo que han estado trabajando con la fundación han visto un gran avance en su negocio y eso los ha impulsado a seguir adelante con la finalidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias y con sus ganancias ellos pueden ofrecer lo indispensable en su hogar. Por si fuera poco, su negocio les da la oportunidad  de cumplir con la empresa que haa creído en ellos y los ha apoyado para que su negocio sea fructífero y en un futuro cada uno tenga un local propio pero no olvidando que con la ayuda de los 3 integrantes han podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Previously the majority of people in the villages did not wear shoes and wore the dress that identified each one of its regions. With the passage of time, the phenomenon of migration began in the regions of the State of Mexico, in which inhabitants of the communities began to go out to the big cities in search of a job or a better quality of life. This is how fashion clothing began to arrive in the regions. After that, another business expanded that gave several families the opportunity to start selling clothing.

Eduardo, Griselda, and Evodio are some of these people who decided to start selling clothing. They tell us that it has been 2 years since they started this type of business, thanks to their family members motivating them to create their own economic activities. Eduardo started by offering his customers socks and men’s and women’s underwear. Thanks to the fact that he has worked arduously, and with the help of Griselda and Evodio, they have been able to open a store near their house. With a lot of effort, dedication, and love for their business, they can now offer their customers men’s and women’s pants, tops, shirts, vests, overcoats, t-shirts, and sweaters. Also, thanks to VisionFund Mexico, they have been able to expand their business and are able to offer their products not just to their neighbors. They go out to different street markets outside of the state to sell a large variety of the merchandise they offer.

With the loan requested, Eduardo will buy pants, tops, shirts, sweaters, and jackets, since it is what his customers buy from him, and with it he will be able to have the money so that his children Mariel, 4 years old, and Eduardo, only 2 months old, will have everything they need. Eduardo also notes that he wants to save so that his little girl can start school, not lack anything, and be able to buy everything the school requests of them. Griselda and Evodio also invest in their clothing store and will buy the same items as Eduardo, since they are partners in the business.

They are the 3 people who make up the Familia Miranda (Miranda Family) group and have benefited from the support that VisionFund México offers. In the time they have been working with the foundation, they have seen great progress in their business, and this has pushed them to move forward with the goal of offering their family members a better quality of life. With their earnings, they can offer the essentials at home, and their business also gives them the opportunity to fulfill their obligations to the organization that has believed in them and has supported them so that their business would be fruitful and so that in the future each one would have their own store, but not forgetting that with the help of the 3 members they have been able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, shirts, sweaters, and jackets

location.town: Guarda San Antonio Buenavista, San José del Rincón

loans.name: Marilu

texts.en:
Marilu is Nicaraguan, 48 years old, and has six children. She moved to Costa Rica approximately fifteen years ago with hopes of improving her financial situation, which she has done through receiving her bachelor’s degree and training as a chef.  With this training, she has been able to work and to support her children. All of her children are currently in school, with the oldest on a scholarship in Venezuela studying medicine. She has provided an excellent example as a hardworking and responsible female business owner who has been able to uplift her family as well as herself.

With the financial support that she receives from her husband, she can look out for her younger children who are in high school. Currently, she is taking a pastry course, and with the loan that she is asking for, she hopes to make this a part of her business.  She specializes in the preparation of pastries and sandwiches for all occasions.

During the last fifteen years, she has been dedicated to her work and to the development of her business. She already has an oven and a blender, but she would like to add to her equipment through the acquisition of a table where she can prepare her products and thus offer a greater variety to her customers.

In addition to her main business, she has also been able to supplement her income through catalog sales, both of which have helped her to support her children. The majority of her clients are from the community of Palmitos de Naranjo and surrounding areas, where she is known as a very hard worker. She prepares food for all types of parties, and every weekend she receives requests for luncheons and from various cafés in her community.

The woman is the head of her household because she doesn’t live with her husband, although he does provide some support for their children’s education. However, it has been Marilu who has fought and trained in order to provide her children with the opportunity to receive an education and to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a table to help to prepare her pastries and sandwiches and thus offer a greater variety to her customers

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza is a young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1989. Shahnoza is married and has a little child. Now, she wants to organize her own business dealing in animal husbandry. Her husband is a master at repairing houses and has a small income. Shahnoza took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She is going to improve her living condition with the profit from her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en: Nuriniso was born in 1955. She is married and has adult children. She is going to start a new business sewing national mattresses. She took part, with this aim, in the course ‘To get Ahead’ from a women's organization. Nuriniso will sew national mattresses in her house. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to start a new business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been operating a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 80,000, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marío Dagoberto

texts.es:
Mario tiene 51 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, formó su hogar a los 18 años, lamentablemente su pareja ya falleció.

Mario es empleado de la alcaldía de la ciudad donde él vive, ya tiene más de 9 años de trabajar, se desempeña como personal administrativo, por los años 80 tuvo la oportunidad de ser alcalde en el pueblo, por lo que se puede decir que desde joven le gustó la política, que la aprendió por medio de los compañeros de trabajo. El trabajo le queda a unos 500 metros de su casa, lo cual se desplaza a pie, el horario que cumple es de  8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo será invertido en el pago de unos compromisos que ha adquirido en comerciales, pues sacó unos muebles, el préstamo le ayudará para que ya no siga pagando los muebles a un alto costo de interés.

Sus propósitos son preparar bien su casa, para que en un futuro tenga mejor valor de adquisición, para sus hijos espera dejarles una herencia digna donde puedan construir.
texts.en:
Mario is 51 years old; he studied until grade 3. He formed his household at 18 years of age, and regrettably his partner has already passed on.

Mario is an employee at the mayor’s office in the city where he lives. He has worked there for over 9 years; he is part of the administrative staff. During the 80’s he had the opportunity of being the mayor of the town, which is why it can be said that he liked politics since he was young, which he learned about through his co-workers. His work is located 500 metres away from his home, so he walks there. The schedule he keeps is from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

The loan will be invested in paying some commitments that he has acquired in the commercial sector, he bought some furniture and the loan will help him so that he doesn’t have to pay for the furniture at a high interest rate. 

His intent is to prepare his house well so that it in the future it will have a better purchase value. For his children he hopes to leave them with a decent inheritance where they can build.

loans.use: to pay commitments that he has acquired in the commercial sector.

loans.name: Fatulloh

texts.ru:
Фатуллох активный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 23 лет. Он женат, и имеет пока одного ребёнка. Фатуллох живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. 

Фатуллох занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Фатуллох занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Фатуллох хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Фатуллох заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Fatulloh is an active and cheerful 23-year-old guy. He is married and currently has one child. Fatulloh lives with his wife in a small house in a country village. In order to feed his family, he runs his own business.

Fatulloh practices farming and livestock breeding. He has a plot of land. From the main plot of land, several portions are left as unwatered land while the rest of the plot is irrigated land. On this land Fatulloh grows carrots, potatoes and grains. His wife helps him looks after and raise the cattle. As their plot of land is large, they also graze their cattle on it. The business of livestock breeding brings in a good income, which is why Fatulloh wants to expand it by increasing his herd. He requested a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Fatulloh thanks Arvand in advance for their support and really relies on a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en: Mastona was born in 1976. She is a very hardworking woman. Mastona is married and brings up three children. One of them is not yet an adult. Mastona tries to provide good living conditions for her children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 16 years. Mastona feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products such as kefir and sour cream to the local people. Mastona now has four cows. She wants to improve her living condition. She is going to change the windows of her house. The windows of her house are old and in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy plastic windows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic windows

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Brundabati is a married woman, 31 years old, who lives in a remote village called Jaljad in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the front, second from right with her hand raised is Brundabati.  She lives with her three-member family comprised of her husband and one son aged three. She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead.
 
Brundabati has been selling milk and doing a seasonal business with her husband for 10 years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with a limited investment and purchased a cow. Gradually, she expanded her business and added one cow every year from her savings.   

In 2014, Brundabati, along with 15 other members of her village, formed a group named Maa Tarini and took a loan of Rs 16,000 each from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan for her group. Now she is earning 7,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scanty to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business in his village. So from this loan, she has purchased a cow (for selling milk) and some seasonal items, thereby increasing her income. Brundabati has a long cherished desire to build a permanent house for her family and educate her child in a better school in a nearby town. The other 15 members of her group are running a milk business, a vegetable business, grocery shops, hotels, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some seasonal items like mahul and paddy

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widowed woman with five children (four adults and one in school). They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Elizabeth has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past nine years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables for her business and pay school fees for her child. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables and pay school fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
With Lucia's generated income from her banana farm, her previous loan, used for fertilizer, was successfully repaid. She was also engaged in a retailing business selling grocery goods in their village. 

She gained access to financial services and helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities after she had joined GDMPC. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase grocery goods to sell. Lucia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: Irenea is a married woman and mother of two school-age children from Getafe, Bohol. Irenea has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income.  Irenea works hard to help her husband meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Irenea hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Shree Ram Group

texts.en:
Rupakanti is a married woman who is 30 years old and lives in a remote village called Thakapali in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the front of the photo with her hand raised is Rupakanti.  She lives with her six-member family including her husband, two sons (8 and 6 years old) and two daughters (10 and 4 years old). She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead. 

Rupakanti has been doing a milk business with her husband in her village for the last five years to maintain her family. Initially she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased a cow. Gradually, she expanded her business and added one cow every year. In 2014, Rupakanti along with 11 other members of her village formed a group and took a loan of Rs 16,000 each from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan for her group. Now she is earning 5,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scant to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business in his village. With this loan, she has purchased a cow for selling of milk, thereby increasing her income. Rupakanti has a long cherished desire to build a permanent house for her family. 
 
The other 11 members of her group are doing a milk business, goat rearing, hotel, grocery shop, tailoring, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk

loans.name: Phanuel

texts.en:
Phanuel is a 54-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, together with his four children. Over twenty years, Phanuel was able to manage his farm that absolutely met the needs of his family. Until now, the farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve his farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Phanuel expects an increase in sales so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve his farm.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

Amina sells vegetables in her stall beside the shop she has. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy components for the solar battery system, inverter, and lights.

loans.name: Nur

texts.ru:
Нур добродушный и жизнерадостный  мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат  и имеет четверых детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Нур живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. 

Чтобы иметь средства на проживание Нур занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется  земельная площадь, которая  составляет около 12 га. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле  Нур занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Нур хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Нур надеется на положительный результат и  заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nur is a good-natured and cheerful 53-year-old man. He is married and has four children. All of his children are already grown-up and have their own families. Nur lives with his wife in a small house in a country village. Despite his age, he is full of life and the desire to work for the benefit of his family.

In order to have an income to live on, Nur practices farming and livestock breeding. He has a plot of land which is about 12 hectares large. From the whole plot of land, 8 hectares is unwatered land, while the rest of the plot is irrigated land. On this land Nur grows carrots, potatoes and grains. His wife helps him look after and raise cattle. As their plot of land is large, they also graze their cattle on it. The business of livestock breeding brings in a good income which is why Nur wants to expand it by increase his herd. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Nur really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La joven María Elena tiene la edad de 26 años, habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde nació y creció al lado de su madre.
Con sacrificio estudió la carrera de contabilidad, ya que viene de una familia muy humilde donde le tocó iniciar a trabajar desde muy joven para costear sus estudios y así salir adelante.
Hoy en la actualidad labora como Auxiliar de contabilidad y le da gracias a Dios por haber encontrado este trabajo acorde a su carrera.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva y Ceprodel con los diferentes créditos los cuales le han ayudado porque ha mejorado la vivienda de su madre y sobre todo en sus estudios culminado con su título universitario.
En este momento está solicitando un financiamiento para pagar un curso universitario con el fin de ampliar sus conocimientos en la parte contable.
Espera que le sigan apoyando para llegar a ser una excelente profesional en el futuro.
texts.en: María Elena is 26 years old. She lives in El Sauce municipality where she was born and grew up at her mother's side. With sacrifice, she studied accounting. As she comes from a very humble family where she had to work from a very young age to pay for her schooling in order to be successful. Today she works as an accounting assistant and is thankful to God for having found this work in her career field. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Ceprodel have provided her on different loans which have helped her because she has been able to improve her mother's home and above all finish her university schooling. Today she seeks a loan to pay for a university class with the goal of expanding her knowledge of accounting. She hopes to continue receiving support in order to be an excellent professional in the future.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees required to receive her university degree.

loans.name: Gs Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La  señora  Verónica de31 edad, vive  en su casa , ubicada en puerto grande al sur de honduras donde se dedica desde hace seis años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la pesca artesanal y que cada día por la mañana visitan su negocio para comprar sus tortillas, demás de vender tortillas también se dedica a la pesca artesanal.
Doña Veronica sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, es conocida en su aldea por ser una persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante. Su negocio es en su casa donde llegan las personas de diferentes lugares para comprar sus tortillas y también su pescado.
Doña Veronica solicita el préstamo para comprar de una cimbra para pescas. Y así tener mejores ganancias, ya que en estos primeros mese del año es cuando hay bastante demanda de pescado además de acercarse la semana santa y en Honduras se consume bastante pescado para estas fechas.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo quienes se dedican también a la pesca artesanal ellas son,  Doña  Gislen, Doña Glenda y Byron, Ellos radican  al sur de Honduras y son amigos. 
Doña Verónica su sueño es tener  su propio local de distribución de pescado y comprar una lacha más.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo-2014.
texts.en:
Verónica is 31 years old and lives in her home located in a large port in southern Honduras. For the past six years she has worked making and selling tortillas. Her customers are all the people who are traditional fisherman and every morning they visit her business to buy her tortillas. in addition to selling tortillas she also fishes.

Verónica works Monday through Sunday, and is known in her village for being a hard-working person with the desire to be successful. Her business is in her home, where people come from different places to buy her tortillas and fish.

Verónica seeks a loan to buy a fishing net. In this way she will have higher earnings, because in the first months of the year is when there is a high demand for fish. In addition with Holy Week approaching, Hondurans eat a lot of fish during this time of year.

With the support of this loan she plans to continue investing in her business and continue growing, along with her colleagues in the group who also work in the traditional fishing industry: Gislen, Glenda, and Bryon. They are located in southern Honduras and are friends.

Verónica dreams of having her own fish distribution locale and to buy another fishing boat.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo-2014.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 40 лет, замужем, мать  четверых детей, имеет среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Начав свой бизнес около 20 лет назад с 5,000 сомов (KGS) в данный момент имеет 2 коровы, жеребенка и более 10 коз. Основной деятельностью Айгуль является земледелие, она имеет участок размером 0,16 Га, где в основном выращивает кукурузу и картофель.Прибыль Айгуль от ведения бизнеса составляет свыше 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Айгуль обратилась за кредитом на покупку семян картофеля, дополнительно планирует приобрести минеральные удобрения и потратить часть средств на пахотные работы. За счет реализации картофеля Айгуль сможет улучшить финансовое благосостояние семьи и купить легковой автомобиль.
texts.en: Aigul is 40 years old, is married, is the mother of four children, has a high school education and works in agriculture.  She started her business about 20 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS); today she has 2 cows, a foal and more than 10 goats.  Aigul's main business is farming, she has a plot of 0.16 ha where she mostly grows corn and potatoes.  Aigul's earnings from the business are more than 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Aigul turned to "Bai Tushum" bank for a loan to purchase potato seeds.  In addition, she plans to buy fertilizer and to use part of the funds for plowings.  By selling the potatoes, Aigul will be able to improve the financial conditions of her family and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a widowed woman. She has four children who are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Anzazi operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Anarhan

texts.ru: Анархан 65 лет, она замужем, мать двоих сыновей, но они уже достаточно взрослые и самостоятельные. У Анархан  среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анархан занимается животноводством, стартовав в далеком 1972году, с покупки скота на 200 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Анархан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова и 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анархан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум", она запланировала покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Анархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья скота и хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Anarhan is 65 years old, she is married and is the mother of two sons, but they are already grown and independent.  Anarhan has a high school education.  As the main source of income for her family, Anarhan raises livestock, having started back in 1972 with the purchase of livestock for 200 som (KGS); thanks to Anarhan's hard work her holdings now include 1 milk cow and 10 goats.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Anarhan turned to Bank "Bai Tushum," she plans to buy cows.  Anarhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock holdings and wants to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support. The previous loan helped her to buy rice, cooking fat, vegetables, meat and charcoal for the business.

She is requesting another loan to buy rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Tynchtyk

texts.ru: Тынчтык, 23 года, детей нет. В поиске доходов в 2010году Тынчтык стал заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начал с 20,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Тынчтык достиг достаточных успехов в развитии хозяйства и стал получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сомов (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Тынчтык имеет: 3 коровы и 3 овцы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тынчтык обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум». Он планирует купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доходы от кредита Тынчтык планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует построить новый сарай и сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Tynchtyk is 23 years old, he does not have children.  In search of income in 2010, Tynchtyk started to farm and raise livestock.  He started the business with 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to his hard work Tynchtyk reached success in growing his business and started to earn a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, Tynchtyk has 3 cows and 3 sheep.  In order to to further grow his holdings, Tynchtyk turned to Bank "Bai Tushum."  He plans to buy fertilizer and seeds.  Tynchtyk plans to invest the profits from the loan into further growing his business and also plans to build a new shed and make home improvements in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pastry-making supplies and 5 pigs.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with six school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are fees and food for the family. 

For the past four years she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase beans, sweets, rice and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase  beans, sweets, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is a young and purposeful woman. She is 22 years old. She is married and has a little child. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Fotima is going to organize a business with animal husbandry. She lives in an agricultural region so she hopes that her new business with animal husbandry will go well. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She will feed cattle some months and sell them in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 27 year old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. He is a university graduate and has a pharmaceutics degree. With the support of his family financially, he was able to open a pharmacy in his area. He started his business four years ago through selling drugs to meet the many medical requirements of the patients in his area. 

He is making modest profits but most of what he earns goes to the expenses of his family. Due to a huge crisis with electricity in the country, most people live in the dark and suffer from the crisis.  For this reason, Ahmmed applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a power generator for the pharmacy.

Ahmmed looks forward to expanding his pharmacy and opening other branches in the city. He hopes to cover all the needs of his family and provide them with a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy a power generator for the pharmacy

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 49 years old and has been in the food vending business for several years now. She has sold snack foods like rice cakes and ice candies (popsicles) for several years now. She is also engaged in rice farming with her husband. 

Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to make more snack foods to sell. In the future, Cecelia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and others

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, ella deseaba seguir estudiando  pero su condición económica y porque no había una escuela cerca ella no pudo continuar, está soltera, pero en algún tiempo estuvo casada con el padre de sus hijos, ella tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 ya están casados y 4 más se encuentran todavía a su cargo viviendo en su casa y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.

María es empleada en una institución de turismo, trabaja como asesora, tiene ya 2 años de trabajar en la institución, anteriormente ella era miembro del consejo  de la alcaldía de su municipalidad en la cual trabajó 2 años, ella también se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar y  educar a sus hijos en los tiempos libres y para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que tomar un bus y desplazarse aproximadamente 3 kilómetros de distancia. Ella entra a trabajar a las ocho de la mañana y sale a las tres de la tarde.  

El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para la remodelación de su casa, específicamente lo que cambiara es el techo de su vivienda, pues ya lo tiene un poco deteriorado y se acerca  la época de lluvia por lo tanto necesita repararlo lo más pronto posible, comprará 500 tejas de cemento y madera de cuartón, esto le permitirá tener una mejor estructura  y no correr el riesgo de que en la época de lluvia se pueda mojar sus pertenencias.

Las proyecciones que ella tiene a futuro son tener un mejor empleo  que le genere mayores ingresos económicos, para su familia desea tener una mejor casa, y que sus hijos sean personas de bien en la sociedad y que sigan estudiando, tiene la esperanza que todo le saldrá bien gracias al crédito y futuros créditos que solicitará.
texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and studied until the fifth grade. She wanted to continue in school but due to her economic status and because there wasn't a school near her, she could not continue. She is single, but at one time was married to the father of her children. She has eight children of which four are already married and four more are still in her care and live at home and are the only people who are dependent on her

Mary is employed at a tourism agency, works as a consultant, and has already two years of working in the agency.  She formerly she was a member of the city council of the municipality where she worked for two years. She also takes care of the household chores and cares for and educates her children in her free time.  To get to her workplace she has to take a bus and travel about 3 kilometers away. She goes to work at eight in the morning and leaves at three in the afternoon.

The requested loan will be used to remodel her home, specifically what will change is the roof of her house, because it already is a little run down.  The rainy season is close so it needs to be repaired as soon as possible.  She will buy 500 cement tiles and wood lathe. This will allow a better structure and not run the risk that in the rainy season belongings can get wet.

Goals that she has are to have in the future a better job that will generate more income, for her family she wants to have a better house, and for her children to be good people in society and continue to go to school. She is hoping that everything will be fine thanks to the loan and loans that are requested in the future.

loans.use: to replace the roof of her house, to buy 500 cement tiles and wooden lathe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his sewing projects.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja haciendo cuadros para fotografía, tienen  un hijo que está en los Estados Unidos, ellos viven solos, la señora depende de los ingresos del esposo y de remesas que recibe de su hijo. 
María necesita este crédito para hacerse unos exámenes médicos en el pie ya que tuvo una fractura, el crédito le servirá de mucho para mejorar sus condiciones de salud, pues es muy importante tener bienestar, y ella es una señora que necesita muchísimo de la ayuda para que pueda curarse y caminar sin ningún problema.
Ella sueña con que su hijo tenga su propia casa y que pueda trabajar duro y al venir al país tenga donde permanecer con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old. She studied up until the second grade. She is married and her husband works making frames for photography. They currently live alone, as their only son is now living in the United States. María depends on her husband's income, and on remittances from their son.

María needs this loan to get some medical exams done on her foot, which has been broken. The loan will serve her a great deal, it will enable her to get better and walk without a problem. 

Her dream is that one day her son will have his own home and be able to work hard, in order to return to their country and remain there with his family.

loans.use: to have some medical exams done on her broken foot.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima cálido, la mayoría de su población se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivos de frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, maíz amarillo, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 52-years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Pomahuaca District. It is a community with a warm climate whose people make their livings in agriculture. They grow fruit tress, sell produce and raise livestock. The area is located in Jaén Province, which is a part of the Cajamarca Region in Perú's northern mountains.

Sebastián makes his living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee and yellow corn. His wife helps him with the farm work; they are a very united family who work hard for their business. Sebastián has requested a loan of 3 500 nuevos soles ($1250 USD) to purchase compost to support his coffee crop. He will then produce a good product to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase compost to support his coffee crop.

loans.name: José Adrián

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica, está casado desde hace doce años, él vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica.

Desde muy pequeño José inició la labor de agricultura, él aprendió este trabajo por su padre quien cada mañana salía a desempeñar esta labor, José sale de su casa a trabajar desde las 6.00 AM y regresa a las 12.00 del mediodía.

El préstamo que él está solicitando es para comenzar a preparar la tierra para el cultivo de granos básicos, en el cual tiene que pagar mozos para que le ayuden.

A futuro él quiere que su familia permanezca siempre unida y que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro que logren culminar sus estudios académicos y que al final sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He studied until the 2nd grade of elementary school. He has been married for 12 years, and lives with his wife and his two children, who are currently in their basic education (elementary – middle school).

From a young age he started working in agriculture. He learned this activity from his father who every morning would go out to perform that job. José goes to work from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. 

The loan he is requesting is to start preparing the land for the cultivation of staple grains, an activity in which he has to pay the hired labor.

For the future, he wants his family to remain always united, and his children to have a good future by finishing their studies, and become professionals.

loans.use: to start preparing the land for the cultivation of staple grains.

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: En la antigua Grecia nada se sabía de virus y bacterias, Platón remarcaba que la buena educación es la que se reflejaba con fuerza a mejorar la mente juntamente con el cuerpo. Reconociendo, de alguna manera, que la salud corporal conduce a la higiene mental como lo hace Doña Petrona Díaz, una Señora de 48 años de edad, dedicada a su trabajo y su familia nos revela que desea la mejora continua de su humilde vivienda; nos dice que su meta más próxima es hacer una pequeña inversión en su casa para la mejora de la misma; solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un servicio sanitario que presente las mejores condiciones higiénicas que el que posee actualmente; estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que  mejorara las condiciones de salud, higienes y de vida de su familia; teniendo como planes futuros la remodelación sistemática de su vivienda.
texts.en: In ancient Greece, they knew nothing about viruses and bacteria.  Plato remarked that a good education is that which is reflected in improving one's mind together with one's body by recognizing, in some way, that bodily health leads to mental hygiene, as does doña Petrona Díaz.  Doña Petrona is a 48-year old woman dedicated to her work and her family.  She tells us that she wants to continually improve her humble home.  Her next goal is to make a small investment in her home to make some improvements.  She is requesting a loan to build a bathroom of better hygienic condition than the one she currently has.  She feels that the requested loan will be a great help to her, as she will be able to improve the health, hygiene and life conditions of her family.  Her future plans are to systematically remodel her home.

loans.use: to build a bathroom that offers the best in hygienic conditions.

loans.name: Elias Francisco Fermin

texts.es:
Elias tiene 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene una hijo, al cual ha podido sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo gracias a su humilde trabajo como chofer; ya que este oficio es su única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar;  Elias trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque es responsable.

Elias esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar los gastos de estudio de su hijo ya que actualmente estudia enfermería y gracias al apoyo podrá comprar el uniforme, materiales, entre otros; así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ver a su hijo hecho un profesional”.
texts.en:
Elias is 52 and lives in the town of Camana.  He lives with his wife with whom has a son. He struggles get ahead due to his humble job as a driver.  His job is their only source of income to cover the costs of the home.

Elias works about 9 hours a day and believes all will be well because he is responsible.

Elias is grateful to Kiva lenders and, thanks to the help they have given, he can cover the costs of his child's study.  He is currently studying nursing and with support can buy a uniform, materials, etc.thus he can keep fighting to realize his big dream: "To see your child become a professional."

loans.use: To pay for education expenses.

loans.name: Carloman

texts.es:
Carlomán tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, frutales, arroz, al comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,, su esposa se dedica a esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes que le permitan abonar a su cultivo de café y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Carlomán is 55 years old, living in a community of the Pomahuaca district. It is a hot place where the population works in agriculture, especially the cultivation and sale of coffee, fruits, rice; as well as raising cattle. Pomahuaca is located within the Jaen province of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Carlomán is a farmer, focused on the cultivation of coffee. His wife also works as a coffee farmer.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizers which will allow him to nourish his coffee crop. In this way he will be able to offer a higher yield to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers which will enable him to fertilize his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man. He has two children, both of whom attend school. Together with his wife, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a business selling fresh water for the past three years, selling from home to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, since during the rainy season, business is low. 

With the KES 100,000, he wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for his business.

loans.name: Shahla's Group

texts.en:
Shahla is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters. Her children are studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for eight years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shahla is applying for a Kiva group loan with another member from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will allow her to assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Shahla is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
With the KES 10,000, he wants to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kanoatkhon

texts.en: Kanoatkhon was born in 1954. She is widowed and has adult children. She has been busy with sewing for four years because she needed money. Kanoatkhon sews women's national dresses in her house. Thanks to good service she has her own clients. She works hard from early morning till late night. She is ill now. She must buy medicines for treatment but she doesn't have money. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Group

texts.en:
Puspa is a married woman, 47 years old, who lives in a remote village called Mangalapali in the Subarnapur district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the front row, second from left with her hand raised is Puspa.  She lives with her four-member family (including her husband and two sons who are 3 and 13 years old).  She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to getting her family ahead. 

Puspa has been doing a milk business with her husband in her village for the last 10 years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased a cow. Gradually, she expanded her business and added one cow every year. In 2014, Puspa, along with 11 other members of her village, formed a group and took a loan of Rs 16,000 each from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan for her group. Now she is earning 7,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scanty to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business in his village. So from this loan, she has purchased a cow to sell milk, thereby increasing her income. Puspa has a long cherished desire to build a stall of her own and educate her children in a better school.
 
Other members of her group are doing a milk business, vegetable vending, goat rearing, grocery shop etc.

loans.use: to purchased a cow for selling milk

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Riffat is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband towards managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en: Muyassar is a smart woman. She is widowed and has three children. She is the only food provider for her children. Three months ago, Muyassar began a business selling dried fruits. She sells dried fruits in a local market where she has her own selling place. Muyassar wants to develop her new business. She took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a woman's organization and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy dried fruits to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to sell

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marvin Antonio es un señor de 58 años que habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida.
Tiene más de treinta años de dedicarse a la profesión de Maestro de primaria donde tiene gran experiencia en este oficio ya que desde muy joven inició a laborar para ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar porque descienden de una familia muy pobre y humilde.
Don Marvin con gran esfuerzo construyó su casita la que ha ido mejorando al paso de los años y con la ayuda de los créditos que le ha financiado Kiva a través de Ceprodel donde les agradece por este apoyo que es muy importante sobre todo para las personas asalariadas.
Don Marvin en este momento está necesitando un crédito para gastos médicos con el que piensa comprar medicamentos y realización de exámenes para mejorar la salud de su esposa.
Confía en Dios y en los inversionistas de Kiva para que le sigan apoyando con estos créditos.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio, 58, lives in El Sauce, a place he has lived all his life.  He has been a teacher in a primary school for more than 30 years and has a lot of experience.  He started working when he was young so he could help his mother with the household expenses, as his family was very poor and humble. 
 
With a lot of effort, Marvin was able to build his own home which he has gradually improved over the years.  He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the loans that they have given him, especially as he has a paid job.

At the moment, Marvin needs a loan to be able to buy medicine and to pay for some health checks for his wife.

He believes in God and hopes Kiva investors will continue to offer their support.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for health checks.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: Faida is a hardworking lady. She has managed to run her business well, and she appreciates the support of the previous loan. She is requesting a loan again, to buy 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Ana Marleny tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores patos, pavos, gallos y gallinas, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, realiza esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Marleny, 44, lives with her husband and children in Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.  In this community where the climate is variable, the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Ana Marleny raises small animals such as ducks, turkeys, hens and chickens in some land at the back of her house.  She does this so she can earn a living and contribute to household expenses.  

She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles so she can buy some formulated feed to fatten up her animals and sell them at a better price to her customers.  This in turn will help her generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy formulated feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is a lady who works hard to ensure her family stays well and comfortable. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support of the previous loan. Now she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy one bale of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Eusebia Antonia

texts.es:
Eusebia de 54 años de edad,  no estudió ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos necesarios para darle sus estudios, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de ganado , ella tiene a su cargo  1 hija de 24 años la cual le apoya con los oficios domésticos.

Actualmente Eusebia se dedica a la venta de pupusas los días sábados y domingos  de lo cual obtiene los ingresos para los gastos del hogar, la señora adquirió los conocimientos desde sus 14 años de edad, pues lo aprendió de su madre  y su hija es la única que se involucra en el trabajo.

Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera y 2 cerdos para sacar el producto de la leche para elaborar queso para vender, y los cerdos engordarlos para luego comercializarlos.

Sus sueños son obtener un buen rendimiento de la vaca ya que es muy importante para ella para la alimentación de su familia y apoyar a sus hija para que puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 54 years old, and she never studied because her parents did not have the necessary resources to send her to school. Today she is married and her husband works in agriculture and selling livestock. In her care she has one daughter who is 24 years old, who helps her with the household chores. 

Currently Eusebia works selling pupusas (a stuffed tortilla) on Saturdays and Sundays, from which she earns money for the household expenses. She adquired this knowledge when she was 14 years old when she learned it from her mother, and her daughter is the only one included in this work. 


Eusebia will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and 2 pigs so she can use the milk to make cheese to sell, and fatten up the pigs to sell them later. 


Her dream is to have a good output from the cow since it is very important to her to feed her family and support her daughter so they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and two pigs.

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es:
Sara de 40 años de edad, reside desde hace diez años donde ahora vive con su familia, es originaria de otro municipio donde creció trabajando en la caficultura y la siembra de granos básicos desde pequeña, es madre de cinco hijos uno de los cuales estudia el nivel básico en la comunidad, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ganadería y además hace viajes en un vehículo a la ciudad y con ella viven sus cinco hijos.
Sara no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a los problemas de la guerra que vivió el país en los años ochentas.
Ella trabaja en la comercialización de ropa, negocio que emprendió hace diez años gracias a que una de sus primas le enseñó, ella vende los días sábados y domingos en la ciudad y lugares aledaños  a la zona donde reside, y va a la ciudad a comprar la mercadería cada 15 días, también los días de semana vende atol, enchiladas, tostadas, yuca, pan y otros antojitos de donde obtiene ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a su familia, ella trabaja sola, a veces su hija le ayuda a vender en la comunidad, además vende productos de lencerías y lo hace a través de revistas para luego hacer los pedidos y entregárselo a los clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito en CrediCampo para comprar una vaca, el resto del dinero lo necesita  para comprar ropa para todas las edades, de donde pretende seguir obteniendo buenos resultados económicos para su familia.
Ella sueña con tener su propio local en la ciudad que le permita en el futuro instalar su negocio fijo, además está con toda la disposición de seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
40-year old Sara has lived in her present home with her family for ten years. Before that she lived in another municipality where she grew up. She has grown coffee and other grains ever since she was young. Sara has five children, one of whom studies at the local school. All still live with her. Her husband works in agriculture raising animals and making journeys into the town in his vehicle. Sara didn't have the opportunity to go to school because of the war which took place in her country in the 80s.

Sara sells clothing. She learned about the business ten years ago when one of cousins taught her. She works on Saturdays and Sundays in the town and neighboring communities. She travels into town twice monthly to buy the merchandise.

Also during the week Sara sells atol (drink made from corn), enchiladas, toast, yucca, bread and other snacks. The money she earns helps support her family. Generally she works alone but sometimes her daughter helps her with sales in the community. Sara also sells underwear from catalogs. She takes orders and then delivers the items to her customers.

Sara is seeking a loan from CrediCampo to buy a cow as well as clothing for all age groups. She hopes to continue getting a good income for her family. Her dream is to have her own premises in the town so in the future she will have a permanent location for her business. She also hopes to continue supporting her children with their education.

loans.use: Buy a cow and clothing for all age groups

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 6 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de calaminas para construir y techar los corrales donde se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvia, 40, lives with her husband and children in Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.  In this community the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Elvia raises and sells pigs, a profession she has had for more than six years.  She raises them on some land at the back of her house.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy corrugated metal sheets to build a roof for the barn where she houses her pigs.  This will help her to improve her business and offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to build a roof for the barn where she raises her animals.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en:
Shoista is married and has a child who is little. She has always wanted to provide her family with a good quality of life. Shoista is going to start a new business in sewing. She is a good seamstress. She took the course "To Get Ahead," from a women's organization, and gained enough skills for her business. She will manage the business alone. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart.

Shoista is asking for a loan of 1500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine to start her new business. She will get through, using her loan, and her business will grow to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Gayatree Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is a married woman, 30 years old, who lives in a remote village called Sibtula in the Subarnapur district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the front line first from left showing a loan file is Sasmita.  She lives with her family of four including her husband and two sons who are eight and six years old. She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead. 

Sasmita has been doing a milk business with her husband in her village for the last 10 years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased a cow. Gradually, she expanded her business and added one cow every year. In 2014, Sasmita, along with the other 13 members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan of her group. Now she is earning 7,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scant to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business in his village. With this loan, she has purchased a cow for selling milk, thereby increasing her income. Sasmita has a long cherished desire to build a cattle shed of her own and educate her children in a better school. 

The other members of her group are doing a milk business, vending vegetables, raising goats, running a grocery shop, a hotel, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk

loans.name: Yajaira Sayuri

texts.es:
Yajaira Sayuri tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, chileno y otros desde hace 02 años aproximadamente, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yajaira Sayuri, 21, lives with her husband and children in Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.  In this community the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

She has been selling vegetables, chileno peppers and other things for about two years now.  She works from home.  She is asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy more vegetables to sell to her clients and improve her income so she can help support her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to offer her customers.

loans.name: Manuel Eloy

texts.es:
Manuel Eloy tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura y al servicio de mototaxi desde hace más de 2 años, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una carpa y llantas para su vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel Eloy, 23, lives in Buenos Aires in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.  In this community, where the climate is warm, the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Manuel works in agriculture and also has a taxi service, which he has had for two years.  He takes customers to the villages near to his area.  He is asking for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy a hood and some wheels for his vehicle so he can offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a hood and wheels for his vehicle.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Bajo la sombra de los imponentes arboles de Estelí, la Joven Sandra Castellón de 35 años de edad, madre de un solo hijo, dedicada al oficio de modista ha comprendido que la salud y la higiene en su familia, de ella y de su clientes es importante para crecer como personas; ella solicita un crédito para la construcción de un servicio sanitario que presente todas las condiciones higiénicas pertinentes para los clientes que visitan su negocio; estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de gran utilidad ya que podrá brindar un mayor y mejor servicio a sus clientes. Teniendo como sus planes a futuros una inversión en su local para la ampliación del mismo e ir incrementando su producción y su crecimiento en ventas.
texts.en:
Underneath the shade of the imposing trees of Esteli, Sandra Castellon, 35, and mother of one son, works as a dressmaker.  She firmly believes that good sanitation for herself, her family and her customers is important.  She is asking for a loan to build a bathroom with all the necessary conveniences for customers to use when they visit her business.  

She believes that his loan will help her offer a better service.  In the future she would like to invest more in her establishment and build an extension which will also help her increase her production and generate more income.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with all the necessary conveniences for her customers.

loans.name: José Fredys

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato en su comunidad, actualmente está casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian educación básica  y su esposa se dedica a trabajar en la costura.

José se dedica al comercio de ganado, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que aprendió de su amigo, su fuente de ingreso depende de la compra y venta de ganado, él también trabaja en la agricultura, él siembra de maíz y fríjol, y el lugar le queda a una distancia de 2 Km. de su casa lo cual viaja en una motocicleta que adquirió hace 2 años. 

El préstamo lo invertirá para comprar ganado para pastarlos y luego venderlos para seguir comprando mas ganado y  obtener ganancias y mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida para darle a sus hijos los estudios. 

Sus planes son trabajar fuerte con el negocio de ganado para mejorar y sacar adelante a sus hijos para que puedan superarse con sus estudios.
texts.en:
