Jose, 34, finished high school in his community and is now married with three children who are studying at school.  His wife is a dressmaker.

Jose has been raising cattle for four years.  He learnt this trade from a friend.  His income depends on him buying and selling cattle, although he also works in agriculture, growing corn and frijoles beans.  His place of work is 2 km away from his home and he travels there on a motorcycle that he bought two years ago.  

He will use the loan to buy cattle so he can graze them and then sell them.  In this way he can continue to generate an income and improve the standard of living for his family and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cattle for grazing and selling.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is a repeat client of IMON. She has a good credit story. She used her previous loans to develop her business. Gulbahor is married and has 3 children. 

She began her own business selling dried fruits 18 years ago. She buys dried fruits from other regions and sells in a local market of her region. Her husband helps her managing the business. She has her own selling place in a local market. 

Gulbahor wants to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 4,800 Somoni to buy dried fruits. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is 45 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well as some of his relatives who like to purchase items from his General Store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town - that is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Ramzana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

Ramzana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.  for general store.

loans.name: Inayat

texts.en:
Inayat is a 45-year-old married lady. Her son just started a business; he sells various chemicals, bleach and acids.

He is a poor person and does not have a sufficient amount to fully stock his shop. Inayat wants to financially help her son in the form of a loan. Therefore, Inayat reached out to the nearest branch of BRAC and requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She hopes that her son will use this loan in a positive way and could establish his business soon. Inayat  thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, acids and bleach to sell.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 32-year-old woman, and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession, he sells vegetables e.g. tomatoes, onions, potatoes and etc. He is alone responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Musarat's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a suitable condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.

Therefore Musarat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Babiy

texts.en:
Babiy is 36 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan from Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a leather merchant, he has been doing his business for past ten years. He is alone responsible for providing for the entire household. 

Babiy's husband wants to purchase leather in bulk for reselling purposes. But due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy leather to re-process it and for reselling purposes. Therefore Babiy has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can financially assist her husband to buy leather for his business purposes. This loan amount will also be helpful for him to increase the size of his business. 

Babiy is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather in bulk for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi operates a fish-selling business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 100,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale to add to her stock. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale to add to her stock.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is 34; she is living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a greengrocer by profession and has sold fresh vegetables in the nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers from his shop. He has been feeding his family through the income he generates from this business. Nowadays the needs of the family suddenly increased and they do not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current enterprise. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so he can maximize his sales.

Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy extra seasonal vegetables.

Sobia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. 

For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Kousar is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly operates a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future and she appreciates the previous loan

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Besides the water selling business, Mwanamisi sells shoes and handbags from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy shoes and handbags for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is a farmer from Hartashen village of Syunik region. She lives together with her husband. 

Armenuhi is used to be engaged in agriculture and she grows barley and grass. Armenuhi keeps livestock which includes cows, pigs and piglets. Armenuhi's husband sells the harvest and dairy products through the re-sellers or in the wholesale market. The loan that Armenuhi has requested will be a huge support for the development of their farm. She asks this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to increase their livestock by four calves and 10 colonies of bees. 

Armenuhi has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Armenuhi has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for four calves and 10 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a small gas station in which he sells LPG to the rickshaw drivers. In his area, a lot of people drive vehicles and there is high demand for gasoline as well, so he decided to open a gas station so he can earn maximum profit. 

Because of the rapid increase in the demand of LPG, he wants to buy more gas cylinders so that he can easily fulfill the demand. For this reason, Rubina has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. In this way her husband can easily cope with the demand and can maximize his net income.

Rubina is very pleased with this cooperation; she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy LPG cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 29-year-old married woman. Her husband has been providing transportation services by using a moto rickshaw. This rickshaw is being driven over local roads to cover small distances. Its body is made of polyester which is not strong enough to bear the jerks over the roads. Now the rickshaw’s body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy new body for his moto rickshaw.

She has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the rickshaw body and can drive it smoothly. Asia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a supply business, buying and selling groceries like sugar, salt, sweets, and snacks to local retailers for the last 5 months. 

In her free time, Winnie serves as the Chairperson of her District Cama Chapter, a network of Camfed alumnae who strive to better their communities. Winnie also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in local schools where she teaches children health and hygiene care. 

With the loan from Kiva, Winnie will be able to make bulk purchases of groceries in order to increase sales. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business and create more employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Salomu

texts.en:
Salomu is a 22-year-old businesswoman living in Mbire, a district in rural Zimbabwe. She is married and a mother of one. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. Salomu also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur where she operates a grocery shop selling food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, maize-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary. Salomu has been running her business for a year now and has managed to employ two people during that time. She is very proud that the business has enabled her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Salomu will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her supplies. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband has been running a small furniture shop in a nearby town. He sells furniture items like sofas, beds, chairs, tables, safe almirahs, etc. He is also a good trained carpenter as well, so, he, himself makes different designed furniture items in his shop. 

People in the area like his furniture items very much. He sells furniture at very reasonable rates that is why his number of customers increases rapidly. He made a plan to increase his furniture shop business. He wants to buy prepared furniture stock like sofas, beds, wooden chairs, etc. to resell. 

Basheeran is applying for a loan from Kiva and its field partner for her husband's work. Basheeran is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy prepared furniture stock like sofas, beds and wooden chairs to resell.

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik is from Khot village where he lives with his mother and grandmother. 

Hovik is a student. His family runs a small farm and the income from it helps his family to sustain their living.

It is very hard for them to save money for Hovik's education, but they do their best to give him higher education degree.

By requesting this loan Hovik asks lenders to support him with his university tuition. It will be a great support for Hovik and his whole family and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en:
Fahima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000. She wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ángel Orlando

texts.es:
Ángel de 19 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. 
Él trabaja de agricultor y ganadero,actividad que sus padres le enseñaron y las circunstancias lo hicieron dejar el estudio para poder trabajar y ayudar a su familia. 
Ángel necesita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería, comprará abono y fertilizantes pues ya viene el tiempo de la cosecha y necesita mucho de la ayuda. 
Él planea trabajar y sacar  adelante a su familia y hacer un patrimonio para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Angel, 19, is single and lives with his parents.  He works in agriculture and livestock farming which he learned from his parents.  He was unable to continue his education because of the circumstances and had to help his family.

Angel is in need of a loan for his work.  He will buy compost and fertilizers since the harvest season is approaching and he very much needs the help.

He is planning to work and provide for his family, and save enough to continue his education.

loans.use: To work in agriculture and livestock farming, buying compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Caroline has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 41-year-old married woman. 

She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses she started embroidering at home. A supplier provides her with raw materials for knitting embroidery; she completes her tasks alongside her daughters, over a wooden frame. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy raw material of her own so she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan to buy raw material so she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and generate maximum income. 

She is a mother of three daughters and a son. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide quality education for her children.

Note: Zahida is wearing black clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Dadirai

texts.en:
Dadirai is a 23-year-old businesswoman living in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about protecting the environment so she volunteers at local clinics and organizes cleaning campaigns. Additionally, she offers psycho-social support to young people in her community. As an entrepreneur, Dadirai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for four years and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Dadirai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more bags and clothes.

loans.name: Roberto Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladado a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevo soles para la compra de repuestos y una carpa para su mototaxi y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel, 30, lives with his wife and children in the district of Buenos Aires.  It is a community with a warm climate where the local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Manuel provides a public transportation service with his own mototaxi and carries passengers to the neighboring rural communities in the district.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy spare parts and a top for his mototaxi so he can provide better customer service.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a top for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo Adolfo  de 27 años de edad,  tiene tres hijos que depende de él, vive con su esposa, tiene casa propia  se dedica desde hace seis  años al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción.
Don Gustavo tiene una volqueta donde transporta arena, piedra, tierra, grava, sus clientes son los amigos que construyen y personas que son contratista de construcción, El se levanta muy temprano a realizar su trabajo ya que el recibe su pago de acuerdo con los viajes que haga.
Don Gustavo esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de un pequeño tanque para acarrear agua potable para venderla a los lugares que no tiene agua potable, con el apoyo de este crédito El pretende  comprar este tanque para tener otros ingresos.
Don Gustavo su sueño es mejorar su volqueta por una mas nueva, para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Gustavo Adolfo, 27, lives with his wife and three dependent children in their own house.  For six years, he has been in the business of selling construction materials.

Gustavo has a dump truck and transports sand, rocks, earth, and gravel.  His customers are friends who work in construction or are contractors.  He gets up very early in the moring to do his job since he is paid depending on the number of trips he makes.

Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy a small tank to carry drinking water to sell it in places where there is no drinking water.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the tank and earn extra income.

His goal is to buy a new truck some day so he can earn more income and give his family better living conditions.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2014

loans.use: To buy a small tank to carry drinking water.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sikoroni dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sikoroni. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates, choux et persils), produits cosmétiques, pommes de terre et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates, choux et persils). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomates, 6 sacs de choux, 3 corbeilles de persils  à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djénèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The seven women of Danaya Group all live in polygamous households. They average 36 years of age and four children. All live in Sikoroni, a neighborhood in Bamako District.

The got to know each other through bonds of community and through their money-earning businesses at the Sikoroni market. They retail condiments (tomatoes, cabbages, and parsley), cosmetics, potatoes, and clothing.

In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Djénèba is the woman sitting in the center in the photograph. She's very well renowned as a seller of condiments (tomatoes, cabbages, parsley). She intends to use her loan to buy, wholesale in Bamako, 4 baskets of tomatoes, 6 sacks of cabbages, and 3 baskets of parsley.

She resells for cash and on credit, at the market and as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mostly women. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, to be reinvested in her business and used to provide for her children and household.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, and parsley

loans.name: Lahidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Lahidou est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  dans le quartier de Sikoroni dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies de meilleures qualités et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Niamè (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des friperies de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies  en gros au marché. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Niamè espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
Lahidou Group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional and nuclear families. They average 45 years of age and six children. All live in Sikoroni, a neighborhood in Bamako District, and got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. 

They sell quality secondhand clothing and condiments. In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Niamè is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's renowned as a seller of best-quality secondhand clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothing wholesale at the market.

She retails at the market and as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mainly women. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, to be reinvested in her business and used to provide for her children's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Juan Evasio

texts.es:
Juan Evasio tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una ciudad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando el ganado lechero para ofrecer a su leche y venta de quesillos, son una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para mayor producción de leche para su ganado y de esta manera tener una producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Evasio, 56, lives with his wife and children in the districto of Morropon which has a warm climate.  The local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in located in the Morropon Province which belongs to the Piura Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Juan works in livestock farming and agriculture and his wife helps by milking the cows to sell milk and cheese.  They are a very close family.  He is requesting 1,000 pen to buy balanced animal feed to increase milk production for his customers.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed to produce more milk.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village in Khobi district with her parents, husband and two children. Her parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have three cows, two calves and a horse. Nino milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and haricot is grown. Nino is very a hardworking woman and does her best by helping her family to ensure a good harvest. Nino decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 Gel. With the received credit she will go to Turkey and purchase clothes to resell. The Start Up program will be a great support to the family. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin reselling clothes.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DJELI /SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, des produits divers et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  5ème  prêt solidaire. SALY  femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10Kg de riz, 10Kg de fonio, 15Kg de pomme de terre, 20Litres d’huile, 5Kg de Sel, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group average 42 years of age with three children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Djeli/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family and have small businesses buying and selling cereals, condiments and other diverse products. Having repaid in full their previous loans, the women of the Danaya group are on their fifth group loan.

Saly, who is standing in the middle of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 10kg of rice, 10kg of fonio, 15kg of potatoes, 20 liters of oil, 5kg of salt and two packets of Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers and sells her products to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credt.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 26,000FCFA, which will be used partly for health-related expenses with the rest to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur  10ème  prêt solidaire. MASSICE 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 rouleau de Bazin, 20 bracelets en caoutchouc, 10 paires de boucle d’oreille et 5 colliers en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group average 35 years of age with four children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family and have small businesses buying and selling condiments, cereals and other diverse products. Having repaid in full their previous loans, the women of the Djiguisseme group are on their tenth group loan.

Massice, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy one roll of damask fabric, 20 rubber bracelets, 10 pairs of earrings and five rubber necklaces. She gets her supplies in Bamako and sells for cash and often on credit to a customer base made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, which will be used partly for health-related expenses and food, with the rest to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne  37ans, 4enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DJELI/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire. TATOU 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group average 37 years of age with four children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Djeli/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region. These women got to know each other through family and have small businesses buying and selling cereals and other diverse products. Having repaid in full their previous loans, the women of the Djiguiya group are on their fifth group loan.

Tatou, who is standing on the far right of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy ten cartons of soap. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers and sells her products to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000FCFA, which will be used partly for health-related expenses, food, clothing and school fees, with the rest to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She lives in a rented house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

For over two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase kids wear clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy firewood for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy firewood for her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a twenty-four-year-old mother of two living in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization.  As a member of Cama, she provides counselling services to young people facing challenges in her community. To earn an income, Rosemary operates a grocery shop selling cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (coarse flour made from maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, and sweets. Rosemary also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur.
 
She will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available. Rosemary hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to buy more cooking supplies

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2010, Akossiwa âgée de 41ans a pour mari un photographe et mère de 02 enfants scolarisés. Elle s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et son second crédit lui permettra d'augmenter des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa, who has been selling groceries since 2010, is 41 years old and has a husband, who is a photographer, and two children who are at school. She gets her supplies from Lomé's Grand Market and her second loan will enable her to increase her stock of groceries. She would like to increase her turnover and ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Shirakavan village. She has one son (sixteen) and one daughter (twenty-one). For the last fifteen years, Marine and her husband have run a farm. Marine and her husband manage to provide their family with normal living conditions. By applying for this loan, Marine asks for financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to enlarge her farming business. 

The loan of USD 1,500 will help her to purchase barley seeds, fuel and cover cultivation costs. Marine previously took a loan from a local financial institution but was unable to pay it back on time because of very difficult financial conditions. Now, by showing that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Marine has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, fuel and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells precious stones for use in making necklaces and bridal dresses. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case to attract the customers.
  
The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living. He wants to renovate his house but in order to do this, he needs to earn more. Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can increase his inventory and earnings as well.

She hopes that they will be able renovate their house soon because their elder son needs to marry. Balqees is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope for fulfilling her desires.

loans.use: to buy precious stones for reselling.

loans.name: Letween

texts.en:
Letween is a 22-year-old business woman living in Mbire, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counselling services to young people facing challenges at a local community centre. 

Letween also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. As an entrepreneur, Letween operates a grocery shop selling food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary. She has been running her business for a year now and has managed to employ two people during that time and provide for her family.

Letween will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter-in-law in the Senaki district of Georgia. The only source of income for the family is small salary of her husband, who works in transportation. 

Eka decided to start her own business and generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 300 to purchase household goods. She will purchase the goods from the wholesalers and then resell at higher price among her villagers. This will give her a chance to generate income and to cover everyday expenses. Eka awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 19-years-old and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. In order to be financially independent, Mercy started her own supply business buying and selling clothing to local residents. 

To give back to her community, she also serves as a member of Cama, a network of Camfed Alumni. As a volunteer in local schools, she serves as an inspiration to other young girls. 

With this Kiva loan, Mercy will be able to purchase clothes in bulk and increase her sales. Mercy hopes that increased profits will allow her to expand her business as well as pay the tuition fees for her younger siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her child and food for the family.

For the past three years, Rukiya has operated a business selling dumplings from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that Rukiya is requesting, she wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 35-year-old married woman from Rafah. She is a mother of seven children. She works as an employee in the public sector where she earns a low income. 

She would like to have another source of income, so she wants to buy a rickshaw and rent it out to a worker who wants to use it to earn an income. Sumaya took a loan from FATEN to buy a new rickshaw so she can rent it out. 

By taking this loan, Sumaya will be able to have another source of income for the family. 

Sumaya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman who has four children, three of whom are adults and one is still in school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanakombo has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the last 15 years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business.
 
With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is married with six children who go to school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the near future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of beans,wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal, cooking oil, sugar and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beans,wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal ,cooking oil, sugar and rice for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for three sons and one daughter, all of whom are under 10 years old. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income due to the economical situation. He would like to have another source of income, so he wants to buy a rickshaw and start work on it. 

Ali took a US loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw and start working on transferring goods in the local market. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to work another job and have another source of income to the family.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw and start working on transferring goods in the local market.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and one daughter. He works as a taxi driver in the city where he gets a low and unstable income. He would like to have another source of income, so he wants to buy a rickshaw and start working on it. 

Kefah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw and start working on transfarring goods in the local market. By taking this loan, Kefah will be able to work another job and have another source of income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw and start working on transfarring goods in the local market

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her two children in Arevik village. Her husband has had to leave the country as a migrant worker to try to find a well paid job. Gayane herself teaches at a local school. She is a teacher with many years of experience. Besides teaching Gayane also runs a farm. Now, when her husband is not in the country she has to manage the farm alone. She cultivates wheat, barley, potato and garlic. Gayane also keeps a cow, 2 calves and 20 chickens. 

Gayane requested this loan of USD 2,500 to be able to enrich her farm. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Gayane has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and barley and potato seeds.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married mother of two children, who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is 35 years old. He is a single man and lives with his family in Taiz city, Yemen. Due to the bad conditions in the country, Fouad studied until the secondary school, but unfortunately, he couldn't complete his studies. He is very active and dynamic man. Despite his miserable conditions, Fouad didn't surrender to them. 

Over time, he accumulated a good amount of money and then he began his own business, opening a store to sell products for the home in the city. He started up in his business for more than four years ago. From this business, he earns a good profit, but he says that his capital is still small and the goods inside the store decrease daily. 

For this reason, Fouad applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase more materials and goods to increase the capital of the store.

Fouad looks forward to expanding his business through opening other branches. His dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and goods for the store.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 29-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a chef by profession; he provides services cooking food for marriage ceremonies, parties and funfair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken & fish and from sweet dishes he prepares firni and kheer. He is very famous chef in his town and most of the people like get him to cook food for their ceremonies. Sometimes he has to cook many dishes at a time, and as a result he has a problem due to a shortage of cauldrons. 

Therefore Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new cauldron, spices and fire wood for cooking food.

loans.use: To buy a cauldron, spices and fire wood for a cooking business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 800 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balaceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la construcción de corrales para distribuir de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
35-year-old Elías lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún in Chiclayo province, which forms part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people there work in farming, trade and cattle rearing. 

Elías and his wife have been breeding and selling animals such as cocks, hens and chickens for 5 years and they run their business from their home. Elías has applied for a loan of 1,800 nuevos soles to buy formulated feed to fatten up his animals and also to build coops to accommodate his animals better.

loans.use: to buy formulated feeds to fatten up his animals and also to build coops.

loans.name: Allakaben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ALLAKABEN ont en moyenne  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KANCENE/SEGOU.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ALLAKABEN sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire. AMINATA 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 130Kg de graine d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Allakaben group have an average of 35 and, on average, 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in Kancec/Ségou. The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and buy and sell cereals. Having correctly repaid their previous loan, the women of the Allakaben group are on their second group loan.

Aminata, standing on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 130 kilos of groundnuts. She gets her supplies locally and in the neighbouring villages. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs which will be spent on healthcare and educational expenses and reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Mojahed

texts.en:
Mojahed is a 22-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Two years ago, he and his friend started their project, which is a cart selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. They buy their products from the local farmers; it is a very good business and earns a good income. 

Mojahed and his friend would like to improve their business and expand it. 

Mojahed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help them to buy a small stall instead of the cart. 

By taking this loan, Mojahed will be able to improve his business and increase the sales. 

Mojahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a small stall instead of the cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en:
Wesam is a 35-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and four kids, three sons and one daughter, in a small humble house in the city. Wesam's husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income to the family.
 
Wesam and her husband would like to improve the family living conditions by buying all the needed stuff. 

Wesam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water purification machine for her home. 

By taking this loan, Wesam will be able to provide clean water for her family. 

Wesam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su propia casa en el Caserío Nueva Esperanza, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en La Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace un año, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglos de su corral, compra de calamina, adobe y de esta manera tener un lugar amplio para la crianza de sus animales.
texts.en:
23-year-old Wilmer lives with his wife and children in their own home in the village of Nueva Esperanza. This is a rural area in the district of Oyotún in Chiclayo province, which forms part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people there work in agriculture, trade and cattle rearing.
Wilmer and his wife have been breeding and selling farmyard animals for a year.  Wilmer has applied for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to invest in improvements to his farmyard; he will buy calamine and adobe to build a bigger area in which to breed his animals.

loans.use: to buy calamine and adobe to build a bigger area in which to breed his animals

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites competition as her major challenge in her business. 

She is requesting Kshs 20,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. 

She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sikidia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIKIDIA ont en moyenne  28ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à ATT BOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (laquatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des légumes et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIKIDIA sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire. MAGNINI 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 panier de tomate, 10Kg d’oignon, 25Kg de Sel, 25Kg de riz, 20Kg de fonio, 10Kg de haricot et 10Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sikidia group have an average of 28 and, on average, 3 children and all live in traditional extended families in Att Bougou, one of the districts of San/Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and buy and sell condiments, vegetables and cereals. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Allakaben group are on their 5th group loan.

Magnini, standing second on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 1 basket of tomatoes, 10 kilos of onions, 25 kilos of salt, 25 kilos of rice, 25 kilos of fonio, 10 kilos of beans and 10 litres of oil. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 26 000 francs which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and educational expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr: Affiwa âgée de 34ans vit à LOME. Elle revend dans une boutique des produits cosmétiques (déodorants, des défrisants et autres...). Le troisième crédit qu'elle sollicite à WAGES lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de clients. Elle espère réinvestir dans son activité et assurer son bien être.
texts.en: Affiwa is 34 years old and lives in Lomé. She sells beauty products (deodorants, hair straighteners, etc.) in a shop. The third loan that she is requesting from WAGES will enable her to restock on merchandise so that she can meet her customer demand. She hopes to be able to reinvest in her business and to ensure her well-being.

loans.use: to buy deodorant and soap.

loans.name: Deeb

texts.en:
Deeb is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city; he lives with his wife and three sons. 

Deeb has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business, but seasonal. He buys his products from the wholesalers and resells them. Deeb would like to expand his business and open in a store in the future.

Deeb took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes to sell. 

By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his sales, and also his income. 

Deeb appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en:
Aashi is 38 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services by using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Aashi has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Aashi thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is a mother of six children, five daughters and a son. Together with her husband, they are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock (cows, calves, chickens and bees) and cultivate land (corn, haricots and potatoes).

Besides their farm, Marusya's husband also takes care of local villagers' colonies of bees. The income that he gathers is vital for this big family's living.
 
Marusya applied for this loan of USD 1,200 to be able to purchase five more colonies of bees for their farm. 

She would like to enlarge the production of honey, and be able to gather more income for her family's living.

As this is Marusya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for five colonies of bees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in an old house in the city. 

Three years ago, Ahmad started working on the family land, where he plants seasonal crops. He uses green houses to ensure he has good quality.
 
Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seed, seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his land and increase productivity. 

Ahmad appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of cloth trading; she buys cloths of different varieties from the wholesale market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. 

She has requested a loan of Rs. 55,000 to purchase a variety of cloth in different colors and materials, according to the season and by taking in account the taste and choice of her customers. 

According to Naseem, Kashf has changed her whole life by providing financial support, providing financial literacy training which helps her in getting awareness in every field of life, and has also improved her decision making power.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair products for his store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 21-year-old entrepreneur currently residing in Mbire District, Zimbabwe with her husband. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She also provides counseling services to young people facing challenges in her community. When Jennifer is not volunteering her time, she is an entrepreneur who operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (coarse flour made from maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, and sweets. She has been running the business for the past year now and is very proud of the progress she has made so far. 

Jennifer will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock and adding more shelves to increase capacity. She hopes to grow the business and be in a better position to support her family and vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her stock and add more shelves.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana María es una señora de 54 años originaria del municipio de El Sauce, madre soltera de dos hijos que con sacrificio los educó sola sin el apoyo del padre con su salario de maestra de primaria profesión que todavía ejerce en una escuela de una comunidad cercana al municipio.
Juanita como es conocida cariñosamente en el pueblo ha sido muy trabajadora y se ha esforzado por preparar a su hijo menor que es el que actualmente está estudiando la carrera de medicina, por ser una carrera muy costosa con gran dificultad lo está logrando porque está en el último año de su carrera y con el salario bajo que se gana en Nicaragua que apenas alcanza para la canasta básica.
Por este motivo se siente muy agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva porque a través de Ceprodel le han ayudado con los diferentes préstamos que le han otorgado con los cuales ha mejorado su casa y otros los ha invertido en los estudios de su hijo.
En este momento solicita para la compra de zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra con el fin de ponerle el techo a un cuarto que construyó.
texts.en:
Juana María is 54 years old and originally for the El Sauce municipality. Juana is a single mother to two children whom, with sacrifice, she has brought up with no help from the father. Juana brought up her children on her salary as a primary teacher, a profession in which she still works at a community school near her town.

As Juana is known and loved by the locals, she has been hard-working and has put in the effort to prepare her youngest son who is now studying medicine. This is a very expensive degree and Juana is only able to pay for it with great difficulty. Her son is now in his final year but with her low salary, Juana is barely able to cover the cost of necessities.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva  investors as, through "Ceprodel", they have helped her with different loans, allowing her to improve her home and to invest in her son's education.

On this occasion, Juana is applying for a loan in order to buy zinc, purlins and nails and to pay for labourers with the aim of putting a roof on the room she has built.

loans.use: to buy zinc, purlins and nails and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de helados cuyos sabores son de fresa, vainilla, chocolate, coco y lúcuma, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de helados para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 44 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province of Lambayeque region in Peru's northern coast. Here the climate is varied and the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and running businesses.

Fernando makes a living selling ice-creams, including chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, coconut and "lúcuma" (a fruit common in Peru) flavours. Fernando runs the business out of his home. He is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a larger quantity of ice creams to sell to customers and to earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of ice creams to sell to customers.

loans.name: Milton Ronald

texts.es:
Milton tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado en el cantón, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene una hija de 1 año de edad la cual está al cuidado de su madre y nadie mas depende de él.
 
Milton se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y fríjol, él siembra una hectárea de maíz y de frijol, él aprendió la actividad con apoyo de su padre quien le brindó el conocimiento.

El préstamo lo invertirá en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, comprará 3,500 tejas de barro, pagará 2 viajes de transporte de la teja, y pagará la mano de obra, el préstamo le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida para él  y su familia ya que su hija tiene 1 año necesita un  lugar mas seguro y pronto se acerca el invierno.

Milton sueña con seguir mejorando su casa y trabajar con su esposa para que a su hija no le falte bienestar y educación.
texts.en:
Milton is 23 years old and completed up to ninth grade at the local school. Milton has a partner - a housewife - and they have a one-year-old daughter, who is looked after by her mother. Milton has no other dependents.

Milton works in farming, growing basic grains such as corn and beans. Milton grows his crops on one hectare of land and learned the trade from his father.

This loan will used to improve Milton's home: he will buy 3500 mud tiles, pay for transportation of the tiles, pay labourers, and thus will be able to improve his living conditions for his family and himself. Milton's daughter is just one year old and needs a safer place to live as winter is approaching.

Milton dreams of continuing to make improvements to his house and of working with his wife so that his daughter needs for nothing in her well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy 3500 mud tiles, pay for transportation of the tiles, pay labourers, and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Aaisha

texts.en:
Aaisha is 44 years old, married, and has five children. She sells milk, which she has been doing for 12 years. She has one buffalo and two cows for milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

Aaisha requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase one buffalo. She is very motivated to provide her children with a respectable life, good education, food, and clothing.  She hopes to increase her production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo

loans.name: Luis Augusto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de fumigación, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos agrícolas y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 28 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province of Lambayeque region in Peru's northern coast. Here the climate is varied and the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and running businesses.

Luis makes a living as a fumigator. He has a close family and has applied for a loan of 1200 Nuevo Soles in order to buy farming supplies and to maintain tools and equipment, and thus provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to maintain tools and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business: soft drinks, juices, purified water, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, laundry soap, bath soap, detergent, bleach, staple foods, flour, oil, instant soups, tomato sauces, snacks, toothbrushes, toothpaste, powdered milk and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora MARIA de 50  años de edad es soltera, tiene  2 hijos  que depende de ella,  radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 12 años  al negocio de venta de tajadas de plátano verde para las pulpería y mercadito además vende tortillas por la mañana, vende frescos, y tiene cría de cerdos, sus clientes le prefieren por su puntualidad en su entrega de los pedidos.
Doña María es una mujer soltera que ha tenido que luchar junto con sus hijos para sacar adelante a la familia, Ella tenía un negocio de pulpería y lo cerro actualmente se dedica a fabricar tajadas de plátano verde, ya que con este  negocio tiene mejores ingresos.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  plátanos verdes, maíz y leña,  que son la materia prima que ella necesita para seguir trabajando en su taller de tajadas de plátano y tortillas, también ella vende cosméticos.
Doña María con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias de esta manera ella tendrá materia prima suficiente para seguir trabajando ya que actualmente está comprando de forma de crédito sus productos.
Doña María su sueño es tener un buen negocio y mejorar su casa para que sus hijos tengan una mejor forma de vivir.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
María, 50 years old, is single and has two children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has her own house, and she has done business for 12 years selling fried plantains to small grocery stores and markets. She also sells tortillas in the mornings, she sells soft drinks, and she raises pigs. Her clients prefer her because she fills orders punctually.

María is a single woman who has had to fight alongside her children to move the family forward. She had a small grocery business, but she closed it, and currently works making fried plantains, as this business gives her a better income.

María is requesting this loan to buy plaintains, corn, and firewood, which are the supplies she needs to continue making fried plantains and tortillas. She also sells cosmetics.With the support from this loan, María will try to improve the conditions of her business and make better profits. This way she will have enough supplies to keep working, as she is currently buying her products on credit.

María's dream is to have a good business and to improve her house so that her children can have a better way of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-- February 2014.

loans.use: to buy plantains, corn, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Blanca Udelia

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 28 años de edad, está acompañada, solo estudió noveno grado por su situación económica, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian, con ella solo viven sus padres y su hermana.

Blanca es sastre,  tiene 4 años elaborando prendas de vestir, aprendió porque se dio la oportunidad mediante un taller de corte y confección y ella aprovechó, es así  como poco a poco ha tomado más experiencia en el área, antes solo se dedicaba a la agricultura junto a su esposo y a los oficios del hogar, el lugar donde tiene sus herramientas le queda a 4 kilómetros y se transporta en bus, su esposo es quien le da el apoyo económico para la materia prima.
  
El crédito solicitado lo necesita para reparar una máquina que no le funciona bien, también comprará materia prima como botones zipper, tela y agujas. 

Ella pretende ampliar  su taller y en un futuro dar trabajo a gente que sabe hacer  el oficio pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo ha podido realizar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 28 years old. She is married and only went to school through the ninth grade due to the financial situation. She has three children and two of them go to school. Her parents and a sister live with her.

Blanca is a seamstress. She has been making clothing for 4 years. She learned how because she had the opportunity to attend a workshop about cutting and sewing. She took advantage of that and little by little she gained experience in the area. Previously, she only worked in agriculture with her husband, and also took care of the home. The place where she keeps her equipment is 4 kilometers away and she gets there in bus. Her husband helps her financially for the materials. 

She has asked for the loan to repair a machine that isn't working well. She will also buy raw materials such as buttons, zippers, fabric and needles. 

She intends to expand her workshop and in the future provide work for people who know the trade, but due to a lack of resources she has been able to do this yet.

loans.use: to repair a machine that isn't working well, as well as buy materials such as buttons, zippers, fabric and needles.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María está muy satisfecha por la ayuda que le ha brindado COMIXMUL en alianza con Kiva, ya que a través del financiamiento brindado pudo comprar insumos como 8 cajas de semilla de papa, 6 quintales de abono, 3 quintales de urea entre otros, que necesitaba para aumentar y darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de papa; por lo que ella expresa que este financiamiento le ha servido enormemente para lograr sus planes. En su primer financiamiento Doña maría obtuvo una cosecha de 75 quintales de primera calidad y 15 quintales de segunda, logrando vender estos a un excelente precio en el mercado a los diferentes intermediarios que ayudar a que esto fuera posible.
Nuevamente Doña María solicita un segundo financiamiento con los fondos Kava con los cuales brindara asistencia y mantenimiento a sus culticos de papa comprando los insumos como 8 cajas de semilla de papa certificada, 10 quintales de abono 12-24-12, 8 quintales de gallinaza, 2 unidades de qurrion, 10 botes de evicet y 8 botes de foliar nutrifet con lo que dará asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de hortalizas.
texts.en:
María is very satisfied with the help that COMIXMUL  has offered her in alliance with Kiva. Through the loan that was given, she was able to buy materials, such as 8 boxes of potato seeds, 6 quintals of fertilizer, 3 quintals of urea, and more. She needed these things to increase and maintain her potato crops. She said that the loan has been very useful for her in achieving her goals. With her first loan, María obtained a harvest of  75 quintales  of the best quality and 15 quintals of the second best quality. She was able to sell them at an excellent price in the market to different intermediaries. It was a big help in making this possible. 

Maria is asking for a second loan with Kiva funds to help and do maintenance on her potato crops by buying materials such as 8 boxes of certified potato seeds, 10 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 8 quintals of chicken manure, 2 units of Qurrion, 10 cans of Evicet and 8 cans of nutrient foliar spray to help and protect her vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy materials to help her potato crops.

loans.name: Tarini Group

texts.en:
Renubala is a married woman of 42 years who lives in a block headquarter called Tarbha of Subarnapur district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the middle of the front line raising her hand is Renubala. She lives with her family comprising four members: her husband, one son, age 15, and one daughter, 10 years old. 

She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead.
 
Renubala has a grocery shop in which she and her husband have sold household items to customers in her locality for the last four years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with limited investment. Gradually, she expanded her business and added some new items every year. 

Now she is earning 7,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scanty to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business.

In the year 2014, Renubala, along with 13 members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan of her group. From this loan she purchased sugar, salt, oil, rice, wheat, shampoo, tea, coffee, ground nuts, pickles, mixture, biscuits, soaps, and other grocery items. Renubala has a long-cherished desire to build a house of her own in her locality.
 
The other members of her group are doing milk businesses, sweets businesses, Xerox center, cycle store, cloth store, pan shop, hotels, tailoring, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, oil, rice, wheat, shampoo, tea, coffee, ground nuts, pickles, mixture, biscuits, and soaps.

loans.name: Majina

texts.en:
