Majina is a rural woman from the village Kothapara in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives there with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son). She is 22 years old and illiterate. Her husband, Tamiz, who is 27 years old and illiterate, is associated with agricultural activities. But they are providing education to their children with great difficulty. They are in grades 2 and 3 respectively.

As her husband's agribusiness is not going well, it is hardly possible for him to meet the family expenses and the educational expenses of their children.  So Majina has extended her helping hand to her husband.  

She is involved in a dairy business. She keeps two cows and makes curd, paneer (cottage cheese) and other milk products. Majina's husband helps her to sell the products in the local market and in the process they get some income. But unfortunately that income is not enough even to give the family a better lifestyle.  She needs to expand her business by purchasing one more cow. More cows means more milk. So she will be able to make more milk products for sale thus make more profit.

Majina has applied a loan from Kiva's partner BJS so that she can purchase one more cow to expand her business. The family hopes that this loan will help them get a higher income and they will be able to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

In future they want to build a concrete house for their own use.

They are grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her diary business.

loans.name: Matina

texts.en:
Matina is 50 years old.  She is married to Kachhimuddin, who is 60 years old. Matina is a housewife and, though illiterate, she can sign her name.  Her husband is completely illiterate.  Their only son is engaged in land cultivation.  They live in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

Matina 's husband is a cycle-van puller.  Cycle-van is a kind of transport that is widely used in remote regions in India.  He carries loads and people in his van, thus earning money for his family expenses.  Sometimes he gives it on hire, which generates additional income. Now the van needs repairing as it got damaged due to an accident.  So it has become impossible for him to meet the basic needs of his family.

Matina heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.  The loan will serve as a complement to the purchase of a new vehicle, which will allow him to strengthen the business and take his customers and carry loads to areas that are not accessible by any other transport. Matina hopes to improve his husband's service, expand his customer base and have better earnings.

Her dream is that her husband continues work in order to support her family financially and purchase an auto rickshaw in future with the profit from this business.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to both Kiva and  BJS for funding them to make their dream true.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for business.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan, who is a 57-year-old married woman from Senaki district, lives with her husband. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live under the poverty line.  

In accordance with the above-mentioned situation, Darejan lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 400 USD to start a trading business. 

Darejan will purchase clothing, linens, and other home products at wholesale prices in the capital and in Turkey, where a wider market is located. She will sell the products locally in her community at an increased price. This credit will be a great support for the family as they will be able to generate income. Darejan is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to live better.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing, linens and other home products.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is a 56-year-old woman. She is from a remote village Khalpara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Her husband, Bimol, age 62 years, is associated with cultivation. Together they raised two daughters who are grown up and work as labourers in a jewelry shop. Both Rekha and her husband have primary education.

To provide the primary income for the family, Rekha's husband does agricultural work. They don't have any land, so he works on hired land. It is very difficult for Rekha's husband to give the basic needs to the family. 

In order to give additional income, Rekha is trying to do something of her own. She has been engaged in animal husbandry for a long time. Now she wants to purchase a cow for expanding her business. She wants to make milk products such as curd, butter, paneer, etc, because these products have great demand in the market. So she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She hopes that this will increase her business to give a decent and financially strong lifestyle to her family. In future, she wants to increase her domestic livestock quantities to get good earnings for their secured future.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her diary business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. Her husband is 41 years old, and by profession he runs his firewood business. Anna has received education up to class IV (grade 4) and her husband up to class V (grade 5). Anna is now a mother of three children who are receiving education. 

Anna has taken money from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products like ghee, paneer, etc. 

Anna dreams that one day her children will be established and will have a bright future. The things that Anna couldn’t have received during her childhood, she dreams to give to her children. For this reason, she has started her own business so that both she and her husband together can go forward with their dreams of making a cattle business with their business profit in the future.

They are really thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling milk and selling and purchasing goats for the past twelve years. She has three goats in milk. She sells milk to her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them a reasonable life. 

She has been working with Kashf for the last four years, and she is happily running her business through support from it. Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase more baby goats so that she can grow them up and sell them in the market. She hopes to have improvements in her business, which ultimately helps in generating more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
Manija is 22 years old. She is married to Jamir, aged 34 years, who is a farmer by profession. They have no children.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made) in Kholaigram in the district Jalpaiguri. They both have primary education. Manija is a housewife. Her husband is associated with an agribusiness. He got involved in farming seasonal vegetables on their own farmland. He has to work hard to give financial assistance to his family. He sells the vegetables in the local market, but he is unable to earn sufficient income for his family.

Day by day their financial condition is going down, although they are striving to meet their basic needs.

Manija wishes to grow jute to generate more income. They have their own land and her husband is experienced in the agricultural field. This is the main reason for choosing this business. Manija knows that this is a profitable business and they will be able to generate more profit.

Manija has taken a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to buy jute seeds and fertilizers for growing jute. She hopes that they can upgrade their living condition by the profit generated from this business.

She aspires to upgrade their kachha house to a concrete house. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing beside her to fight against poverty.

loans.use: To purchase seeds of jute and fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 48 years old and a married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales, purchase and milk selling for the past 20 years. She buys animals at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she requested a loan of Rs.40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shehnaz is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She has successfully completed her first KIVA loan. Now she wants to further grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to cover the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting further increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años habita en una vivienda de tambo de madera, con dos pequeños cuartos. Con el sueño de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, ha luchado por mejorar su casita, hace dos años solicito financiamiento a PANA PANA, con el propósito de construir su cocina de madera. Actualmente solicita su segundo financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra en estado deteriorado, comprar materiales: madera rustica, clavos, zinc, hierro, cemento, arena fina, arena gruesa y cubrir los costos de mano de obra para construir de concreto los postes de base para su vivienda de tambo. Su sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades a su familia, que sus hijos tengan sus propios cuartos, con el propósito de ir reduciendo el hacinamiento, debido a que actualmente habitan 6 personas. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular condición.
texts.en:
Yadira is originally from Waspam. She is 46 years old and has three school-aged children. For around ten years, Yadira has lived in a house build of wood, with two small rooms. With a dream of having her own home and of living in a safe and secure place, Yadira has fought to improve her little house. Two years ago she applied for a loan with "Pana Pana" in order to build her kitchen out of wood. She is now applying for a second loan in order to change the wood on her house, as it has become deteriorated. Yadira will buy materials such as rustic wood, nails, zinc, iron, cement, and fine and thick sands, and will pay labourers to build the foundations for her country house.

Yadira's dream is to have a home that is comfortable for her family. She wants her children to have their own rooms and does not want the house to be overcrowded (it currently has six people living in it). Yadira would like to install a toilet in her house and build septic tank as currently she just has a latrine.

loans.use: to change the wood on her house.

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan’s age is 46; she is married, living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has grown old and stays at home. She owns a small clothing business at home. She purchases clothing from the market at low prices and sells it at a higher price in her community. The ladies of her town like her garment selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now the summer season is going to start, and she wants to buy summer season clothing for reselling purposes. But she does not have cash in hand due to household expenses. This is the reason, she has requested a loan so she can buy clothes for the summer season to fill the demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy summer season clothing for resale.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Mrs. Irshad is a 36-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a milk selling business with the help of her husband. The man in the picture is Irshad's husband. He sells milk on a bike to their customers in nearby communities. She sells milk and yogurt to the people of her neighborhood. 

Over time, Irshad has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Irshad is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase more pots and drums for milk for her business, along with some utensils such as bowls and bottles. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pots and drums for milk storage

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married and has children who attend school. She operates a poultry selling business, which she has been doing for over four years. She faces the challenge of disease outbreak causing losses. 

Rukia requested a loan from Yehu for 25,000 KES, which she will use to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 40-year-old, married woman and mother of five children. She is successfully running a food stall in her community, with her husband. They work selling fruit 'chat' (salads) in a stall located at the corner of a popular street in their town. She is helping her husband and contributing to the family income through all her hard work. 

Razia has been in association with Kashf Foundation for nine years now. She has successfully completed her first KIVA loan and now, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of apples and guavas, together with tins of pineapple. She has also planned to start offering a new product called Gol Gappa that is a popular street food in Pakistan.  It consists of a round, hollow puri (bread), fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), tamarind chutney, chili, 'chaat masala', potato, onion and chickpeas. It is generally small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. She is hoping to get a boost in their net income, and she aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of apples and guavas, as well as tins of pineapple

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing agricultural work for many years with her husband. They grow different vegetables and food items and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, fertilizer as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides, Nazia applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and fertilizer, as well as  packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en:
Tariro is 23 years old and resides in Mbire District in Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Learner Guide in schools, teaching students life skills as a part of their education. The Learner Guides program is run by Camfed and supports children’s academic achievement. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary, which she has been doing for eight months. She employs one person. Tariro inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur.

Tariro requested a loan, which she will use to expand her business by increasing her supplies. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is a mother of five sons. Her eldest son and her second one are migrant workers in a neighboring country. They left their mother with the hope of finding well paid jobs and financially sustaining their family.

Gyulnara and her other three sons are villagers. They run a farm which includes two cows, pigs and piglets, as well as a plot of land where corn and potatoes are cultivated.

Gyulnara is a very hardworking woman who has faced many difficulties in raising her five sons alone. She has now applied for this loan of USD 1000, asking financial support from Kiva lenders. The loan will greatly assist her to purchase two more calves for her farm. Gyulnara has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves for her farm

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando en la escuela del mismo caserío, por el momento solo él y su familia viven en su casa, solo sus 3 hijos y su esposa dependen de él.

Él trabaja en una finca que está cerca del lugar de residencia, tiene 8 años de trabajar en esta finca realizando podas, aporco, fertilización, y corta de café, cuando él estaba pequeño sus padres lo llevaban al campo, y como se acostumbró a ir a la finca decidió dedicarse desde muy joven a esta actividad .  
Con el paso del tiempo decidió acompañarse, por el momento es la única actividad productiva que tiene, el lugar donde trabaja le queda  a 2 km de distancia y para llegar se transporta a pie, el horario de trabajo es de 6:30 AM a 1:00 PM.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar 3,500 tejas porque va cambiar las que tiene actualmente su casa, 400 varas de tusa, 15 libras de clavos de diferentes medidas y el resto para pagar la mano de obra, también pagara el transporte de la teja.

El sueño de José es ver su casa terminada, vivir más cómodo, tener mejor salud, también pretende ampliarla haciéndole un cuarto más en la parte trasera para tener más espacio para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and completed up to fifth grade. He is married; his wife is a housewife. The couple has three children all of whom are attending school in the same hamlet. For the moment it is just José and his family living in the house. José's only dependents are his wife and three children.

José has been working on a farm for eight years. There he prunes crops, lays earth and fertilisers and cuts the coffee. As a child, José's parents took him to the field and, as he became accustomed to working in the field, he decided at a young age to make this his work.

As time went by, José decided to marry. His farm job is his only work; the farm is two kilometres from his house and he arrives there on foot. José works from 6.30 a.m. until 1 p.m.

José is applying for this loan in order to buy 2500 tiles, as he wants to replace the tiles on his house. He will also buy 400 corn husks and 15 lbs of different-sized nails; the rest of the loan will be used to labourers and for the transportation of the tiles.

José's dream is to finish building his house, to live more comfortably and to have better health. José also plans to expand his home by adding another room at the back. This will give the family more space.

loans.use: to buy 3500 tiles, 400 corn husks and 15 lbs of different-sized nails; the rest of the loan will be used to labourers and for the transportation of the tiles.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Ms. Shareefan is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. The man shown in the picture is her husband. She has been doing agricultural work with the help of her husband for many years. They grow wheat, vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. 

Shareefan has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase seeds, fertilizer and packs of insecticides and pesticides, She applied for a loan of Rs. 45000. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Ms. Kalsoom is 45 years old and a married woman; she has been running a business of animals sales and purchase for many years with the help of her husband. She buys animals (calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them later on. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more calves. She has been working with Kashf Foundation for the last three years with very good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: To purchase more calves

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is a 45-year-old, married woman. for the past 18 years, she has been doing a business of vegetable-selling and running a general store, with the help of her husband. The man shown in the picture is her husband. 

Shagufta is very enthusiastic in her business of selling fruits and general store products and she manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, health, and education and she is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase stocks of vegetables and products for the general store (e.g., rice, packs of salt, biscuits). This will help her to consistently meet market demands.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables and products for her general store (e.g., rice, packs of salt, biscuits).

loans.name: Taizivei

texts.en:
Taizivei is 20 years old. She resides in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. Taizivei has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Taizivei rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for eighteen months now and it has enabled her to support her family. 
 
With the Kiva loan, Taizivei will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more bags and clothes

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old woman living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her hometown is a very populated area. 

Mostly, people like to chew betel leaf, so a few years ago her husband decided to open a paan shop to offer kinds of betel leaves to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaves such as sweet paan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves) and various spices, and tobacco paan, which consists of powdered tobacco. 

He is an expert in preparing paan because he has been running this shop for many years, and a lot of customers like to take betel leaves that are prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. 

Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner.

loans.use: to buy a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices and tobacco for the paan shop.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is 22 years old and resides in Mbire District, Zimbabwe. Loveness actively supports the community clinic by volunteering as a janitor. Loveness also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools working to improve the well-being of students. In addition, Loveness rents a small stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts, which she has been doing for one year. It has enabled her to support her family.  

Loveness requested a loan, which she will use to improve her sales by increasing and diversifying her inventory. Her hope is to expand the business and open her own store. This loan will bring stability to Loveness’ business and will enable her to secure her a further education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase a wider range of products for her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, fufu, and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 21-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe.

For the last five months, she has successfully operated a business to buy and sell clothing. Memory decided to start this business as a way to support herself. 

When she is not working, she serves as a member of Cama, a network of Camfed alumnae who strive to make their communities better places to live. Memory also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer at local schools. With the requested Kiva loan, Memory will make bulk purchases of clothes and boost her sales volume and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment in her community, and support her siblings in their educational pursuits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to boost her sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and baking powder for her business. 

She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil,sugar, and baking powder for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Nourish

texts.en: Nourish is a 20-year-old entrepreneur living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. As a way to provide for her younger siblings, Nourish started her own supply business, buying and selling clothing seven months ago. Nourish is also very involved in giving back to her community and volunteers at a local school as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. This Kiva loan will enable her to make bulk purchases of clothes and boost her sales. Nourish hopes a more profitable business will allow her to hire employees as well as provide for her siblings.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothes and boost her sales.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 19-year-old single woman living in Mbire District of Zimbabwe. 

Rumbidzai is passionate about helping to empower young women in her community. As an entrepreneur, she rents a shop at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets. She has run the business for 18 months and during that time it has enabled her to improve her standard of living. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand. 

Rumbidzai will use the Kiva loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her standard of living and create employment in her community. Her dream is to one day be successful enough to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Kapan town with her two sons. She is a divorced woman and is an army officer. 

To tackle financial hardships, Anna is also involved in beekeeping. She keeps 20 colonies of bees and gets high quality honey. Her sons sell the honey in the nearby open market. 

Anna has applied for 3,000 USD to purchase 17 more colonies of bees and enlarge the honey production. Anna has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that the beekeeping is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anna has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products

loans.use: to purchase 17 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed  is a 51-year-old married woman who has sold milk for the past 20 years. She has 2 cows and 5 goats. She sells milk and butter to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough to provide a decent life. She has two children and she is very motivated to provide them a reasonable life.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses. This is her 4th year with Kashf Foundation and she happily runs her business with the support of the loan. 

She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She hopes to increase her production capacity which will ultimately help to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 41-year-old hardworking married lady. She has run a business to grind chili for many years. She has a good customer base and is able to earn enough money.

Jamila requests 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy bulk quantities of chili  for customers and expand her inventory. Jamila expects an increase in her earnings and she plans to spend part of her profits to benefit her family members.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of chili.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a widowed woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
She has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 36-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small crockery store, in which he sells plastic utensils and crockery items, such as plates, platters, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs, cauldrons, and buckets. 

Samina's husband wants to buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities for collecting dowry. For this is reason, more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy plastic utensils and crockery items and generate additional income, to cherish his family in better way. 

Samina is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils and crockery for her husband's business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 22 years old and from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe where she has been operating her own businesss buying and selling clothes and sugar for the past ten months. She ventured into business so that she could look after herself and help raise the standard of living for her family. During her spare time Alice volunteers as a Cama member, a network of Camfed alumnae who reinvest in their communities.  As a Cama member, she volunteers as a peer educator in schools within the community. With the requested Kiva loan, Alice intends to buy more sugar and clothes. With the additional profits, she will provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Enert

texts.en: Enert is a 21-year-old business woman living in Mbire, a district in Zimbabwe. To give back to the community, Enert provides counseling services at a local community center to young people facing challenges.  She also volunteers at the local clinic as a janitor. Enert also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. She has been running her business for a year and has managed to employ two people during that time as well as provide for her family. Enert will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking lady who strives hard to meet the needs of her family.  She appreciates  the support from Yehu and Kiva.

She requests 50,000 KES to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requests a loan for her husband’s grocery business. He has sold fresh seasonal vegetables in his hometown for many years. He uses a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. He has opened a shop to sell vegetables but does not have enough cash to buy an initial inventory to efficiently run his shop.
 
His young children are growing and their needs include a rapid increase in school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses. 

He wants to establish his business but he does not have enough cash to buy bulk quantities of vegetables.

Therefore, Asma requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan fo her husband to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 22-year-old single businesswoman who lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe.  She successfully operates a business to sell clothing to people of all ages. 

Ten months ago, she was inspired by her sister and other Cama members, to become an entrepreneur  in order to look after herself and financially assist her parents and siblings. 

During her spare time, Patricia volunteers as a Cama member and disseminates health information to community schools. With the requested Kiva loan, Patricia will buy more clothes, blankets, and shoes for people of all ages so she can increase her sales and profits. With the additional profits, she intends to provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets, and shoes for all age groups so that she can increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
This is Fatuma. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support for her previous loan. Besides the water selling business, Fatuma operates a fruits and vegetables stall.

She is requesting a loan to purchase coconuts, tomatoes, potatoes and vegetables for her business. 

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts, tomatoes, potatoes and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciated her previous loan as it improved her living standards, enabling her to expand her business and earn a higher income.
She would like to apply for a loan to buy more video movies for her mini-cinema business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more video movies for her mini-cinema

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine lives in Hayanist village with her mother and retired grandparents. Zarine has taught at a local school for a couple of years. She also helps her grandparents run the family farm. 

Zarine requests 2,000 USD to be able to improve their farm. The loan will be used to renovate the greenhouse and purchase fertilizer and tomato seeds. 

This is Zarine's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse andpurchase fertilizer and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Moline

texts.en:
Moline is a 23-year-old mother of two. She currently lives in Mbire District of Zimbabwe. 

For the past three years, Moline has successfully operated a grocery shop at the local business center where she sells sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour. She started the business to raise school fees for her young sisters and provide for her family. 

Moline will purchase bulk quantities of sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour to increase her stock and improve profits. An increase in profits will enable Moline to add more shelves to her shop and provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a divorced woman with three children who attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Halima has operated a business selling clothes for the past year. She sells in a shop to her community, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 21-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe, where she successfully operates a general store, selling washing soap, petroleum jellies, sanitary pads and exercise books. When she started her business eleven months ago, Ruth was encouraged by her cousin and other Cama members, who she saw as successful entrepreneurs in her community. Ruth runs her business in order to financially provide for herself, parents and siblings. 
During her spare time, Ruth volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools within her community. With the requested Kiva loan, Ruth will buy more supplies for her shop, which will help to boost profits so she can provide for her family

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Tsungirirayi

texts.en:
Tsungirirayi is a 20-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe, where she successfully operates a shop, selling snacks and sweets. She started her business a year and a half ago because of the positive encouragement from her friends. When she is not working in her business, Tsungirirayi serves as a Cama member, volunteering to work in schools within the community. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Tsungirirayi will make bulk purchases of the snacks and sweets, which will help her to boost her sales volume and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment in her community, and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and sweets, which will help her to boost her sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Hadie

texts.en:
Hadie appreciates the previous loans which helped her increase her cafe's profits.

She requests another loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables for sale.

Hadie thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Asanet

texts.en:
Asanet lives with her husband in Zovasar village. The couple has been engaged in agriculture for many years. They also raise livestock (cow, two calves, 15 sheep, two pigs and 25 piglets). 

The farm also includes 15 colonies of bees and a plot of land where potato and grass are cultivated.  Both Asanet and her husband are very hardworking farmers. 

Asanet has applied for this loan of $1500 to purchase agricultural machinery for their farm.  It is very important for Asanet and her husband to have a collector to make their work more effective.

As this is Asanet's first loan, this "first-chance" loan provides assistance to people like Asanet who don’t have access to credit because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Diloramhan

texts.ru: Дилорамхон 67 лет, вдова, имеет пятерых детей. После смерти супруга, Дилорамхон очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Дилорамхон решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Разведением скота занимается уже более 30 лет, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря ее трудолюбию и стараниям на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 18,000 сомов (KGS). В хозяйстве у Дилорамхон имеется 5 дойных коров. Также она имеет 0,38 Га земли, в основном выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Дилорамхон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, она планирует купить коров для дальнейшего разведения. Прибыль от разведения скота направит на строительство нового жилого дома, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Diloramhan is 67 years old, a widow, and has five children. After the death of her husband, Diloramhan was unable to get over the loss of her loved one for a very long time. Needing to raise her children and get them on their feet, Diloramhan decided to take her household and financial responsibilities into her own hands. She has been raising cattle for more than 30 years. She started this business with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and commitment, she currently receives a monthly income of 18,000 som (KGS). Diloramhan has 5 milk cows on her farm. She also has a 0.38 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows potatoes and corn. For the purpose of increasing her herd, Diloramhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to raise and breed in the future. Diloramhan plans to use the earnings from the cattle for to build a new house as well as to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives with her husband, son, and his family. Her son has three children and is a constructor by profession. Mariam's husband and son used to migrate and work in a neighboring country, but now they try to work locally. 

Mariam has been running her farm for five years. She keeps two cows, 10 sheep, and 10 chickens. Mariam also cultivates potatoes for family use only.

Mariam requested a loan for $1,500, which she will use to enlarge her livestock by purchasing two cows. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, she was not able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Mariam has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: María Brígida

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado debido a que era de escasos recursos económicos, ella está acompañada y su esposo trabaja en una venta de repuestos , tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, sus ingresos provienen de su espos y de una pensión que recibe del gobierno.

  El crédito lo necesita para comprar 30 pliegos de lámina y un flete de madera (cuartón) y el resto lo invertirá en el pago de mano de obra.

El crédito ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida  ya que  tendrá más seguridad, mejorando su techo vivirá más segura junto a sus hijos.

   Ella pretende comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego sacarlos a la venta, también quiere remodelar el área de cocina ya que no es del todo segura, lo van a lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación  y con la ayuda de un crédito que pueda  otorgarle la institución.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and studied only until fourth grade due to scarce economic resources. She has a husband and he works selling spare parts. She has 2 children who are studying. She is a homemaker. Their income comes from her husband and from a government pension.

She needs the loan to purchase 30 sheets of laminate and a load of wood (planks) and the rest she will invest in the payment for manual labour. The loan will help to improve their quality of life as they will have more security, improving the roof they will live safely with their children.

She plans on purchasing pigs to fatten and later sell them, as well she wants to remodel the kitchen as it’s not safe. They are going to do it with effort and dedication and with the help of the loan that the institution can grant them.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sheets of laminate and a load of wood (planks) and the rest she will invest in the payment for manual labour.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, y trabaja como vendedor en una pequeña empresa de venta de autos, Luis trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con los ingresos de su trabajo, puede salir adelante. 

Luis esta agradecido con el apoyo que le están otorgando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar alguno materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en la habitación donde vive, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Asimismo Luis comenta que desea seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un auto”.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man. He lives in the city of Ica and works as a salesman in a small car dealership. Luis works around 9 hours per day and with his income he can come out ahead. 

Luis is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders. Thanks to them he is able to buy construction materials to make improvements to the room he lives in and this way he can improve his quality of life. In addition, Luis says that he wishes to continue working and striving to be able to realize his biggest dream “to have a car”.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
This is the 37 year-old Shpresa or ‘Hope’ in English.  She wants to buy a replacement part for her husband's tractor, that he uses it to make his own income.

Shpresa does horticulture and sells the products to wholesale buyers.  She’s got plenty of cherry and apple orchards and grapevines.  As for livestock, Shpresa has one dairy cow with a calf and she sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm.

Shpresa is a married mother of three children, ages 14, 10 and 5.  They live in a hilly village with a very cold climate that is  and not very supportive of agriculture.  However, villagers find their own ways to plant veggies and other crops to cover for their basic needs.  Cows, sheep and goats are the preferred animals of almost every villager.

loans.use: to buy replacement part for her husband's tractor.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado en la escuela, está acompañada junto y ha procreado 3 hijos, actualmente dos de ellos estudian, su esposo trabaja en el destacamento militar y Marta solo viven sus hijos y esposo.
     
Ella se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, su esposo es quien le ayuda con los gastos y con la alimentación de sus niños, pero Marta siempre ha mantenido cerdos en su hogar, los cuida, los engorda y luego los vende. Desde hace 3 años realiza esta actividad, aprendió ya que sus padres compraban antes y hacían la misma actividad fue así que un día le dijo a su esposo que sacaría un crédito para iniciar. Por el momento no tiene otra actividad que le genere ingresos, antes solo ha sido domestica ayudando a sus padres y luego a su esposo. 

El crédito lo solicita para comprar tres cerdos y tres quintales de concentrado para nutrirlos bien, y el resto lo utilizará para cancelar parte de un crédito que tiene en CrediCampo.

 En un futuro pretende hacer formalmente la galera de los cerdos ya que puede darle un mejor mantenimiento porque cuenta con suficiente agua. También junto a su esposo pretenden comprar una vaca para que haya  alimentación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 27 years old and studied until first grade. She has a partner and together they have 3 children, two of whom are currently studying. Her husband is in a military unit and Marta lives with her children and husband.

Her work is taking care of her children. Her husband is the one who helps with the household expenses and for the food for the children. Marta has always maintained pigs at her house, she takes care of them, fattens them, and later sells them. For 3 years she has done this activity. She learned it from her parents who purchased pigs and did the same activity and it was one day that she said to her husband that she would take out a loan to start.  At the moment she doesn’t have any other activity that generates an income. Before she only did domestic work helping her parents and later her husband. 

The loan she is requesting is to purchase three pigs and three quintal (300 lbs.) of concentrate to feed them well and the rest she will use to pay off part of her loan with CrediCampo.

In the future she plans on making a galley for the pigs as it can give them better maintenance because it has enough water. Also with her husband she plans to purchase a cow so they have food for their children.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and three quintal (300 lbs.) of concentrate to feed them well and the rest she will use to pay off part of her loan with CrediCampo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools like macanas (clubs) machetes, cumas (curved machete) and rubber boots and also 2 quintals of sugar and 1 of rice.

loans.name: Pronah

texts.en:
Pronah is a 24 year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. 

Pronah sells bath towels and plastic sandals to men, women and children.  She started her business five months ago.

Pronah was encouraged by other Cama members to venture into business, so that she can look after herself and help raise her family out of poverty. 

During her spare time, Pronah volunteers as a Cama member in schools within her community. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Pronah will buy plastic sandals and bath towels.  Pronah hopes to increase her sales volume and profits. 

With the additional profits, Pronah hopes to provide basic necessities for herself and her siblings, expand her business and create an employment opportunity in her community.

loans.use: to buy plastic sandals and bath towels.

loans.name: Laizar

texts.en:
Laizar is an 18 year-old businesswoman.  She is married with one child and live in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe.  

Laizar has been selling sugar, washing soap and matches for five months.  She was encouraged by other Cama members to begin a business so that she can look after herself and her family.  Her husband is unemployed. 

During her spare time, Laizar volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in local schools. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Laizar will buy wash soap, sugar and matches. 

With the additional profits, Laizar will provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy wash soap, sugar and matches.

loans.name: Reynoldo Manrique

texts.es:
Reynoldo es un joven trabajador de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo  grado, cuando sus padres ya no podían ayudarle decidió mejor trabajar y no estudiar. Él está soltero sin compromiso alguno, no tiene hijos , con él vive con su padre y su madre y una hermana, ninguna persona depende de él.

Él se dedica a trabajar en una finca de café, cuando no hay café que cortar se mantiene podando, fertilizando, por el momento están arando para sembrar más café, lleva ya dos años de dedicarse a este trabajo que aprendió de sus padres quienes desde pequeño lo enseñaron a realizar estas labores agrícolas tan importantes, por no tener otra fuente de ingreso más estable se ha dedicado a esta actividad, el lugar de trabajo le queda a media hora d su casa, para transportarse lo hace a pie.

Él solicita el préstamo para pagar la mano de obra para sus trabajos agrícolas.

   Su sueño es un día ver terminada su casa, que sus padres vivan muy felices y que puedan tener seguridad de estar bajo un techo más confiable, también pretende formar una familia y trabajar para poder mantenerla.
texts.en:
Reynoldo is a young 22 year old worker who studied until Grade 7. His parents couldn't afford to support him any more and he decided to go to work. He is single and has no children. He lives with his father and mother and a sister. No one is dependent on him.

He works on his coffee farm. When there is no coffee to harvest he works pruning and fertilizing. At the moment he is plowing for planting more coffee. He has been dong this work for two years. He learned this work from his parents who taught him many important agricultural tasks. As he had no other source of income he decided to do this work. The place where he works is 30 minutes from his house and he walks there.

Reynoldo is requesting a loan to pay for labor for his agricultural work. His dream is to some day finish his house so that his parents live happily and have the security of living under a solid roof. He also wants to have a family and work to support them.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat (in photo) is 53 years old, has been married since 1981 and has eight children. Two of her children are married and lives separately; other two are cleaners for a company and other two work for a NGO and other two attend school. 
Nat stays at home and does housework. Main source of income is from her children and husband’s salary. Her husband is a construction contractor. 
Nat’s husband wants to purchase construction materials, it would be better for him to work. Hence Nat decided apply for a loan to help purchasing her husband. 
Nat’s family is living in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora  María Virginia de 52  años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus tres nietos y su hijo mayor en su propia casa, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de pollo, carnes, embutidos, churros, frescos, detergentes, granos básicos, su venta es con los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan, su negocio está ubicado en una buena zona de comercio, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería en general, como ser: harina, manteca, huevos, frescos, maseca, etc., con el apoyo del préstamo ella mejorar su calidad de vida ya que tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y así tendrá más ganancias.
Doña María sueña con mejorar su casa para que sus nietos tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
María Virginia is 52 years old and a single mother who lives with three grandchildren and her oldest son in their own house. For the past 6 years she has sold chicken, meat, sausages, churros, soft drinks, detergents and basic grains. Her sales are to friends and people who come visit her daily. Her business is located in a good commercial area.

She is very content to continue to work with Prisma and Kiva. María is requesting a loan to buy groceries like flour, lard, eggs, drinks, corn flour, etc. With the loan she can improve the quality of her life and have more products to offer her clients thus making more profit. She dreams of improving her house so that her grandchildren have better living conditions.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2014.

loans.use: to buy groceries like flour, lard, eggs, drinks, corn flour, etc.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuỷ operates a business fishing. Thuỷ is 46 years old and married with three children. Two of them are grown up, so Thuỷ lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2014, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. This is Thuỷ's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thuỷ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Hòa is 43 years old and she is married with two children. Hòa lives with in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Hòa operates a fishing business. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2014, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. This is Hòa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hòa faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor’s latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Hòa hopes that her children will find good jobs, to buy land of her own, and to make enough money to provide for her kids with her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. Xuân is 32 years old. She is married and has four children. Xuân lives with her four dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

Xuân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a business fishing.

Minh is 42 years old and she is married with two children.
Minh lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Minh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Minh hopes to build a new house, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.
